Gauteng, incidentally, is one of the provinces that has recorded a coronavirus case.On being asked if the recent travel advisory has impacted the schedule, SVF co-founder and director Mahendra Soni said, “Things are on track now. We have not received any travel advisory regarding Indians returning from South Africa. If the government issues any advisory, we will definitely abide by that.”On March 3, guitarist Pt Debashish Bhattacharya left for Istanbul and then Budapest . The situation changed when he reached Warsaw, where he had concerts on March 13, 14, 19 and 21. Three of them were in Poland and one in Denmark. “All four got cancelled in the last 48 hours despite me having arrived hale and hearty and ready to perform. For a self-employed musician, nothing can be more frustrating than these cancellations,” he said. Now, he is burning a hole in his pocket while trying to get return tickets. “I am up since dawn trying to get fresh return tickets that avoid the countries which have been mentioned in the travel advisory from Indian government,” the guitarist added.Percussionist Pt Tanmoy Bose has been luckier since he has not faced any show cancellation in Australia or New Zealand as yet. “I read reports of Tom Hanks and Rita Wilson having tested positive for coronavirus. I’ve finished my tour of Adelaide and Melbourne, but these reports are worrying,” said Bose, adding, “If I have to be quarantined, it will upset my schedule.”Equally worried is Bhattacharya, who shudders to think what will happen if he has to go through a quarantine period in Kolkata. “I have already booked a studio for recording of the first audio album of my new creation — the Pushpa Veena. The mixing deadline is March 24. If I am kept in quarantine, it will be a huge loss for me,” Bhattacharya signed off.

Title: Mask hoarding: Enforcement Branch raids on medical shops continue in West Bengal
Content: KOLKATA: The Enforcement Branch continued its raids against hoarding and selling of masks for the second day on Thursday. Officers spent the entire day at medical shops in Mukundapur, Purba Jadavpur and Panchasayar, where a number of private hospitals are located.“We sensitized the shopkeepers not to charge high. Masks are again in demand given the sudden spurt in patients across the nation and the new school session beginning in two weeks,” said an officer. DC (EB) Biswajit Ghosh said, “We have told the shop owners to maintain accounts. They have been sensitized adequately.”After instructions from CM Mamata Banerjee, EB officers began raiding medical shops and wholesale distributors last Saturday. “While non-N-95 masks are priced at Rs 20-Rs 50, we found several shops charging as high as Rs 80-Rs 120. Now, the prices have stabilized a bit,” said a source. However, in most shops, the masks were simply unavailable. “Covid-19 has almost become a consumer demand generator,” said an officer.

Title: Bihar: Heavy vehicle ban on J P Setu hits truckers
Content:
Several complaints regarding the ban on J P Setu have been received

PATNA: With the ban on movement of heavy vehicles on J P Setu , trucks and tractors have no other option but to use Veer Kunwar Singh bridge via Sahar bridge on Sone river in Bhojpur district to reach Hajipur.

Bihar Truck Owners’ Association (BTOA) president Bhanu Shekhar Prasad Singh said the ban has just increased the distance manifold. “Earlier, the trucks used to travel 10km for reaching Hajipur. However, after the ban, they are covering a distance of 150km from Patna via Arwal and Ara to reach Hajipur. Trucks that hardly took few hours to reach north Bihar are now taking seven to 10 days,” he said.

Singh added that the ban has severely hit transport of sand, stone aggregates and other materials. “Movement of heavy vehicles is already not allowed on Koilwar bridge, Mahatma Gandhi Setu and Rajendra Setu. As a result, prices of sand, stone aggregates and other construction materials have surged,” he said.

Singh said the association has urged the government to allow movement of all types of heavy vehicles on J P Setu and six-wheeled vehicles on Gandhi Setu.

Divisional commissioner Sanjay Kumar Agarwal said the decision to ban movement of heavy vehicles on J P Setu was taken a fortnight ago after general manager of East Central Railway (ECR), Hajipur division, suggested the state government to take precautionary measures for the safety of the bridge between Digha and Pahleja in Sonepur.

“The ban is temporary and we will find a permanent solution soon. A committee comprising engineers of road construction department has been formed to examine the strength of the bridge. After this, a meeting will be held with the ECR and RCD engineers for a final decision,” Agarwal, who is also the managing director of Bihar Road Construction Department Limited (BSRDCL), said.

Meanwhile, a senior RCD engineer said the department has received several complaints from transporters regarding the ban on J P Setu. “The bridge was constructed to carry all kinds of heavy vehicles. It comes under the A1 class, which has the highest loading capacity,” he said.

Title: 73 illegal structures removed in Patna
Content:
The drive to remove encroachments from major drains was re-launched on the instruction of Patna divisional com... Read More

PATNA: Around 73 illegal structures and hutments were removed from Bahadurpur housing colony and Yogipur Nala in Kankerbagh circle in Thursday as part of the anti-encroachment drive launched jointly by the district administration and Patna Municipal Corporation (PMC).

The drive to remove encroachments from major drains was re-launched on the instruction of Patna divisional commissioner Sanjay Kumar Agarwal and DM Kumar Ravi. The drive will continue till March 21.

The DM said two teams comprising officials of PMC, executive officers, ward councillors and security personnel have been formed. The first team is led by deputy collector of land reforms, Patna sadar and the second team by the deputy collector of land reforms, Masaurhi.

“The number of teams will be increased as per the requirement. The teams will remove illegal structures and encroachments from big drains in Patna, including Yogipur Nala, Saidpur Nala and Badhshai Nala among others,” he said.

On Thursday, illegal structures, including concrete and hutments were removed from Saidpur Nala, Rampur Road and Sai Chowk Nahar. The PMC officials realised around Rs 1,500 as fine from shops and seized three carts carrying construction materials.

Title: Work boycott: General-OBC employees strike intensifies, take out torch procession
Content:
Dehradun: In no mood to relent from their stand, thousands of members of the Uttarakhand General-OBC employees ’ association continued with their indefinite work boycott on Thursday, seeking removal of a provision which provides for SC/ST quota promotions in government jobs.

The protesters, who have been on work boycott since March 2, also took out a mashaal (fire-torch) procession from Parade Ground to the state secretariat.

A letter written by chief secretary Utpal Kumar Singh on Wednesday asking them to return to work citing coronavirus threat and the need to be adequately prepared failed to make any impact on the protesters, who claimed, “The protest will only be called off after a government order is issued on our demand.”

The members of diploma pharmacists association, Uttarakhand nurses services association, X-ray technicians, lab technicians and other Class IV staff of various hospitals also extended their support to the protest by boycotting work for two hours on Thursday.

All these organisations claimed that they would go on a complete work boycott from March 16.

“Our demand or rather request is simple: The state government needs to follow the Supreme Court order on reservation in promotion,” president of Uttarakhand General-OBC employees’ association Deepak Joshi told TOI.

He said the protest would continue until the government heeds to their request.

The association wants the government to comply with the apex court’s February 7 order which said the states are not bound to provide reservation in promotions and reservation is not a fundamental right.

The SC judgment came in response to a special leave petition filed by the Uttarakhand government seeking stay on the state high court order which asked the government to fill up government posts by providing reservation in promotion.

Meanwhile, the protesters also visited the government departments on Thursday and ensured that the employees remain off work. A few instances were reported where some employees, who were found working, were reportedly harassed and forced to leave the office premises and join the protest.

The General-OBC employees’ association furthersaid its members would visit locations near their homes to spread a “general awareness campaign” on March 14 and 15. The association said a motorcycle rally would be taken out in all districts on March 15 as well.

Further, all general and OBC employees have also been directed by the association to take their family members and relatives to the protest site on March 17.

“Our aim is not to cause disturbance, but we have no choice but to hold these protests to make our voices heard,” Virendra Gosain, the general secretary of the association said.

Title: Karanam quits TDP as son joins YSRC
Content:
Ongole: The TDP suffered a setback yet again on Thursday, this time in Prakasam district, after veteran legislator Karanam Balaram quit the party. Balaram met chief minister and YSRC supremo YS Jaganmohan Reddy at the latter’s residence on Wednesday.

Although, Balaram has not officially joined YSRC, keeping in view of Jaganmohan Reddy’s policy of not admitting legislators from other parties without them resigning their posts, Balaram’s son Venkatesh, however has joined YSRC.

Energy minister Balineni Srinivasa Reddy, TDP rebel legislator Vallabhaneni Vamsi of Gannavaram constituency escorted Balaram and his followers to the chief minister. Venkatesh said they have decided to join the YSRC after seeing the overwhelming mandate of people for the chief minister’s welfare activities. He said the chief minister’s vision to equally develop all regions has also been well- received by the people and they would work to strengthen YSRC in the district.

Balaram’s resignation is a big jolt to the TDP, particularly with the local body elections coming up.

Title: Extend deadline to file poll nomination, Naidu tells SEC
Content:
Vijayawada: TDP supremo N Chandrababu Naidu on Thursday asked the State Election Commission to extend the deadline for the submission of nomination papers to contest local body elections. The former chief minister wrote a letter to the State Election Commission justifying his demand and listing the number of incidents of violence reported across the state.

Naidu claimed YSRC leaders had resorted to violence at several places to prevent others from filing nominations. He wrote that the ruling party’s workers had at several places physically assaulted opposition candidates and snatched their nomination papers. He also alleged that the police were hand-in-glove with ruling party leaders.

The TDP chief further said that in some places, officials were not available to issue nativity certificate for candidates to file nominations.

Naidu wrote that violent incidents were reported at 76 places across the state ahead of mandal parishad and zilla parishad elections. The local police responded only to complaints filed by the ruling party and turned a blind eye to complaints from opposition parties, he alleged.

Violence was reported in Pulivendula, Punganuru, Macherla, Mantralayam and other places in the state. He sent a consolidated statement of incidence of violence reported from across the state and requested the State Election Commission to take necessary action against ruling party workers.

He also demanded that action be taken against police personnel who aided ruling party leaders in several places and prevented opposition party candidates from filing nominations. He requested the State Election Commission to issue fresh notification in all the places including Pulivendula and Macharla where incidents of serious violence were reported.

Title: Serial killer who had jumped parole a year ago nabbed
Content:
Rajkot: A serial killer who was absconding for the past one year after jumping parole was nabbed from 80 ft Road in Rajkot on Thursday.

Police said the convict Nilay Mehta (40) was involved in as many as six murders and sentenced to life imprisonment in two cases.

On February 22 last year, Mehta was released on parole from Rajkot Central Jail and went absconding. After jumping the parole, Mehta had gone to Ahmedabad where he had committed a loot in Amraiwadi area, after which he had fled to Uttar Pradesh, where he worked as a labourer in Kumbh Mela in Allahabad. From Allahabad, Mehta had gone to Lucknow, and from there he had returned to Rajkot.

“The moment we learnt about Mehta’s presence in Rajkot, we activated our informers, found out about his whereabouts on 80-Feet Road and nabbed him,” said Rajkot police commissioner Manoj Agarwal.

“We suspect that Mehta had returned to Rajkot to commit some big crime. It is suspected that Mehta had taken ‘supari’ (contract) to kill someone for which he had come to the city,” said Agarwal.

Agrawal said that the police would produce Mehta before the chief judicial magistrate court in Rajkot to seek his remand. “During his remand, we intend to find out his motive to visit Rajkot,” he added.

Apart from the murders, Mehta also faces charges ranging from robberies, thefts to physical assault.

HID TWO BLADES UNDER CHEEKS

Like the character of ‘Perpendicular’ from the famous Bollywood crime caper ‘Gangs of Wasseypur II’, Mehta would keep two pieces of one blade in his mouth — one each under both his cheeks. He would take out the piece of the blade and cut the throat of his victim. However, most of the murders he had committed with knives. After his arrest, the police found the pieces of blade from his mouth. While his first murder was out of personal enmity, the other five murders were committed for loot. Surprisingly, he never suffered any injury due to the blades in the mouth.

Title: Two booked for firing in air from air gun
Content:
Police question the people who had witnessed the alleged crime

Rajkot: Two persons were booked for threatening a youth by firing from an air gun in Maheshweri Nagar locality of Jamnagar on Wednesday night.

Police said the accused, identified as Karan Zala and Piyush, had fired from the air gun in the air to scare and threaten Kunal Makwana.

“Makwana had a long pending dispute with Zala over a trivial issue. On the night of the crime, Zala had called up Makwana and hurled abuses at him. After a heated exchange of words, Zala and Piyush arrived and opened fire in the air,” said an official from Jamnagar B division police station.

Title: With Rs breaching 74, RBI offers $ for desi currency
Content: Mumbai: The Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ) said that it has enough forex reserves and would supply banks dollars for six months through sell-buy swaps to ensure supply at a time of turmoil in global markets. The announcement came as the rupee hit a lifetime low of 74.48 in intra-day trades in the interbank market, in line with the rout in equity markets.With state-owned banks selling dollars, the rupee recovered to close at 74.22, which was 58 paise lower than Wednesday. One positive news was the improvement in the country’s current account deficit (CAD), which narrowed sharply to $1.4 billion, or 0.2% of the GDP, for the December 2019 quarter as against 2.7% a year ago and 0.9% in the preceding quarter. However, with equity markets suffering their worst loss over fears of the coronavirus pandemic triggering a recession, overall sentiment was negative.“The RBI is closely and continuously monitoring the rapidly evolving global situation and spillovers. It stands ready to take all necessary measures to ensure that the effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on the Indian economy are mitigated, and financial markets and institutions in India continue to function normally,” the RBI said in a statement. The central bank’s forex reserves currently stand at $487.2 billion.The RBI said that it will conduct six-month US dollar sell-buy swaps to provide dollar liquidity to the foreign exchange market, with the first such swap for $2 billion to be held on March 16. The swap amounts to lending dollars to banks as there is a simultaneous contract to buy them back.According to DBS Bank country treasurer Ashish Vaidya , there is a global shortage of dollars. “Globally, corporates are stocking up on cash by selling treasuries. Given the market conditions, they are engaging in deleveraging, which is resulting in a shortage of dollars,” he said. “The sell-buy swaps will generate dollar liquidity and ensure that the rupee does not weaken sharply.”However, dealers do expect the rupee to come under pressure. “Unlike the previous swaps, this time the RBI will be selling dollars and simultaneously purchasing at the end of the swap period. With sufficient FX reserves to meet any contingency, such a move would enhance dollar liquidity in the FX market,” said IFA Global founder Abhishek Goenka. “This will calm down the pressure on the rupee to a certain extent. At the end of the swap, as the dollar will be bought back, the RBI will be at a comfortable position. This will encourage the central bank to do more sell-buy swaps until the rupee volatility is contained,” he added.“The swaps will result in a reduction of rupee liquidity. But the RBI is likely to offset that by conducting long-term repo operations (LTROs). In fact, the RBI could consider doing repo below its benchmark rates if it wants to bring down interest rates before the MPC,” said Vaidya.

Title: Two coronavirus cases push Uttar Pradesh tally to 11, Toronto doctor in KGMU isolation
Content: LUCKNOW: Two fresh Covid-19 positive cases took the state’s tally to 11 on Thursday — one is from Lucknow and the other from Ghaziabad. Two patients were also quarantined in Mathura and Delhi on suspicion of contracting the virus in the past 24 hours. While one is a foreign national, the other a resident of Agra.Currently, seven cases from Agra, one each from Noida and Ghaziabad have tested positive to the disease, which has been declared a pandemic by World Health Organisation on Wednesday.Lucknow’s patient is a 35-year-old resident of Canada, who came to Lucknow to meet her relatives in Gomtinagar, said nodal officer, coronavirus , Dr Vikasendu Agarwal. “While the woman and her husband have been quarantined at King George’s Medical University, seven of her family members have been isolated at home. Also, throat swabs of 22 persons, including family members who were in contact with the couple, have been sent for testing to confirm or rule out Covid-19,” he said. Late Thursday, all 10 relatives of the doctor tested negative to covid-19.Chief Medical Officer, Lucknow, Dr Narendra Agarwal said, the patient is Toronto-based doctor who reached Lucknow via London and Mumbai on March 1. “She did not pass through thermal scanners as the procedure was set rolling in airports after March 5.The Canada-based doctor had touched down in Lucknow four days before,” he said.Faculty, medicine department and in charge of infectious diseases cell, KGMU, Dr D Himanshu said: “The patient reached out to us on March 8. We got both of them tested and found they had high viral load, but no symptoms. So we advised home isolation as symptoms often show up 5-10 days after exposure. Their swab samples were sent to check Covid-19. Of the two, the woman tested positive, while the man was asymptomatic.”Stating that the patient was stable, Dr Himanshu said: “We are closely monitoring her. She has mild respiratory tract infection. It will take at least 14 days for her to recover. Thereafter, she will b0e kept in observation for 14 more days to fend off relapse.”Fresh swab samples of the patient and her husband were sent to the laboratory again on Thursday and results remained unchanged. Earlier, five suspected coronavirus patients were admitted in KGMU since the onset of the disease, but no one tested positive.The patient from Ghaziabad is the son of a man, who tested positive to the disease last week. Admitted in Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital, Delhi, the patient had returned from Iran. After he tested positive, health authorities quarantined six of his close contacts and sent their samples for testing. Of them, the patient’s son tested positive to the disease at 3 am on Thursday.The state health department has decided to compulsorily quarantine from Friday all travelers, including Indian nationals, arriving on or after February 15 with a travel history to China, Iran, South Korea, Italy, Germany, Spain and France.They would be isolated for a minimum period of 14 days. Health officials convened an inter-departmental meeting with officials of Panchyati Raj, education and urban development departments to work on a coronavirus management and containment plan.

Title: Register online for compensation by March 23: Bihar minister to farmers
Content:
Prem Kumar

PATNA: State agriculture minister Prem Kumar on Thursday appealed to farmers of 11 districts who suffered crop damage due to rain, storm and hailstorm last month to register themselves online for availing agriculture input subsidy as compensation that the government had announced for them. The last date for the online registration is March 23.

Any farmer who has suffered crop damage but not registered online while making the claim will not be eligible for the agriculture input subsidy benefit, the minister said.

The 11 districts which witnessed rain or hailstorm in February and also suffered consequent crop damage are Aurangabad, Bhagalpur , Buxar, Gaya, Jehanabad , Kaimur , Muzaffarpur, Patna , East Champaran, Samastipur and Vaishali, the minister said, adding an area assessment of crop damage was made at the local level by the district administrations concerned.

The minister said the farmers of the districts and blocks concerned whose standing rabi crops were damaged should get themselves registered online on either of the two portals of the agriculture department – www.krishi.bih.nic.in and dbtagriculture.bihar.gov.in.

The agriculture input subsidy will be transferred into the bank accounts of the farmers through the direct benefit transfer (DBT) method. Their claims will be cleared after proper verification.

Farmers whose crops on the non-irrigated or rain-fed plots of land were damaged will get Rs 6,500 per hectare of land, while the compensation is Rs 13,500 per hectare of irrigated land. The compensation paid would be for the maximum 2 hectares of land, the minister said.

Title: Patna: Two criminals in surgical masks loot Rs 15,000, held
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: With the threat of Covid-19 looming large over the state, some miscreants are now using surgical masks to conceal their identity during the course of crime.

This is exactly what happened at a cake shop near the Mithapur bus stand under the Jakkanpur police station area in Patna late on Wednesday evening. Unsuspecting criminals wearing face masks entered the shop around 8pm, looted over Rs 15,000 after holding the staff and the owner captive at gunpoint and decamped with the cash on their motorbike.

Both the criminals — Sanu Kumar (21) and Sagar Kumar (22) — were wearing face masks to conceal their identity and hoodwink police. While Sanu barged into the shop posing as a bona fide customer, Sagar stood guard outside to keep a watch on the passers-by. Surprisingly, the Jakkanpur police station is just a stone’s throw from the site of occurrence, but police have no inkling of the incident.

City SP (East) Jitendra Kumar said on Thursday that both the criminals were later arrested with the help of the local people and the looted amount was recovered from their possession. While Sanu, a resident of Postal Park, has criminal antecedent and was earlier arrested in connection with a case lodged with the Kotwali police station, Sagar’s antecedents are being verified.

The City SP said, “The face masks as well as caps, which the robbers were wearing at the time of the incident, were seized. Police also recovered a ‘desi katta’ (countrymade weapon) and a motorbike used in the crime. The novel modus operandi of the robbers was captured in the CCTV camera installed in the shop.”

The SHO of Jakkanpur police station, Mukesh Kumar Verma, said a complaint was lodged against the criminals on the statement of the shop owner, Arjun Kumar. “Since the culprits have already been arrested, the charge sheet against them will be submitted in the court at the earliest,” he added.

Title: NGO steps in to rebuild burnt shops in northeast Delhi
Content:
Shopowners say with the aid, they can finally look forward to resuming their businesses

NEW DELHI: Owners of several shops on the Khajuri Khas main road that were gutted and damaged by violent mobs in February, have got a helping hand. Khalsa Aid, an international NGO, has started rebuilding the shops for the owners free of cost.

“We have started work in Khajuri Khas and our volunteers will soon start restoring the shops in other riot-affected areas as well,” said a member of the NGO.

Shopowners say with the aid provided, they can finally look forward to resuming their businesses.

Gyanendra Kumar’s shop in Khajuri Khas is the first shop that is being repaired by Khalsa Aid. Kumar had opened his shop barely six months ago, and had never imagined that his shop would be looted, vandalised and burnt down by a mob.

“I was standing outside my shop when I was heckled by a mob. My Muslim neighbours made a human chain to protect my shop, but in vain. I will always remember their gesture. But the rioters were extremely violent and had my neighbours not finally relented, they would have burnt all of them alive too,” Kumar recalled.

Karan Khanna, whose shop is adjacent to Kumar’s, suffered a similar fate. Within a month of inauguration, his shop was gutted. His e-rickshaw store was burnt down by a mob on February 25 despite his neighbours trying their best to protect the shop from being burnt.

“The Khalsa Aid community is taking care of the expenses for repair work. They have lessened our burden while we await compensation from Delhi government,” Khanna said.

“When the violence broke out, I was around my shop. I had never seen anything like that before. My neighbours were quick to call us into their homes so that they could hide us from the mob. We have suffered losses of more than Rs 50 lakh and don’t know how will we be able to pick up the pieces,” Khanna added.

Satpal Singh, who owned ‘Classic Paints’ on the same road, claimed his losses are estimated to be around Rs 1 crore. “The NGO will be restoring most of the structure and electrical fittings, and also painting the shop. This should help us, but we are still eagerly waiting for the Delhi government’s compensation. The amount may not be sufficient to compensate for the losses, but we need some money at this juncture,” said Singh.

Som Lal, whose mattress shop was being renovated by the NGO on the same road, claimed most of the mattresses kept at his shops were either stolen or burnt during the riots. “We could not recover even a single piece. We also don’t have any funds left and are solely relying on the goodness of the NGO and the compensation claim,” said Lal.

Title: Bihar: RJD snubs Congress, fields own nominees for Rajya Sabha
Content:
Prem Chand Gupta (centre) and Amrendra Dhari Singh (left) with RJD leader Tejashwi Prasad Yadav after filing t... Read More

PATNA: The Lalu Prasad-led RJD sprung a surprise on Thursday by fielding Amrendra Dhari Singh, an entrepreneur hailing from Dulhin Bazar in rural Patna, for the upcoming biennial election for Rajya Sabha.

Amrendra, from bhumihar caste, is a political greenhorn even though RJD state president Jagdanand Singh told reporters at the party headquarters here that he is a social worker and has been associated with the party from a while.

His name was announced along with Lalu’s close aide Prem Chand Gupta, who is a sitting member of the Upper House. “Prem Chand Gupta and Amrendra Dhari Singh have been selected by RJD for Rajya Sabha nomination. Amrendra Dhari has been a social worker and an eminent personality. He is a well-educated and learned person, who we believe, will be able to aptly represent the party in the Upper House,” Jagdanand said.

A 50-year-old bachelor, Amrendra Dhari is in the business of fertilisers and real estate. RJD insiders claimed that he is the grandson of late Jangdhari Singh, who was a well-known Bhumihar landlord of his time.

Many RJD MLAs claimed they don’t know much about Amrendra Dhari. Muneshwar Chaudhary, an RJD MLA, who was a proposer in the nomination filing process at the legislative assembly, told reporters that he came after being called by the party.

“Big leaders of the party must be aware of him. Whatever will be decided by the top leaders of our party- Lalu Ji and Tejashwi Ji will be accepted by us and we will be the voter for that person,” Chaudhary said.

Several other MLAs also cited lack of knowledge about Amrendra Dhari and claimed that they were told over phone to come for the nomination process and they were adhering to the instructions.

Political observers claimed that RJD has taken another step towards wooing the forward castes ahead of the assembly elections by nominating Amrendra Dhari. The apparent bid to attract forward caste by RJD started with the appointment of Jagdanand Singh as the state unit president last year.

Jagdanand, too, claimed that selection of Amrendra dhari shows representation of all sections of society in RJD. “RJD follows the Sarv-Samaj (entire society) policy and we are ensuing that all section of the society is suitably represented. It will be seen in the legislative council as well as upcoming assembly election as well,” he said.

Tejashwi also told reporters that the candidature of Prem Chand Gupta— a Vaishya — and Amrendra, a Bhumihar, “is a befitting reply to those who accuse RJD of confining itself to Muslim- Yadav (MY) combine”.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Bihar Industries Association’s startup conclave postponed
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: In view of the coronavirus (Covid-19) outbreak in the country, the Bihar Industries Association (BIA) has postponed the ‘Bihar Startup Conclave’, which was scheduled to be held on March 14 in the city. The next date will be finalized once the effect of the virus minimizes.

BIA officials claimed that it was necessary to cancel the event as Covid-19 had spread its tentacles all over. Association’s president Ram Lal Khetan told this newspaper on Thursday, “The main speakers of the event, which include leading investors, innovators and entrepreneurs, have expressed their inability to attend the event on March 14. Hence, we will probably organize the conclave next month.”

The event will provide a platform to budding entrepreneurs, students and innovators with new startup ideas. The BIA has received more than 100 plans for the conclave, which is based on the ‘Agri-tech’ theme. Most entries are from Hyderabad, Mumbai, Kolkata, Bhubaneswar, Delhi, Kerala and Chennai.

“During the last three years, the BIA has provided funds to more than 50 startup plans. This year, we are promoting the technologies in the agriculture sector, on which a major population of the country is dependent. At least 14 prominent speakers will throw light on different aspects of the topic,” Khetan said and added that panel discussions and chats would also be conducted as part of the daylong conclave.

The first three winners will get Rs 1 lakh, Rs 50,000 and Rs 25,000, respectively. The next three will receive consolation prizes of Rs 10,000 each.

Title: SSG Capital top bidder for Altico
Content:
(Representative image)

MUMBAI: Hong Kong-based asset management company SSG Capital , which specialises in distressed assets, has emerged as the highest bidder for troubled real estate lender Altico Capital .

SSG is understood to have offered Rs 2,750 crore up front and an additional Rs 350 crore in the form of security receipts, which give the holder a stake in the funds recovered. Altico Capital has liabilities of Rs 4,300 crore and the bid will result in a substantial recovery for lenders including SBI , Bank of Baroda and Yes Bank .

Shadow bank Altico Capital is inching toward the final stage of a debt-restructuring plan that has been keenly watched as the country grapples with a crisis in the industry. Besides SSG, another hedge fund Cerberus Capital had bid for Altico.

The lender-led debt restructuring at Altico is one of the earliest one in the financial sector involving real estate. Earlier, Altico had indicated that its debtors were all real estate developers, including Rajesh (Rs 676 crore), Vatika (Rs 494 crore), Renaissance (Rs 475 crore).

SSG describes itself as a pan-Asian alternative investment manager focusing on special situations in Greater China, India and Southeast Asia.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Andhra Pradesh: Poultry sector loses Rs 350 crore in February
Content:
Nalla.Ram@timesgroup.com

By-VIJAYAWADA: The poultry sector in Andhra Pradesh has suffered over Rs 350 crore loss in February, according to farmers and traders.They said the losses would increase in the coming days due to coronavirus scare The industry has been hit hard amid rumours that Covid-19 can be transmitted through consumption of chicken and eggs. The prices of chicken and eggs have dipped by 30 to 50%.Many people in Andhra Pradesh and Odisha are saying no to chicken, red meat and egg. Chicken is being sold at Rs 80 to Rs 100/kg compared with Rs 180/kg earlier on. The price of live bird (chicken) has fallen to Rs 50/ kg. World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE) has said coronavirus is transmitted only through human contact. There is no evidence of the virus spreading from animals to humans or humans to animals.Gaddam Bucha Rao, president of Broiler Chicken Farmers Association, Krishna and Guntur districts, said poultry business is hit due to misinformation on social media. “The average demand for chicken is 8 lakh kg per day in the state. It has dropped to over 4 lakh kg. Broiler chicken industry lost Rs 200 crore in February and the losses would touch over Rs350 crore in March,” he said.Every summer (April and May) the poultry industry sees fall in consumption.With 4.6 crore eggs per day, the state is the second highest producer of eggs in the country. At present, AP produces around 3.5 crore eggs per day from over 2,000 layer farms and sends over 1.5 crore eggs to other states. The consumption of eggs has decreased by 30% due to coronavirus scare.

Title: Calicut University’s biggest teacher recruitment drive for 116 posts gets only 3,000 applications
Content:
Picture for representational purpose only.

KOZHIKODE: While almost every PSC notification for government jobs in the state invariably sees a huge rush of applicants, often numbering to tens of thousands, the largest-ever recruitment of teachers in Calicut University for 116 vacancies through an all-India notification has received just around 3,000 applications .

According to sources, the varsity has received around 2,500 applications for 63 assistant professor vacancies and around 500 applications for 29 associate professor and 24 professor vacancies combined. This has brought down the odds for applicants to land the jobs to 1:10 and less in many associate professor and professor posts.

While critics have said the decision by the varsity to notify the vacancies without specifying the reservation turns and concerns among applicants of the possibility of the selection process hitting legal hurdles have dissuaded many applicants, varsity officials said receiving 3,000 applications was a reasonably good response and attributed the absence of huge rush of applicants to the eligibility criteria for the posts as per UGC regulations on minimum qualifications for appointment of teachers 2018.

“While 55% marks at the master’s level along with NET pass is the minimum qualification for assistant professor appointment, PhD degree has become a sort of unofficial requirement with most applicants having doctorate degrees. Also, there are not many qualified people for professor and associate professor posts in universities in the state satisfying the UGC’s eligibility norms regarding published research works and total research score,” syndicate member K K Haneefa said.

Meanwhile, UDF-aligned syndicate member Rasheed Ahammed said the 3,000 applications received by varsity for 116 teaching posts were definitely short of expectations. “Apprehensions over the recruitment process being challenged in the court and concerns about political interference have dissuaded many people who are working in affiliated colleges and elsewhere to submit applications,” he said.

Title: Cab driver’s family members test negative
Content:
Pune: The three family members of the coronavirus-affected private cab driver tested negative for Covid-19 on Thursday.

The 47-year-old cabby’s family members — his two sons in teens and his 38-year-old wife — were isolated at Naidu Hospital after the cab driver, a resident of Manjari Budruk , tested positive for the contagion on March 10.

The cab driver had ferried the coronavirus-affected couple and their 23-year-old daughter from Mumbai to Pune on their return from Dubai on March 1.

“The cab driver’s family was under focus as they had high chances of contracting the infection from him. However, their throat swab samples tested negative ,” a civic health official said.

Title: Odisha: Jeypore railway station lacks basic amenities
Content:
Representative Image

KORAPUT: Thousands of rail commuters , who reach Jeypore railway station in Koraput district daily to catch trains, and those who alight from trains are suffering due to lack of basic amenities.

Passengers are having a harrowing time due to non-availability of safe drinking water and lack of proper sheds and washrooms.

With summer round the corner, the passengers are livid over alleged inaction of railway authorities to provide safe drinking water.

There are 16 water posts in the platform but all are running dry.

“In sweltering weather conditions, we face difficulty to fetch a bottle of drinking water as we have to go near the station manager’s chamber, which is more than 200 metres away from entrance,” said Trinath Bhuiyan, a passenger on Thursday. Also, the passengers alleged that they face difficulty to stand under direct sun.

Only a small portion of the platform is covered with shed which is not sufficient at rush hours.

“The entire platform should be covered,” said Krishna Rao, another passenger.

The station neither has a dormitory nor a proper washroom, he added.

With at least 10 passenger trains passing through the station daily, there is high footfall at the station.

An official said the drinking water problem at the station will be sorted out in next two weeks as a new bore-well will be dug.

“Due to depleting groundwater table we are unable to get sufficient water from the lone bore-well. A new bore-well will be dug soon to meet the water requirement,” said John Kujru, station superintendent, Jeypore railway station.

According to the official, a proposal for setting up a dormitory, a new platform, additional sitting arrangements and extending the shed of the platform, among others, has been submitted to the higher authorities for clearance. In next few months, the infrastructure facilities of the railway station will be strengthened, he said.

Title: Shops on Marina beach: Smart carts for existing and new vendors
Content:
The corporation told the Madras high court that 900 shops will be permitted on the famous beach

CHENNAI: Greater Chennai Corporation has announced that 60% of the smart carts that it is purchasing for the Marina beach will be given to applicants who are existing street vendors, while the remaining will be kept open for others who may not be vendors there but intend to start a business on the beach.

Two types of applications with details of terms and conditions, vending fees, timings, monthly rent, maintenance charges, penalty amount and other details have been uploaded on the civic body’s website. Those intending to apply should fill up the application with supporting documents from April 3 to April 8. This is as per the Madras high court’s orders in the writ petition 16797 of 2015 filed by Fisherman Care.

The corporation had earlier informed the high court that only 900 shops would be permitted on the beach for which Rs 3,000 a year would be collected as licence fee per vendor. Carts will be purchased at a total cost of Rs 16.47 crore, the civic body told the court.

The division bench of Justice Vineet Kothari and Justice R Suresh Kumar had told the civic body that the number of shops permitted on the beach shall not exceed 900 and no other street vendor should be allowed except the duly allotted and licensed shops.

The corporation said the allotment of the second category of vendors was made to strike a balance between the existing street vendors and those who want to run a business in the future.

The applications would be scrutinised from April 10 to April 15 and finalised on April 18. The draw of lots will be decided after finalisation of the application, the corporation said.

The allotment of shops and issue certificate of vending will be done after finalisation of the draw of lots, the civic body said.

Title: Facility to turn plastic into fuel in the offing in Haridwar
Content: Dehradun: The Haridwar Municipal Corporation (HMC) officials on Thursday said they are inviting bids to build a plant where plastic waste would be processed into fuel, on the lines of the one that is functional in Dehradun. They said the facility would be established before the Kumbh Mela 2021 begins.They added that the facility would be built through the private-public partnership (PPP) model.“The concept is like solving two problems in one stroke. On the one hand, we will be able to get rid of the plastic used in Kumbh while on the other, it will also help generate fuel,” said Narendra Singh Bhandari, Haridwar municipal commissioner.Providing further details of the proposed project, the official said that the Haridwar municipal corporation will not be investing any money in the project, but will provide land to set up the plant with the capacity to process 10 tonnes of plastic waste.“The partnership will also yield income for us as we would get rent against the land. The existing agency engaged for garbage collection in the city can also be tasked for collecting and carrying the plastic waste to the plant,” the municipal commissioner added.Since there are very few players with expertise in such projects, the Haridwar municipal corporation did not receive an overwhelming response the last time when the bidding process was initiated. The officials are now hopeful to receive “a good response”.Calling the effort futuristic, Anoop Nautiyal, founder of Dehradun-based Social Development for Communities (SDC) Foundation which is involved in setting up plastic banks in the city, said, “The move is all the more critical as the Kumbh mela will witness one of the biggest religious congregations, which will certainly result in the generation of a huge amount of waste. I would also recommend the state government to follow the plastic waste management rules, 2016, in letter and spirit during the mela.”As reported by TOI earlier, the Doon-based Indian Institute of Petroleum (IIP) has installed a plant in its campus which is converting plastic — collected from 10 plastic banks in the city — into diesel.

Title: YSRC silent on ZP chief choices, but names cleared, say insiders
Content:
Amaravati: The YSRC leadership has almost cleared the names for ZP chairperson posts in Guntur, Prakasam and Nellore districts. The party leadership asked legislators to extend their support to candidates and see that they get elected in ZPTC elections. The party directed district ministers to take adequate care in getting ZP chairperson candidates elected without any trouble from within the party.

However, the official announcement about candidates will be made only after the declaration of local body election results. YSRC, which is hopeful of bagging most of the seats in ZPs, is readying candidates to take the top post to avoid last minute jostling. Sources said that the party had cleared the name of Dalit leader Kattera Heny Christina for the ZP chairperson’s post in Guntur. Christina was, in fact, recently nominated as chairperson of District Cooperative Marketing Society (DCMS). Christina lost the 2014 Assembly elections from Tadikonda constituency as party nominee and served as party constituency in-charge for five years when YSRC was in opposition. However, the party replaced her with Dr V Sridevi in the 2019 elections and promised Christina due recognition when the party comes to power. Initially, Christina was made DCMS chairperson as it was believed that the ZP chief’s post would fall under general quota. Although, the post was made women’s quota during the initial fixation, it was allocated to SC (woman) quota after the reduction of quotas to reserved categories to 50 percent. The change of reservation helped Christina back in the race for the top post. Sources said that YSRC elections coordination team comprising senior leaders reported to have asked Tenali legislator Annabathuni Sivakumar to field Christina from Kollipara mandal as ZPTC in his constituency and work for her victory.

Similarly, the party cleared the name of Buchepalli Venkayamma, legislator Sivaprasada Reddy’s mother for the ZP chairperson post in Prakasam district. She is contesting as Darsi ZPTC. After Sivaprasada Reddy expressed unwillingness to contest assembly elections due to his father and former MLA Subbareddy’s ill health and business issues, the party fielded Maddisetty Venugopal from Darsi constituency. Venugopal won the seat with the support of Buchepalli family which had a good following in the constituency.

As Sivaprasada Reddy had been loyal to Jagan since he floated the party a decade ago, the party decided to give the ZP post to their family. Venkayamma had served as mandal president in Chimakurthy in the past. Sources said that YSRC had cleared the name of Anam Arunamma, wife of senior leader Vijayakumar Reddy, for the ZP chairperson post. She is contesting as ZPTC from Nellore rural mandal.

Title: Rly employees protest against cooperative bank election
Content:
Gorakhpur: The railway employees and the employee unions staged a protest against the election of board members at NE and EC multi-railway Cooperative bank in Gorakhpur and demanded re-election following complete procedure and annul the election with immediate effect. They gave a memorandum to chief personnel officer and will give a memorandum to GM and central cooperative registrar on Friday.

General secretary of NER employees union Vinod Rai, said, “None of the shareholders, rail officials or employees were informed about it. We demand election following proper rules and procedures.”

PRO of NER employee union AK Singh said, “The multi cooperative society Act 2004 has not been followed and the rules given in Indian Railway establishment manual second in para number 2339 to 2343 were ignored.”

However, acting secretary of cooperative bank, Sunil Kumar Singh termed the allegations baseless and said that the election was conducted as per the rules of multi railway cooperative bank society Act 2002. On being contacted, CPRO Pankaj Singh said he would look into the matter.

Title: 80 US citizens arrive in Agra from Kathmandu screened for coronavirus at airport
Content:
Agra: A group of 80 US citizens, who arrived from Kathmandu to Agra in a chartered plane on Thursday were screened for symptoms of the novel coronavirus (Covid-19) at the airport by a team of doctors.

After visiting Australia, Combodia and Nepal, the group arrived at the Agra airport.

Agra airport director Kusum Das said, “After landing at the airport, the group of 80 US nationals underwent thermal screening carried out by a team of doctors. None of the passengers had symptoms of cough, fever or cold.”

Confirming the same, chief medical officer Mukesh Vats said, “The American tourists are healthy.”The US tourists are expected to stay in Agra for the next two days.

Title: Blame me, not Delhi Police; they tackled riot situation in 36 hours, says Amit Shah
Content:
Amit Shah

NEW DELHI: Union home minister Amit Shah on Thursday came out again in stout defence of Delhi Police, saying it had acted swiftly to bring the situation in the riot-hit northeast Delhi under control and asked the opposition to refrain from attacking the force.

During a debate in Rajya Sabha on Delhi riots , Shah rejected the opposition charge that police had failed to control the violence on the first day itself when it was confined to a limited area. “If you have to blame, you can attack me... I am a politician...I can take it but don’t attack police. They dealt with the situation rather swiftly, preventing the riot from spreading. In 36 hours, they brought everything under control,” he said.

When Aam Aadmi’Party’s Sanjay Singh tried to intervene to say that the riots went on for longer, the treasury benches shot back in protest and the home minister shared details of the time when the first information on the violence came on the afternoon of February 24 and the last information at 11.00 pm on February 25.

Sanjay Singh accused the home minister of doing nothing when Delhi kept burning for three days. “I want to ask what was the home minister doing. Such a minister has no right to remain in his post,” he said. Singh said Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal had sought imposition of curfew and deployment of the Army to deal with the riots, but the Centre did not act.

Shah said that at high level meeting on February 25 where the lieutenant governor, the CM and senior officials were present, Kejriwal made no such request. he said the Delhi CM was talking about the Army on February 27 when rioting had stopped. Shah took a dig at Kejriwal saying the CM may have suddenly started raising his voice as “so many things were found from his (AAP) councillor’s (Tahir Hussain) house and he had to be suspended”.

Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar asked, “Was the bomb factory discovered at Tahir's (suspended AAP councillor Tahir Hussain) house not instigation?”

Shah said hundreds of social media accounts were created just before February 24, the day the riots started, and large number of them were closed by the night of February 25. He said the investigating teams were tracing all such accounts and book those who spread hate.

The home minister also rejected conspiracy theories behind the transfer of Delhi High Court judge S Muralidhar who had ordered registering of FIRs against BJP functionaries and ministers for alleged hate speech, saying it was done on the recommendation of the SC collegium. “Why do you think only one judge can give justice and not any other?” he asked.

Title: Telangana: Jammu and Kashmir cops arrest Jagtial farmer in espionage case
Content:
Representative Image

HYDERABAD: A 36-year-old farmer from a remote village in Jagtial was arrested by cops from Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) for transferring money online to an accused in an espionage case.

A team of J&K cops reached Kushthapur village on Wednesday night and arrested S Linganna in the case registered at Arnia police station in Jammu.

Police had arrested a resident of Arnia, Rakesh Kumar, on January 5 for sharing details of security installations in and around Arnia, which is close to the Line of Control, with a woman through Facebook. They believe the woman was a Pakistani spy.

Linganna came under police lens for transferring Rs 5,000 to a bank account linked to Rakesh Kumar through Google Pay on February 13. “Linganna confessed that he had transferred the amount, but said he was instructed to do so by his brother-in-law Srinivas, who works in Dubai,” a Jammu police official said.

“The Jammu and Kashmir police arrested Linganna and took him to Jammu on a prisoner transit warrant,” Jagtial SP Ch Sindhu Sharma said.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: One killed due to thunderstorm in Bhadohi
Content:
Representative image

VARANASI: Thunderstorm accompanied with strong wind claimed a life and damaged crops in different parts of Bhadohi district on late Wednesday night. The district administration is estimating the loss due to the storm.

According to reports, a 35-year-old man Ravi Seth, posted at Aurai police station as follower, lost his life a branches of a tree fell on him during the storm. He was rushed to the Gopiganj community centre, where he was declared dead.

Meanwhile, power supply from Suriyawa sub-station was disrupted after a tree fell on a high tension wire near Bankat village. Several old houses collapsed in Gopiganj due to rain and storm.

The standing crops of wheat and pea were also damaged due to thunderstorm and rainfall. Bhadohi district magistrate Rajendra Prasad has confirmed a casualty and added that the loss due to the storm is being estimated for compensation.

Title: Four of family killed on Agra-Lucknow expressway
Content:
Agra: Four members of a family hailing from West Bengal were killed in an accident on Agra-Lucknow expressway on Wednesday night.

The accident occurred near milestone 118 under Chaubia police jurisdiction of Etawah district around 11:57pm. According to police, victims’ hatchback hit the rear of a truck which was heading towards Agra on the extreme left lane.

Deceased were identified as Srikant Maithi, clerk in district magistrate’s office of East Medinipur, his wife Kavita Maithi, daughter Ananiya Maithi and son-in-law Arjit Vishwas. Injured driver, identified as Deepak Kumar, has been admitted to Saifai hospital.

Station house officer of Chaubia Jeevram Yadav said, “It seems the driver of the car fell asleep on steering wheel and lost control of the car killing four members of a family. The victims were heading to Gurugram from Lucknow.”

Earlier on Tuesday afternoon, two were killed and two others were injured on Yamuna expressway near milestone 63 under Naujheel police jurisdiction after two motor-bikes suffered a head-on-collision.

Title: Anti-CAA stir: Former BJYM office-bearer arrested in Aligarh for ‘attempt to murder’
Content:
Agra: Aligarh police on Wednesday night arrested former Bharatiya Janta Yuva Morcha (BJYM) office bearer Vinay Varshney in connection with the alleged attempt to murder of 22-year-old Mohammad Tariq during a clash that broke out between anti-CAA protesters and police in Aligarh’s Babri Mandi area last month.

Five other persons from a different community were also arrested by the police for allegedly pelting stones on police and causing violence in Upper Kot and Babri Mandi area on February 23.

Confirming this, SP (crime) Arvind Kumar said that Varshney was arrested and remanded to judicial custody for 14 days. He added that Varshney was named in the FIR lodged by Tariq’s brother Shariq, accusing him of opening fire from a pistol. Varshney was shifted to Etah prison on Thursday to maintain law and order in the city, said Kumar.

Five others identified as Faimuddin, Mustaqeem, Sabir, Imran and Anwar had also been remanded to judicial custody on Thursday, said the SP. He added that they were named, along with 23 others, in another FIR for indulging in stone pelting. He said that others will be arrested soon.

According to the FIR, Tariq was standing on the balcony of his house, when he was struck by a bullet. Tariq’s condition is said to be critical and he is admitted in the JN Medical College’s ICU. According to Tariq’s brother, Shariq, Tariq had received a gunshot wound in his stomach. He said that two others were also named in the FIR, but they have not been arrested so far.

Several BJP leaders, including the party’s MLAs Anil Parashar, Sanjeev Raja from Aligarh, reached the prison to meet Varshney, but they refused to speak to the media after meeting him and only said “government will look into the matter”.

State power minister Shrikant Sharma, who was in Aligarh, said that the CM has taken cognisance and is himself monitoring the matter. He added that justice will be done.

Title: ‘Centre to recruit 200 IPS officers’
Content:
The Centre will increase the number of Indian Police Service ( IPS ) recruits in the civil services examination from 150 to 200, said Jitendra Singh, Union minister of state for personnel, public grievances and pensions and minister of state for prime minister’s office, in Rajya Sabha.

The minister was replying to a question by YSRC MP Vijaysai Reddy.

“On the basis of the recommendation of Kamal Kumar Committee, 150 IPS officers are recruited every year since 2009. The ministry of Home Affairs has decided to recruit 200 IPS officers for CSE-2020,” the minister said.

The minister said there will be no increase in the number of IAS recruits. TNN

Title: Man arrested for his role in murder of IB staffer during northeast Delhi riots
Content:
Ankit Sharma’s body was recovered from the Chand Bagh drain on February 26

NEW DELHI: The Special Cell has formally arrested a man named Haseen Qureshi for allegedly being involved in the murder of intelligence official Ankit Sharma during the northeast Delhi riots . Police claimed his interrogation had, for the first time, shed light on what transpired at the Pulia in Chand Bagh where Sharma was brutally killed by a mob.

Qureshi, who was arrested by the southwestern range of the Special Cell on Thursday, has reportedly told the cops that he was present in the area with his friend Sameer. Around 2pm, he saw violence had broken out in the area and decided to join in. He told cops they mingled in the crowd and started throwing stones at people from the other community who had gathered on the other side of the Pulia.

In the meantime, Qureshi picked up a knife kept near the stall of a sweet shop and stood on the road near the residence of suspended AAP councillor Tahir Hussain, a source said. Hussain, along with his brother Shah Alam, has been arrested on the charges of hatching a conspiracy that led to Sharma’s murder.

After walking around for some time, Qureshi saw that a group of 20-30 people had been dragging a person from the other side of the Pulia to this side, said the source. Qureshi claimed he didn’t know the man’s identity.

As he rushed towards the group, police claimed, he saw the mob brutally thrashing the man with sticks, stones and other objects and stabbed the person three times and also kicked him. He apparently told the cops that as the man stopped responding after a few minutes, they picked up his body and threw it in the drain.

The next day — when Sharma’s body was recovered from the Chand Bagh drain — Qureshi identified the man from the photograph being shown on the television and went underground.

He was nabbed by a Special Cell team led by DCP Sanjeev Yadav, who had formed a team comprising of ACP Sanjay Dutt and inspectors Atul Tyagi and Dalip Kumar to work on technical intelligence. By deploying sources on the ground to develop the electronic leads, the team zeroed in on Qureshi, whose location was found to be around the spot where Sharma was killed.

The Special Cell is hoping to identify other killers with the help of Qureshi, who has been remanded in police custody.

Title: Noida tops Uttar Pradesh GDP & per capita income again, Lucknow is second
Content: LUCKNOW: The state’s latest district gross domestic product figures released by UP government reveal massive economic disparities among various districts in the state, calling for swift corrective action at a time when the aim is to make UP a one trillion dollar economy.Noida retains first position among all districts, accounting for 10.12% of the state’s GDP , despite registering a slight drop of 0.17% since 2017-18. Lucknow, which is second behind Noida, contributes 3.85% of state GDP, even though it lags at less than 40% of Noida’s figures.Shravasti with a GDP of Rs 2,793.87 crore translating to 0.25% of the state trails at the bottom of the list.Noida is first in terms of per capita income too, with an average of Rs 6.71 lakh per annum, while Balrampur is at the end of list with average per capita income of just Rs 32,305 per annum.Chief minister Yogi Adityanath blamed previous governments for the wide economic disparity while adding that UP’s per capita income was highest in the country after independence, but had fallen much below the national average when he became CM.“When we came to power, UP’s per capita income was less than half of the national average. We have been working vigorously to generate employment in the state and per capital income has risen above the national average,” he said.Two districts — Chitrakoot and Mahoba — cry for attention while registering a fall both in GDP and per capita income.Chitrakoot’s share of state GDP went down from 0.50% in 2017-18 to 0.32%, while its per capita income dipped from Rs 56,402 to Rs 38,751 per annum. Mahoba, the second district witnessing a decline in both parameters, saw its GDP share slip from 0.68% to 0.51% and per capita income fall steeply from Rs 89,035 to Rs 75,573.The share of various regions to state GDP has remained almost constant, once again emphasizing a wide chasm between the developed and underdeveloped expanses of the state. While west UP accounts for 51.71% of state GDP, the lagging Bundelkhand accounts for just 5.22%, though it has risen from 4.95% bringing some solace to the government.Arvind Kumar Pandey, director finance and statistics, in his introduction to the report, said limited statistics available with the government made it difficult to assess the actual economic condition of a district, though computing per capita income was possible.Consequently, the state also started a detailed exercise to compute credible district-wise GDP figures.A senior official in planning department said states like Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra have also been calculating district GDP and UP would have to collect more data in a more systematic way for more accurate information.“Uttar Pradesj is going to use sustainable development goals to identify the indicators on which to calculate GDP, and not restrict itself to just economic factors,” the official said.

Title: Kolkata second most forgetful city, leaves even tricycles in app cabs: Study
Content: KOLKATA: The city has emerged as the second most forgetful city in India after Mumbai revealed app cab aggregator Uber’s fourth Lost and Found Index, 2020, that was released on Thursday. In fact, Kolkata’s forgetfulness has scaled up over the years. In the 2019 index, Kolkata’s rank was fifth and in the 2018 edition, the city had secured the fourth rank. Bengaluru, which had been most forgetful city for the last three years, managed to go down in the scale to the fifth position.Phones continued to top the list of most forgotten items across the cities. Mangoes, soft toys and kids’ tricycles also made it to the list. Most of the lost items were reported on Fridays and Thursdays, especially around the afternoon lunch and post-lunch lazy lull from 1pm-3pm, the index showed. Most forgetful days were in July and August.“The index is a snapshot of the frequently forgotten items, the most forgetful cities, as well as the days of the week and times of the year Uber riders tended to report items as lost in India. Uber riders can report lost items by tapping ‘I lost an item’ in the app. Backed by rider insight and other data, the index aims to educate riders about Uber’s in-app options, in case they lost or forgot something during their trip,” an Uber spokesperson said.“Over the last year, we have seen phones, cameras, and bags top the list of items left in our cabs across India. These items were followed by effects like wallets, keys, clothing, and umbrellas in the top 10 most forgotten items category. Indians also forgot unique things, such as acrylic artificial tooth, mangoes, medical prescriptions, exam notes, kitchen pans, soft toys and brooms,” the spokesperson added.

Title: Meet on prospects of cargo flight to NE
Content:
Nashik: A team of officials from SpiceJet, a private airline, will be coming to Nashik on March 16 to explore the possibilities of starting cargo flights to transport vegetables and fruits to the Northeast (NE) states under the Krishi Uddan scheme.

A meeting will be held on Monday between SpiceJet officials, Halcon — which is a joint venture between Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) and Container Corporation of India (Concor) — and farmers, in Ozar near the city.

“SpiceJet is keen on starting a dedicated freighter to transport vegetables and fruits from Nashik to the NE. Accordingly, the team of officials from SpiceJet will hold talks with Halcon and farmers,” said an official from Halcon.

“Consignments of grapes are sent to Guwahati by road, which takes around five days to reach the destination. Transporting grapes by air will save time and the cost. There are chances of sending pomegranates and other vegetables to NE states through a dedicated freighter,” said Halcon official.

At present, Halcon exports 4,500 tonne of fresh vegetables and fruits annually to London, Dubai and other international markets via Mumbai airport.

Vegetables like okra, drumstick, luffa, flat beans, chilli and others are exported by air directly from Nashik airport to Dubai. Fresh fruits like pomegranate, guava and chiku are also exported via Mumbai airport.

Farmers will get more business if they get new markets like NE states to transport vegetables, said an official from Halcon.

During the three months of the rainy season beginning from June, there has been a huge demand for sheep and goat in Sharjah. Farmers and exporters from Nashik and other parts of North Maharashtra have been exporting goats and sheep for the past few years.

Last year, SpiceJet had started its air cargo service to Sharajah during three months of the rainy season.

SpiceJet will also get this business if it starts air cargo service from Nashik, added the official.

Title: DHS: Screening, isolation enough to control virus
Content:
Ponda: Rejecting the possibility of screening machinery at different tourist destinations, the directorate of health services is of the opinion that a centralised screening system at the airport and quarantining of suspected infected persons are sufficient to keep the disease at bay in Goa.

Following the outbreak of Covid-19, Shri Mangesh temple at Mangeshi Ponda had requested the state health department to install thermal screening machinery at the entrance.

But the health services directorate has said there is no need for such measures at every place.

“We have been screening passengers from foreign countries at the airport and if any person is found with an infection, or similar symptoms, we shift them to Goa Medical College and Hospital (GMC) for medical aid,” Dr Utkarsh Betodkar, nodal officer for Covid-19 at the DHS said.

“The incubation period for coronavirus is 14 days but we either hotel quarantine or house quarantine the suspected infected person for at least 15 days to refrain him from moving out into public places,” he added.

Shri Mangesh temple secretary Sudin Ambe said they have already kept hand wash available for visitors and ascertained that the temple staff, including the priest, who have direct access to visitors wear masks.

Title: Drunk man bludgeons wife to death
Content:
Agra: A man allegedly bludgeoned his wife to death in a remote village of Firozabad.

Identified as Avnish Singh (32) of Bhaide village under Jasrana police jurisdiction, the accused was arrested from Ghiror intersection while he was trying to escape. Meanwhile, the police identified the deceased as Sapna (30). Sapna hailed from Kushinagar.

According to police, “According to the accused, he was drunk when his wife confronted him. The couple engaged in a heated argument and in a fit of rage, Avnish bludgeoned Sapna to death with a wooden stick.”

Married for three-years, the couple have one-and-a-half-year-old daughter. After the murder, the accused locked the victim inside the room and tried to escape with his daughter. Neighbours alerted the police about the incident. Police claimed that Avnish’s first wife left him because of his violent behaviour.

Title: Animal husbandry dept to disinfect water resources
Content:
Kozhikode: A review meeting chaired by the district animal husbandry officer at the collectorate here on Friday decided to disinfect the wells and water resources situated in the bird-flu-hit areas in the limits of Kodiyathur grama panchayat and Kozhikode city corporation.

The meeting also decided to carry out monitoring of the visit of migratory birds in the district. This will be done with the help of the forest department.

The animal husbandry department officials had already sprayed disinfectants within a 10-km radius of the bird-flu-hit areas in west Kodiyathur and at Vengeri under the city corporation limits on the day. The disinfectant spraying was conducted by the 25 rapid response teams in the early morning following completion of the culling operations at the bird-flu-hit areas. The meeting also decided to carry out sample collection of birds from the flu-hit areas to ensure elimination of the disease.

The rapid response teams will carry out surveillance for a period of 90 in the district.

Labour and excise minister T P Ramakrishnan will chair another review meeting at the collectorate on March 14. tnn

Title: Telangana: Lorry crashes into house, 3 die
Content:
Representative Image

HYDERABAD: Three persons, including two motorists, died and four others were injured when a lorry crashed into a house along the highway in Jedcherla on Thursday. The deceased were Rafeequddin (54), Mallaiah (35), and Bangaraiah (25).

Police said the incident occured at 9.30am when a jackfruit-laden lorry was on its way to UP from Kerala. Vehicles were being diverted to the service road due to works on the highway. However, the driver lost control of the lorry while changing lanes.

“The lorry first hit Rafeequddin, who was waiting for a bus, and then Mallaiah and Bangaraiah, who were travelling on a bike, before crashing into a house along the road. The three persons died on the spot,” Jedcharla rural police told TOI.

A case was registered under Section 304A of IPC.

Title: Covid-19: Halt in foreign arrivals to hit Goa where it hurts
Content:
Cancellation of visas is being perceived as the final nail in the coffin.

PANAJI: International tourist flow has come to a grinding halt after India suspended all tourist visas and e-visas on Wednesday evening.

The decision has hastened the charter seasons which normally ends by the first week of May. Though the news came as a relief to many, tour operators, hoteliers and taxi drivers had a tough time coming to terms with reality on Thursday.

Abida Kumar, vice-president at Minar Travels (India) Pvt Ltd, said that since the news broke out, she attended to endless calls from hotels and agents. Foreign travellers in Goa have called her to find out if their stay would be shortened.

“It is a terrible scenario. The season has ended. For us, the last chartered flight arrives from Russia on Friday morning,” she said. Travellers who are already in the state, she said, will return as per their scheduled departure.

Amar Dhumatkar, president of the Goa chapter at Caper Travel India Pvt Ltd, said that since the chartered flight slated for Friday morning is landing as per schedule, they assume tourists will not shorten their stay. “We haven’t received anything in black and white. Foreign operators are still locked in discussion,” he said.

Flights will come empty and leave with passengers. “It entails a huge cost to operators,” he added.

Savio Messias, president of Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG), said it will not be easy to quantify the losses at this stage, but the impact will be “huge”.

The cancellation of visas is being perceived as the final nail in the coffin by some with hotels being hit the worst. Francisco de Braganca, a hotelier, said, “The good thing is that the major part of the season is nearly over. We need to concentrate on domestic tourists,” he said. Messias said domestic tourists are likely to benefit from the drop in room tariffs and travel cost.

John Lobo, secretary of the Goa Shack Owners’ Welfare Society said shacks that depend on foreign footfalls will close early. “In Baga and some parts of Calangute, shacks will not shut shop early. Travellers from neighbouring states will visit,” he said. President Cruz Cardozo is not as optimistic. “We in South Goa will wait a week before taking a call. I don’t think people will take the risk of travelling, ” he said.

Title: Coronavirus in Chandigarh: Panchkula spring fest, MC’s anniversary event cancelled
Content: PANCHKULA: After the latest notification and tweet by Haryana health minister Anil Vij mentioning coronavirus as an epidemic in the state, Panchkula municipal corporation has cancelled its 10-year anniversary celebration that was to be held on March 17, confirmed MC commissioner Sumedha Kataria. The administration has also cancelled its two-day 34th spring fest that was to be held at Sector 5 town park on March 14 and 15.Deputy commissioner MK Ahuja was to inaugurate the spring fest and Haryana assembly speaker Gian Chand Gupta was to distribute prizes on the concluding day. But on Thursday evening, they announced to postpone the event and later cancelled it, confirmed the horticulture wing of the Haryana Urban Development Authority.However, closure of schools, colleges, cinemas and public transport has not been announced.On Thursday morning, Vij tweeted, “Covid-19 (Corona Virus Disease) declared epidemic in Haryana.” Soon thereafter, fresh advisories were issued to all the departments to avoid public gatherings and meetings.Three days ago, Citizens’ Welfare Association members of Panchkula had written to the Haryana chief minister, the HUDA chief administrator and the DC to postpone or cancel the spring fest. The association president, SK Nayar, said, “We thank the government for cancelling the fest.”

Title: IndiGo to kick-start four flights from Agra under Udan scheme by March-end
Content:
Agra: Budget carrier IndiGo is all set to start four new flights from Agra airport to Bengaluru, Lucknow, Varanasi and Bhopal from March 29 under the central government’s regional connectivity scheme Udan.

Confirming the move, Agra airport director Kusum Das said that IndiGo would operate flights to the four destinations on all seven days of the week.

“Flight for Bengaluru and Lucknow will help local residents to get connecting flights for international destinations, especially Middle-East. For Bengaluru, the aviation company will operate 180-seater Airbus 320, while for Lucknow, Varanasi and Bhopal, IndiGo will rope in ATR 72, a twin-engine turboprop which has capacity of carrying 74 passengers,” said Das.

An IndiGo official said, “Business viability survey for the air routes was done earlier and we expect huge passenger flow for Bengaluru and state capital destinations.”

At present, only three routes are operational from Agra — Delhi-Agra, Varanasi-Agra-Khajuraho and Jaipur-Agra — for three and four days a week, respectively.

The regional connectivity scheme Udan seeks to connect unserved and under-served airports as well as making flying affordable.

According to the airports authority officials, more flights are expected to kick-start from Agra in future, as expansion of the civil terminal is in pipeline.

Title: 43-year-old man dies in hit-and-run
Content:
tnn

Chandigarh: A hit-and-run claimed the life of a 43-year-old man near sectors 22 and 23 light-point on Wednesday night.

Police said Subhash Kumar, a resident of Dhanas, was on way home from Sector 22 around 10pm. “When he reached near sectors 22 and 23 light-point, a car hit his two-wheeler and sped away. Passersby rushed him to GMH-16 and called up his family as well as the police. Doctors, however, declared him brought dead,” said a cop.

On the statement of his brother, Aswani, police have registered a case against the car driver. “The footage of CCTVs installed in and around the area are being scrutinised to identify the accused,” the cop added.

Title: Man shot at by three on a bike
Content:
Agra: A man was shot at and injured allegedly by three gun wielding motorbike-borne men in Agra city on Thursday afternoon.

The injured man was identified as Faugi Yadav. The 24-year-old was shot at Khandari of Hariparvat police jurisdiction while returning from district jail.

The victim who has been admitted to hospital said, “I went to meet Monu Yadav in jail. On my way back, I was confronted by Ragvender Chauhan, Deepu Senger and Manu Yadav. One of the accused whipped out a country-made pistol and shot at me.”

According to police, Monu Yadav is a history-sheeter and he was having an old rivalry with Manu Yadav.

Till late on Thursday, police were yet to lodge an FIR in the case.

Title: Telangana: Minor ‘chained’ at police station, NGO seeks action
Content:
Mahbubnagar police said the photo was from the II Town police station after a 14-year-old boy was nabbed for a... Read More

HYDERABAD: A child rights organisation on Thursday lodged a complaint with Mahbubnagar superintendent of police after a photograph of a minor boy chained inside a police station went viral.

Mahbubnagar police said the photo was from the II Town police station after a 14-year-old boy was nabbed for allegedly stealing mobile phones.

The boy was nabbed on Wednesday by police and he was taken to the II Town police station, where the local police reportedly chained him to immobilise him. However, a photograph was taken by an unknown person, who shared it on social media.

Deputy superintendent of police (Mahbubnagar sub-division) B Bhaskar said that after the photograph went viral, an inquiry was ordered into what led to the minor being chained.

The warden of the residential school, where the boy studies, was called by police. Later, he was produced before the Child Welfare Committee (CWC), which later handed over him to the warden in view of the forthcoming examination season.

On Thursday, child rights NGO Balala Hakkula Sangam lodged a complaint with the director-general of police and Mahbubnagar SP Rema Rajeshwari. When the SP was contacted over phone, she was unavailable.

Title: Uttar Pradesh to get website for NRIs
Content:
Representative image

LUCKNOW: The government is launching a website for NRIs who hail from UP. The website is expected to be launched by April 15 and will contain details about the state and its tourism and investment potential, among others.

Minister for NRI department Sidharth Nath Singh said that the website, to be available in both Hindi and English, will contain links to other government departments like tourism, health, education, ODOP and industries. This will allow NRIs to make plans for travelling within the state, investment, Pravasi Bharatiya Diwas and in accessing various government policies that pertain to them.
