Title: North Maha university okays 3 wildlife certificate courses
Content:
Nashik: The Jalgaon-based Kavayitri Bahinabai Chaudhari North Maharashtra University has recently given its nod to three wildlife certificate courses. The courses are likely to begin this summer.

The three-month courses are being introduced by Samarpan Sanstha, School of Environment — a Jalgaon-based NGO — and the university is the affiliation body for the courses.

The courses will run under the university’s Department of Lifelong Learning and Extension. Director of the department Manish Joshi said distinctive courses would benefit students who are interested in learning various aspects of wildlife.

“We will be the affiliation body for courses while the syllabus designing and other required process will be carried out by the NGO. They had asked us to begin these courses in collaboration and the university has decided to be part of it,” he said.

The three certificate courses are Ornithology (Bird Science), Biodiversity and Forest and Wildlife. Anyone who has completed his higher secondary education will be eligible to join the courses.

Rajendra Nannaware, chairman of Samarpan Sanstha, said, “There are various wildlife activists and academicians who need to learn a systematic syllabus. We decided to come up with a conceptual course which would help them in learning about the environment.”

The syllabus will be designed by the NGO and the study material will be provided by them. “The designing of syllabus and study material is under process. We have formed an academic council of 10 experts from the field,” Nannaware said.

“The certificate courses can be learnt through distance learning programme as well. The students will be provided the study material but they will have to complete the field work and assignments given by the experts,” said Nannaware.

Title: Scindia won’t get respect or satisfaction in BJP: Rahul
Content:
Senior Congress leader Vivek Tankha meets Digvijaya Singh after he filed his RS nomination papers. Arun Yadav ... Read More

New Delhi: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi Thursday said that Jyotiraditya Scindia abandoned his ideology and went with the RSS out of concern for his political future, warning him that he would not neither get respect nor satisfaction in the BJP.

Breaking his silence on the Gwalior royal’s decision to leave the Congress, Rahul Gandhi told reporters, “Scindia became apprehensive about his political future, he abandoned his ideology and went with the RSS. But the reality is that he will neither get respect nor satisfaction there (in BJP) given what he has in his heart. He will understand.”

In what appeared a reaction to Scindia’s comments in praise of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and BJP, and his criticism of Congress, Gandhi said, “Ours is an old friendship. What is in his heart and what he is saying are two different things.”

Stressing the difference between Scindia’s old and new political shelter, Rahul said, “This is an ideological fight with Congress on one side and RSS-BJP on the other. I know Scindia’s ideology, he was with me in college.”

The remarks came a day after Rahul Gandhi offered a nuanced reaction to Scindia’s rebellion by retweeting a picture he had posted after Kamal Nath was named the chief minister of Madhya Pradesh in December 2018.

Flanked by Scindia and Nath, Rahul had captioned the picture by stressing the importance of “patience and time being the greatest warriors”. Rahul’s comment that Scindia became “apprehensive” about his political future alludes to his rivalry with Nath and Digvijaya Singh, who came to be seen as the ruling faction of Madhya Pradesh Congress after Nath became the CM. However, in the wake of Scindia’s exit, the Gandhi scion is finding it hard to quell the queries that members of his “team” are facing trouble at the hands of the “old guard”.

While he appeared before the press to criticise Modi government over its response to economic crisis and coronavirus, he was miffed at repeated questions about post-Scindia rumblings, the latest being over Rajya Sabha nominations being denied to people “of his team”.

Title: Coronavirus in Bhopal: Domestic travel history passengers under scanner
Content:
All to be screened, quarantined

BHOPAL: A student with a travel history to Iran has been quarantined in All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) Bhopal. The suspected Covid-19 patient was admitted to the hospital on Wednesday.Condition of the patient is said to be stable and his Covid-19 test report is expected to be known by Friday, said an AIIMS Bhopal official.AIIMS Bhopal lab has begun testing for coronavirus after it got Union government certification on Wednesday.Meanwhile, Madhya Pradesh health department is gearing up to screen all domestic passengers traveling by air, train and road. Thirteen states including cities like Delhi, Bengaluru among others have reported Covid-19 positive cases. “We are requesting people with Covid-19 location travel history to get tested if they show symptoms,” said a top health department official.Seeking to restrict public interactions, health department has asked school education and higher education departments to consider closing schools and colleges on the lines of Delhi. Only essential activities like examination would continue.So far, MP has not reported any positive cases. 283 people are under isolation, in MP, said a health department release here on Thursday.Since the Covid-19 outbreak in January, 100 people have been placed under quarantine in Bhopal, said Dr Sudhir Dheriya , CMHO Bhopal. Recently, MP Health Public Health Act, 1949 was invoked conferring special powers on to chief medical and health officer (CMHO) to control infectious diseases.“Thermal scanners (to check for body temperature) are currently being used at the airports,” said Bhopal CMHO Dr Dheriya. High body temperature is one of the symptoms of Covid-19. A two-member team of doctors, Dr James Varghese and Dr Avinash Dubey has been approved for the Vidhan Sabha in Bhopal ahead of crucial vote. Dr Verghese said they have not received any instructions on for screening for Covid-19.On Thursday, Union government notified that all incoming travelers, including Indian nationals, arriving from or having visited China, Italy, Iran, Republic of Korea, France, Spain and Germany February 15 shall be quarantined for a minimum period of 14 days. This will come into effect from midnight on Friday.Incoming travelers, including Indian nationals, are advised to avoid non-essential travel and are informed that they can be quarantined for a minimum of 14 days on their arrival in India.“We are awaiting instruction from the health department,” said a senior health official. There are only 741 beds for quarantine and isolation of such passengers in MP.

Title: Act on fee data: Parents to Telangana government
Content:
Representative Image

HYDERABAD: A day after the Telangana high court set a 28 day deadline for the state government to formulate a comprehensive policy for school fee regulation, parents in the city have questioned the school education department’s inaction on school data that was collected in 2018.

Following the constitution of Tirupathi Rao committee, the department sought audited account statements of all the schools for the academic years 2016-17 and 2017-18. The commissioner of school education had launched a website for the same, where out of the 12,000 schools in the city, close to 4,500 had submitted their data until June 2018.

Parents claim that while the activity was primarily conducted to formulate a policy and examine the fee issue, the school department has been ineffective for the past two years.

“For a long time, the government’s argument was that they do not have sufficient data to regulate school fees . Now that they have collected the data, they have neither informed us about the range of fees collected by schools nor have they regulated it,” said Pawan Kumar, executive member of Hyderabad School Parents Association.

As per the committee recommendations, the data was expected to help the department decide the modalities on fixing the fee hike issue, including a cut-off on percentage of hike based on the annual pay revision. However, due to government’s failure in taking a decision, the data has been gathering dust with the school education department.

With the HC intervening in the hike issue, parents have demanded the government to ensure that the data is put to use. “With the new academic session set to commence, the government should now take note of this data and form a comprehensive policy to regulate the fee structure,” said Vedika Chunduri, a parent.

Sources in the school education department claim that majority schools that had submitted their financial records were budget schools with fees in the range of Rs 1,500 to Rs 35,000. There were barely few schools who levy between Rs 35,000 to Rs 1.50 lakh annual fee.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Moradabad: Health department on alert after 11 locals return from Italy
Content: BAREILLY: The health directorate has sent a report on 11 residents of Moradabad district who had arrived in Delhi from Italy on Wednesday. The report was sent to the local health department following which the chief medical officer (CMO) has alerted the officials concerned. Italy has been severely affected with 12,462 positive coronavirus cases and 827 deaths so far.According to health department, 11 people had returned to India from Italy. Their information was shared with the state government by Union civil aviation ministry. The CMO said that health team would monitor all 11 people for the next 14 days and they have been advised to stay under quarantine.Those who arrived from Italy include two residents of Dilari, and one each of Thakurdwara, Tajpur, Kanth, Chidiyatoal, Majhola, Town Hall, Chau ki Basti, Deputy Ganj and Faizganj, health officials stated. Their names were reportedly shared with the health directorate in UP by the Union government.CMO Dr MC Garg said that medical face masks have been provided to family members of all 11 people. “Our teams visited these people and their family members have been educated about the precautions they must take for the next 14 days. Besides, all 11 people are advised not to meet anyone for 14 days and stay under quarantine. Our teams will visit each and every individual daily to examine them. Their daily reports will be sent to the health directorate,” the CMO added. Notably, all 11 people are exporters and the administration is keeping a tab on those individuals who have recently visited expo meets abroad.

Title: Breathalyser tests for drunk driving to continue: Hyderabad Police
Content: HYDERABAD: Breathalyser tests to detect drunk driving are set to continue in the city, despite increasing demand for stopping the checks amid the fear of Covid-19. After an MLA broached the topic in the assembly on Wednesday, traffic police turned down the demand saying the tests are conducted in a very hygienic way. Previously, an NGO working for road safety had written a letter to the traffic police demanding that the tests be stopped.Since mid-January, the coronavirus argument has been used time and again by motorists to evade the tests. The issue was discussed internally by the traffic police earlier this week and cops decided against doing away with the tests. “Our system of checking with breathalysers is very safe and hygienic. We use a disposable straw for each person, which has been the practice since a long time. Besides preventing the spread of coronavirus, it is essential for preventing other communicable diseases too,” said Anil Kumar, additional commissioner of police (traffic), Hyderabad adding that the checks cannot be done away due to traffic accidents caused by drunk driving. “Preventing traffic accidents is a priority. Also, the situation isn’t so alarming right now. The single-use disposable straw is safe for use,” he added.In February, Vaada Foundation had shot off a letter to the traffic police demanding that the tests be stopped. “Breathanalysers are highly unhygienic and can contribute to the spread of the virus,” P Suresh Raju, founder, Vaada foundation had said.

Title: Shiv Jayanti shouldbe celebrated as perHindu calendar: Raj
Content:
Aurangabad: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray on Thursday said that major religious occasions and festivals are celebrated as per Hindu calendar only and nobody should have any qualms about celebrating Shiv Jayanti in a similar manner.

While Shiv Sena has been the only party to celebrate the day as per the Hindu calendar, the MNS has joined in with an eye on the Hindu votebank.

The MNS chief, who was in town on the occasion amid grand arrangements, said, “For us, Shiv Jayanti is a festival. We revere Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj most and would like to celebrate his birth anniversary on 365 days of the year. As a token of respect, we will celebrate the day as per the Hindu calendar only as it is a festival for us.”

Thackeray, while addressing a gathering after paying tribute to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at Kranti Chowk, did not make a direct attack on Shiv Sena but raised the Hindutva pitch after the saffron party joined hands with Congress and NCP to form Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government in the state.

While the event took place amid caution against public gathering in the wake of coronavirus outbreak, Thackeray appealed to the revellers to take precautionary measures. “We already have so many diseases and now there is an addition to it. But, on a serious note, everyone must follow the advisory of the health authorities,” he said.

Title: ‘Like Uttarakhand in 2016, BJP will face humiliation in MP too’
Content:
Former Uttarakhand chief minister Harish Rawat

DEHRADUN: Former Uttarakhand chief minister Harish Rawat who has been deputed by the Congress to help Kamal Nath save his government, says he is offering advice based on “my own experience of handling a similar situation engineered by BJP in Uttarakhand in 2016.”

The former CM had faced a revolt from a section of his MLAs in 2016, who had subsequently joined the BJP. With the Congress government short of majority, central rule was imposed in the state but Rawat was later able to prove his majority in the House and save his government. In view of his experience in dealing with the crisis, Rawat along with AICC general secretary Mukul Wasnik has been deputed by the party to help in the MP situation.

Rawat who was in Jaipur on Thursday told TOI that “90-plus Congress MLAs are in Jaipur and contact has been made with 14 other MLAs, who have been held captive at Bengaluru.” Exuding confidence that these 14 Congress MLAs were willing to return to the party fold, Rawat said, “I am confident that we will prove our majority in MP. As far as Scindia ji is concerned, he held prominent positions for a large part of his political career but it was the need for power, which took him to BJP.”

He added that the situation was different when Scindia was in Congress as he had some MLAs in his camp. “After he quit the party, his followers do not want to do so, but still they are being forcefully kept at Bengaluru. It is surprising that the PM himself is negotiating these things,” he said.

He alleged that on Thursday, the father of a Congress MLA went to Bengaluru to meet his son, but he was also detained at a police station. “What kind of democracy is this where a father cannot meet his son and bring him back?”

Attacking the BJP for creating political instability, Rawat said, “There is a sense of political uneasiness in the states because of the Narendra Modi government. They have created similar situations earlier in Assam, Uttarakhand and Goa and now are doing it in MP.” He claimed that the BJP’s top leadership was “unable to digest anything which is against them, even the peoples’ mandate.” “Whether it is through Vijay Bahuguna in Uttarakhand or Jyotiraditya Scindia in Madhya Pradesh , the BJP is quick to pounce on the situation and aggressively act against any state government which is of another political outfit.”

Title: Church denies permission for last rites
Content:
Secunderabad: The family of a deceased person was not allowed to perform his last rites in the Trimulgherry Cantonment cemetry on Thursday.

Family of A Fernandez, 48, (who passed away on March 12 ) alleged that members of CSI Wesley Church , Clock Tower ( Secunderabad ) denied them from performing his last rites.

“We approached CSI church members at 8:30 am. They made us wait till 1 pm and we finally had to go to Yapral. Fernandez's mother was also buried here in January last year. How can the church deny permission now because we are Catholics,” asked A Lazar, a relative of Fernandez.

In a video, the family of the deceased were also seen arguing with the committee. The graveyard in Trimulgherey is under CSI Wesly Chruch.

The church committee said that the family was denied permission because they are not CSI members.

“The family has not been denied permission because they were Catholics. The permission was denied as they are not CSI members. The cemetery is only for members. The family was earlier given permission on humanitarian grounds,” said Parmanand assistant pastor of CSI.

Title: Without power, Scindia felt like fish out of water: Baghel
Content:
Chief minister Bhupesh Baghel

RAIPUR: Chhattisgarh chief minister Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday took a dig at Jyotiraditya Scindia for joining the BJP, saying, this proved that he cannot live without power .

“After having lost the elections, Scindia was apparently feeling like fish out of water,” he quipped on his return from New Delhi after having discussion with party high command regarding party candidates for Rajya Sabha polls from Chhattisgarh.

“We in Congress always considered Scindia as a great man. But in a crisis time, he preferred to join the BJP and that sums up about his personality”, the chief minister said.

Meanwhile, Chhattisgarh panchayat and rural development minister T S Singh Deo said the people will have to teach a lesson to politicians who defect — irrespective of their party affiliations. He said Scindia had always opposed and publicly criticised the ideology of BJP, but suddenly he began singing praise of the BJP, which he has been critical for long.

Criticising the BJP for being desperate to grab power and topple governments in non-BJP ruled states, the minister asked “What kind of greed is this? Do they want to stick to power for the next 1,000 years? Such actions are not good for democracy,” he added.

Title: Coronavirus in Telangana: Unwell devotees should avoid mass, says Archdiocese
Content: SECUNDERABAD: In wake of the coronavirus pandemic, the Archdiocese of Hyderabad has asked people to restrict themselves from attending mass, missions, stations of the cross if they have developed any symptoms such as dry cough and breathlessness among others. In a letter issued to all members of the church located at SP road, the Archdiocese listed out advice by doctors and urged people to remain cautious.The Archdiocese urged priests to sanitise their hands before distributing the holy communion and has encouraged people to have holy communion in the hand.People are also discouraged from shaking hands and have been asked to greet each other with folded hands.The letter also advises devotees to avoid kissing the cross. “Those who desire can come in a queue, make reverence with a bow and go back,” read the letter, adding that all these are temporary arrangements and will be reviewed regularly. For the time being, the Archdiocese has asked people and priests to follow the norms until Sunday, April 12.Even the Church of South India Saint Thomas SPG Church, Telugu Pastorate, Secunderabad has informed its members of a new way it has adopted to distribute the holy communion.“From coming Sundays, we will be using small individual cups to partake in the holy communion,” read a message circulated by the church authorities, citing the state government’s instructions to take precautionary measures to avoid the spread of coronavirus.

Title: Bareilly: Nearly 200 turn up at district hospital for anti-rabies jab
Content:
Representative image

BAREILLY: Nearly 200 people turned up at the district hospital’s out-patient department (OPD) on Wednesday for anti-rabies vaccination (ARV). Officials said scores of people are coming to the district hospital in Bareilly for ARV as there is shortage of vaccine at a few community health centres (CHCs) in the district and other hospitals in Bareilly division .

Chief medical superintendent Dr TS Arya said, “Nearly 200-250 patients are turning up daily at the district hospital for ARV. The number of patients has gone up in the past few days as ARV is unavailable at CHCs and a few other hospitals. Patients are also coming from neighbouring districts, including Budaun, Pilibhit and Shahjahanpur .”

Chief medical officer Dr Vineet Shukla said, “The stock of ARV is over at a few CHCs and we have raised demand from UP medical corporation which will supply it in a few days. As ARV is unavailable at a few CHCs, patients are going directly to the district hospital.”

According to the officials, the vaccine – expensive in the open market – is administered free of cost at the CHCs and government hospitals. It is mandatory to be given anti-rabies shots within 24 hours of being bitten by an animal, mostly dogs and monkeys. It is fatal if a human being who contracts rabies is not treated immediately. At least three to six shots are required per patient, which need to be given on 3rd day after the first shot and later on 7th, 14th, 30th and 90th days.

TOI had earlier reported that a report by the state health department has revealed that 1,855 cases of dog bite, 166 cases of monkey bite, 27 cases of cat bite, 2 cases of horse bite and 1 case of crocodile bite have been reported at Bareilly district hospital in January alone. The report further stated that a person died due to rabies in the same period. Officials said the actual number in the district is likely to be higher.

Title: Coronavirus cases in Mumbai: Many schools advance break, suspend classes
Content: MUMBAI: A day after two Covid-19 cases were reported in the city, several schools decided to give students an early break. Schools will use online resources to continue education and in the meantime sanitise their premises.A school in the vicinity of the building where the two cases were reported on Wednesday, for instance, shut operations for the afternoon session on Thursday, and will also remain shut on Friday as well to sanitize the premises. “We are sanitizing the school as a precautionary measure. We have SSC boards running full-fledged and the staff is also fully involved in preparing for the next academic year,” said the school’s principal.Several schools have decided to suspend classes. The Cathedral and John Connon School, Fort, will now reopen on March 31 with an exception of students who are appearing for exams. In an email to parents, principal Meera Isaac said, “Teachers will conduct their lessons on a regular basis, sharing presentations, videos and other resources on online platforms such as Google Classrooms, Hangouts and Zoom, etc, based on which students will be assessed on their return to the school. In addition, they will also be given assignments that they will be expected to complete as per prescribed deadlines.”Similarly, Utpal Shanghvi Global School, Juhu, which has given a short break to students, will send work home through a portal. “Students are expected to stay home, await lots of work coming their way through Skolaro (our online school information management software), so that they can carry on working from home and prepare for the forthcoming exams,” said principal Rakhi Mukherjee.Several international schools such as Dhirubhai Ambani International School (DAIS) at BKC and Oberoi International schools have advanced their spring break. “The school’s spring break was scheduled to begin on March 14 and as a precautionary measure it has been decided to prepone this break from March 13, that is, by a day. The school is scheduled to reopen on March 26 post the spring break. The school has taken several preventive measures and safeguards, including cancellation of all trips and travel by students and staff. The school has also requested the entire school community to avoid non-essential travel,” said a DAIS spokesperson.Among other schools that have called off sessions are Witty International School, Malad, Vasant Vihar High School, Thane, and Rustomjee Cambridge schools in the western suburbs. “Given this pandemic, and in the interest of the health and safety of all students, the school is taking an immediate call to declare an early summer break for Grades I to IX immediately, with final exams being cancelled for Grades I to VIII and grade promotion decision will be based on the average score of the previous exams conducted during the academic year,” said a note to parents by Rustomjee schools.Some have allowed parents to decide. A parent said, "We are not sending our son to school as it is impossible to know the travel history of students and their parents.” India Wide Parents Association has asked the chief minister to shut schools and colleges.

Title: Scindia scion begins with a bang in Bhopal
Content:
File photo of Jyotiraditya Scindia

BHOPAL: Jyotiraditya Scindia was given a royal welcome on his arrival at Bhopal for his first road show as a BJP leader. It took him almost 45 minutes to cover just 500metres from the airport to the main road, part of which he had to walk because it became impossible to keep his SUV crawling through the crowd.

Supporters lined up to cheer him along nearly the entire route to the BJP HQ.

Bhopal airport was jam-packed with Scindia supporters hours before he was scheduled to land with senior BJP leader and Union minister Narendra Singh Tomar .

State BJP president V D Sharma, senior BJP leader Narottam Mishra and around 5,000 supporters from different corners of the state waited for him at the airport.

Scindia came out of airport at 4.45pm, 45 minutes beyond the scheduled time. Immediately, the crowd surged forward, cheering for ‘Maharaj’. They made it clear they were Scindia supporters and would follow him anywhere, be it Congress or BJP — or as minister Imarti Devi had said on Wednesday, “even into a well”. “Hum kal bhi aapke the, aaj bhi hai, aur kal bhi rahenge,” read placards held up by the cheering crowd.

Scindia was supposed to move through Bhopal in the form of rally, but very quickly it became clear that it would be impossible. Supporters jostled for a glimpse of the Gwalior scion and did not allow the vehicle to move. Scindia sat in the SUV with his aunt, former BJP minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia , VD Sharma and BJP spokesperson Zafar Islam.

Scindia then climbed atop the SUV to keep it moving but the crowd just kept coming. The BJP leader, too, reached out to them, urging people to throw garlands if they couldn’t reach him.

Finally, Scindia stepped out of the vehicle and walked along with his supporters. With his supporters forming a human chain, Scindia moved on foot for about 500m to the main road.

Supporters of the breakaway MLAs of the Scindia faction, now in Bengaluru, also came to the airport to show their support for Shrimant, as he is addressed by supporters. Former BJP minister who joined Congress in 2018 state polls Sartaj Singh also came to greet Scindia at airport, apart from scores of BJP leaders and Scindia supporters.

There were saffron flags and drumbeats at the airport, but that show was purely of Scindia supporters.

Scindia was the man of the moment. He posed for selfies, hugged supporters and did not mind getting jostled in the crowd. It took an hour for him just to move out of the airport premises.

His supporters and BJP workers were on streets to welcome him while his convoy moved towards BJP headquarters. Scindia stopped his cavalcade nine times on the 20km drive. Scindia’s cavalcade was over a kilometre long, mostly comprising youths. Police were deployed in strength all along the route. In the morning, a few posters of Scindia put up by BJP had been blackened by unknown miscreants. Police were taking no chances.

Cops deployed at the airport had a tough time controlling the crowd. He reached state BJP headquarters at 6.40pm.

Title: HC reserves order on allotting land to the poor from other places in capital
Content:
Vijayawada: The high court on Thursday reserved orders in a batch of petitions challenging the allocation of house sites to landless poor from other places in the capital city area.

While the petitioners argued that the allocation of house sites to people from Vijayawada, Mangalagiri, Tadepalli and other villages is illegal and in violation of Capital Region Development Authority ( CRDA ) Act, the state government argued that there is no prohibition on allotting lands to the poor according to the Act.

Arguing on behalf of the petitioners, former advocate general Dammalapati Srinivas contended that the five per cent land reserved from the total extent of land taken under Land Pooling Scheme (LPS) is for future use. It was to provide affordable housing to the poor people who will migrate to the capital over a period of time, but the state government is trying allocate the land at one go that is against the spirit of the CRDA Act.

Senior counsel Ashok Bhan argued that GO 107 issued to allot lands to the poor in capital city area is illegal and ultra vires as it not only violates the CRDA Act but also defeats the purpose of LPS under which the farmers had given their lands for the construction of the capital city. Moreover, the five per cent land reserved is for the purpose of providing housing to the poor people residing in the capital city area and not those from other areas. He further said if the state government wants to allot lands to the people, it can do so outside the capital city area.

One of the petitioner’s counsel Karumanchi Indraneel Babu observed that the definition of poor people mentioned in CRDA Act should be interpreted with the LPS and cannot be seen in isolation. The state government cannot allot lands to people from other areas as the definition of poor has to be interpreted as it was done in case of land owners in the capital city area. He further said that the zonal regulations prescribed in CRDA Act do not allow to provide house sites not less than 100 sq metres.

Arguing on behalf of the state government, advocate general S Sriram said there is no prohibition in CRDA Act that bars the government from allotting lands to poor people from other places. The decision was taken after a series of consultation by Krishna and Guntur collectors as there was no land available to allot in the urban areas, they requested the government for other suitable land.

Upon hearing all sides, the high court bench headed by Chief Justice J K Maheswari, Justice A V Sesha Sai and Justice M Satyanarayana Murthy reserved their order.

Title: High drama in Bengaluru, Jitu arrested on ‘rescue mission’
Content:
A video grab of minister Jitu Patwari being arrested by Bengaluru cops.

BENGALURU/BHOPAL: A Congress operation to ‘rescue’ the MLAs it claims are being held ‘hostage’ by BJP at a resort in Bengaluru led to high drama as minister Jitu Patwari was arrested, following a scuffle, when he tried to enter the resort.

In Bhopal, senior Congress leaders Digvijaya Singh and Vivek Tankha held a press meet to show dramatic videos of Jitu being “shoved around” and led into a police bus, and condemned the police action. Tankha said Congress could move Supreme Court as it was now an “inter-state, even national issue”.

Patwari and minister Lakhan Singh had gone to the resort along with Narayan Choudhary, father of MLA Manoj Choudhary who is one of the 19 legislators cooped up in the resort. Patwari is a relative of Manoj. Digvijaya and Tankha showed videos of how Patwari, Lakhan and Narayan Choudhary were allegedly manhandled by police, bodily lifted into a police bus and taken away. Choudhary is seen in the videos in a pair of swimming shorts and with a towel around his neck.

“This is a case of abduction and forced captivity,” Tankha, an eminent lawyer, said. “You abduct and take our MLAs to a different region, and hold them hostage. They cannot even contact their families as their mobile phones have been taken away. They are not there out of free will. A BJP delegation, led by senior leaders takes resignations from MLAs on Holi and returns to Bhopal to submit them to the Speaker. No one knows under what circumstances these resignations were taken from our MLAs,” he said.

In a video of the incident, which was widely shared, Patwari is seen trying to enter the resort, while policemen are preventing him. It also shows the minister in a heated argument with police.

Karnataka Congress condemned the police action and demanded an apology from chief minister BS Yediyurappa. “Karnataka police’s act of arresting a Madhya Pradesh minister, who had come to convince the Congress legislators who are in Bengaluru, is condemnable. Goonda behaviour of Karnataka BJP government is not right, they should be released immediately, and chief minister BS Yediyurappa has to apologise for the mistake,” state Congress tweeted.

Nineteen legislators, loyalists of Jyotiraditya Scindia, in a letter to Karnataka DGP and IG had said they had come to Karnataka “voluntarily” on “important work”. All 19 had tendered their resignations on Tuesday, pushing the Kamal Nath-led Congress government in MP into a crisis.

Bengaluru police commissioner Bhaskar Rao told TOI that his force arrested Patwari under IPC 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharging duty).

“The MLAs from MP had given a written requisition saying some politicians from their home state were flying down to meet them and they don’t want to meet anyone. So we set up a police force outside the place. Jitu Patwari not only tried to enter forcibly, but also manhandled police trying to stop him,” Rao said.

Later in the evening, Patwari and newly appointed KPCC president DK Shivakumar held a press briefing, accusing city police of acting on behalf of the ruling party and not even allowing family members meet “kidnapped” legislators from MP.

“It is possible that a few people are trying to put psychological pressure by putting forth the image of Jyotiraditya Scindia. But why are you (MLAs) trying to sacrifice the people’s mandate? I urge my family of Congress legislators to not fall into this trap of the BJP,” said Patwari.

Patwari said they were there only to meet the legislators and not to take them back. “How can two of us forcefully take them back?” he asked, alleging that police were being used by BJP to “unlawfully confine Congress legislators”.

Shivakumar, said he was not involved “in any way” with the MP crisis and was only helping his “friends, leaders and colleagues” from the Congress.

Title: Telangana: 14 months on, promoted IPS officers await new postings
Content: HYDERABAD: Over a dozen IPS officers have been promoted, but continue to languish in their current postings for the past 14 months. Promotion followed by a transfer is the norm, but in Telangana it went for a toss. For instance, an additional director-general of police-rank officer should report to director-general of police (DGP), but now reports to another Additional DG-rank officer.The last major reshuffle of IPS officers took place exactly two years ago. The state government transferred and gave new postings to 38 IPS officers, including incumbent commissioners of Hyderabad and Cyberabad on March 11, 2018. Subsequently, several officers had been promoted, but they were retained in their current posts despite some posts remaining vacant due to superannuation or central deputations.In April, 2019, the government had promoted 23 IPS officers of the 2004 & 2005 batches. IPS officers S Chandrasekhar Reddy, SP of Sangareddy, AR Srinivas, DCP West Zone, and V Shiva Kumar, SP Intelligence, VB Kamalasan Reddy, commissioner of Karimnagar, Avinash Mohanty, DCP of CCS, Hyderabad, P Viswa Prasad, DCP, Central Zone, and M Ramesh, DCP, East Zone, were promoted as deputy inspectors-general (DIGs) of police and retained in their postings.After their promotion and in the rank of DIG, some of them were working as Joint CPs in Hyderabad commissionerate holding in-charge DCP posts. Similarly, the 2001 batch IPS officers G Sudheer Babu, Rachakonda joint commissioner, P Pramod Kumar, Karimnagar, DIG, T Prabhakar Rao, DIG, Intelligence, Akun Sabharwal, Civil supplies commissioner and director of enforcement (P&E), were promoted to the rank of inspector general (IG) of police. Sudheer Babu was posted as additional commissioner in Rachakonda commissionerate, where the CP too is an IG-rank officer. Pramod Kumar has been posted as IG of CID and he is also holding additional charge of DIG Karimanagr. Prabhakar Rao has been retained in intelligence as an IG. After Akun Sabharwal went on central deputation, the posts he was holding were filled with IAS and retired IAS officers.After the superannuation of two IGs, who were working as Additional CP, Admin, and CAR, in August 2019, Additional CP, Crime, Shikha Goel and Additional CP (L&O) DS Chauhan were holding additional charge of these posts. Shikha Goel of the 1994 batch has been promoted to the rank of Additional DG in April 2019, but she still continues to work as additional CP in the Hyderabad commissionerate.Though several officers of 1994, 2001, 2004 and 2005 batches were still waiting for new postings, the government recently empanelled nine IPS officers of the 2002 and 2006 batches for promotion to IG and DIG ranks.“Initially, festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi and then a series of elections forced the government to stall them. Now, the assembly is in session. Hopefully, the new postings that match our ranks will be given after the budget session. Otherwise, Ram Navami and Hanuman Jayanthi bandobust duties might become priority,” an IPS officer said. After DCP, South Zone, Ambar Kishor Jha went on central deputation, the post is being held by in-charge officers, already burdened with work from their assigned posts. Ramagundam commissioner V Satyanarayana is the in-charge DCP, South Zone. Cyberabad joint commissioner post has been lying vacant for the past few years.
