Title: Gujarat police to get 9,000 body cameras
Content:
File photo of a body camera worn by a policeman in Hyderabad

GANDHINAGAR: Gujarat police is set to go high-tech, as minister of state for home Pradipsinh Jadeja announced that the state will soon acquire body cameras , tasers and an anti-drone system for the police.

Replying on the demands of the home department in the assembly, Jadeja said the government is set to acquire 9,000 body-worn cameras which will help police to record altercations and interactions with citizens. He further said that 8,000 such cameras will be given to field officers.

Jadeja said that after the visit of US president Donald Trump, it was decided to get ultra-modern equipment. Gujarat Police will also acquire an anti-drone system to strengthen its air surveillance.

Jadeja said the department has also decided to acquire tasers to control suspects. These devices make the subject unconscious without injuring them. Jadeja said Gujarat will become the first Indian state to acquire tasers. The home department will also acquire 1,000 simcard-enabled cameras for crime detection.

Jadeja said under the Viswas project, 34 district headquarters, six religious places and the Statute of Unity have CCTV networks for traffic management and crime monitoring. He said the government has decided to have a police commissionerate in Gandhinagar and plans to bring in a new law to control anti-social elements.

Senior Congress leader Shailesh Parmar said, “Law and order in the state is deteriorating.” Quoting figures from the National Crime Record Bureau, he said that compared to 2017 there were 18,799 more IPC cases, a 14.6% increase. He said the crime rate in Gujarat was 4.7% in 2018, higher than states like Chhattisgarh (1.9%) and Andhra Pradesh (1%).

He said the crime rates in Gujarat cities was also high. The crime rate in Surat was 5.7% and in Ahmedabad was 5.3%. This was higher than cities such as Lucknow (3.2%), Kolkata (3.6%) and Chennai (3.7%). He said in Ahmedabad city there were 12,381 more IPC cases in 2018 than in 2016, a 75.57% increase. In Surat the increase was 11,322, a 57.06% increase in two years.

Title: Coronavirus in Delhi: Scared, patients give hospitals a miss
Content: NEW DELHI: Dr Sushil Sharma of Kailash Super Speciality Hospital in Noida was headed for a busy schedule this week with four joint replacement surgeries lined up over four days in addition to emergency cases. But, as the novel coronavirus scare grew, all four surgeries got cancelled.“Some patients were upfront in stating their scare of getting infected in the hospital while the others requested for postponing the surgery on some pretext or other,” Dr Sharma, a senior orthopaedic and joint replacement surgeon, told TOI.A doctor at Sir Ganga Ram Hospital (SGRH) said people were hesitant to come to Delhi for planned surgeries or follow-ups as they had heard about the viral cases in the city. “Last month, too, many patients postponed routine surgeries and follow-ups due to the riots. Now people don’t want to travel due to the novel coronavirus scare,” said Dr Amrendra Pathak, a senior urologist.Dr Yash Gulati, consultant orthopaedic surgeon at Apollo Hospital, also said he had seen a nearly 20% decline in the OPD footfall. “People are mostly scared of air travel,” he added.Cataract and gallbladder removal, and weight loss and cosmetic surgeries have been affected the most by the scare. Dr Sunil Choudhary, chief of Max Institute of Reconstructive, Aesthetic, Cleft and Craniofacial Surgery, said the demand for planned cosmetic surgeries such as rhinoplasty, commonly known as nose job, had gone down by nearly a half. “I think it is okay. Right now, our focus should be on containing the outbreak and for that people should avoid travelling for surgeries that can be postponed. But they shouldn’t neglect ill health or delay important surgeries,” he said.Big corporate hospitals are screening patients at their entrance for any symptom of the virus. They are also providing hand sanitisers at the entrance. But the fear remains. “I used to see at least 50 patients daily. But it has dipped by nearly 40% over the past two-three days,” said Dr Anoop Misra, chairman of Fortis C-Doc.Even AIIMS isn’t spared. Dr A K Bisoi, senior cardio thoracic and vascular surgeon, said there was a 30-40% fall in the follow-up cases. “Surgeries haven’t gone down here but we have come up with measures to ensure there is no crowding. All patients are called only a day or two before the surgery so that the wait period isn’t long. Extra precaution is also being taken to implement hand hygiene and other safety measures,” he said.While routine surgeries and follow-up for chronic conditions can be postponed, many people with emergency may still need to go to the hospital. Dr A S Soin, chairman of Institute of Liver Transplantation and Regenerative Medicine, Medanta-The Medicity in Gurgaon, advised both patients and their attendants to avoid crowded areas while visiting hospitals. “They should also sanitise hands after using human touch points and and make sure that the hospital is following cleaning procedures during tests,” he said.Dr Soin emphasised that hospitals should clean the common touch points and floors in every four to six hours and train all healthcare workers to practise hand hygiene.

Title: Hyderabad: 30-year-old sexually assaults calf, arrested
Content:
Representative Image

HYDERABAD: A 30-year-old man was arrested by Narayanguda police on Thursday for raping a nine-month-old calf at a cattle shed in Avanti Nagar, Hyderguda.

The incident took place on Wednesday night, but came to light the next day after police registered a case against the man, identified as Mahesh.

“I caught Mahesh committing the crime and immediately informed the police as well as People For Animals (PFA) and Greater Hyderabad Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (GHSPCA). This is not the first time that such an incident has occurred in this cattle shed. This has been happening for over a year now. We tried contacting the shed owners, but in vain,” an eyewitness told TOI.

The Narayanaguda police booked Mahesh under Section 377 (unnatural offences) of IPC and sent the calf to a veterinary hospital for examination. The accused has also been taken to Gandhi Hospital for a potency test.

“We have initiated investigation into the case and are trying to contact the owners of the cattle shed. We can produce the accused in court and seek custody only after we receive the reports from the hospitals,” said sub-inspector Narayana.

Title: Bhopal: BJP presses for floor test on March 16
Content:
Representative image

BHOPAL: Amid political turmoil in Madhya Pradesh, the BJP will press for a floor test on March 16, the inaugural day of the state’s budget session. The move comes in the wake of 22 Congress MLAs, siding with Jyotiraditya Scindia and resigning from the assembly, leaving the incumbent Kamal Nath-led Congress government in deep crisis.

“The Congress government is in minority. We are going to request the Governor and the assembly Speaker for a floor test on March 16 when the state budget session begins,” said BJP’s chief whip in the state assembly, Narottam Mishra , on Thursday.

Mishra said the Governor and the Speaker have the resignations of 22 MLAs. Now it is up to them to take a call. “The floor test should be conducted ahead of Governor’s address as, the state government for whom Governor will address the House has been rendered into a minority with the recent crisis. The Kamal Nath-led MP government must prove its numbers before the budget session begins on March 16,” he asserted. Mishra also challenged Congress leader Digvijaya Singh to prove majority in House and claimed that the BJP will successfully form a government in eight to 10 days.

Former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said, “We have nothing to do with the internal crisis in the Congress. But, the Kamal Nath government has lost the majority and it should resign. I had also quit the government in 2018 when my party couldn’t garner support of seven MLAs.” BJP leader Bhupendra Singh , who handed over the resignations of 22 Congress MLAs also called on Speaker NP Prajapati and urged him to take early decision on the same. “MP government has reduced to a minority, CM Kamal Nath should immediately quit the post,” he said

On Thursday, Governor Lalji Tandon also arrived in the state capital from his vacation.

Meanwhile, Speaker NP Prajapati has served notice to 13 MLAs seeking clarification on their resignations. “I have given notice to seven MLAs on Wednesday and six MLAs on Thursday seeking verification on their resignations. I have asked them whether they have personally and willingly tendered resignations or under duress. I am bound by the rules and work as per the established procedure,” said Prajapati.

Title: ‘With Shivraj & I, It’s Ek Aur Ek Gyarah’
Content:
BJP leader Jyotiraditya Scindia being welcomed by party workers on his first visit to Bhopal.

Bhopal: A royal greeting at Bhopal airport and the welcome of a conquering hero at the BJP head office in Bhopal — Jyotiraditya Scindia’s homecoming as a saffron leader was as grand as it could be on Thursday.

Nearly 5,000 supporters thronged the airport for a glimpse of ‘Maharaj’, and swarmed all over his SUV. Scindia had to step out and walk half a kilometre to the main road, surrounded by cheering supporters.

The boisterous welcome stretched all along the 20km route to the BJP office, where it reached a crescendo. The man who had played a significant role in defeating BJP in Madhya Pradesh in 2018, was welcomed in royal fashion in the saffron camp that now sees itself within touching distance of regaining power, thanks to Scindia’s defection with 19 Congress MLAs.

In his impassioned speech, Scindia laid out the reasons for his shock resignation from Congress. “When the Scindia parivaar is challenged,” he said, quivering with emotion, “We fight for morality and truth.”

“It is easy to target a party from outside but to criticise the party while being a member is very difficult. Being the head of Scindia family, I have to speak the bitter truth. In 1967, my grandmother had to quit Congress. In 1990, my father was charged in fake hawala scam and now, when I raised the issue of guest teachers, withdrawal of police cases against farmers, delay in agri loan waiver and warned to hit the streets if promises made in ‘Vachan Patra’ were not fulfilled, I was asked to ‘go ahead’,” he said.

“Being a member of Scindia family, I had to take decisions when I was challenged on morality and truth. Now I have handed myself to BJP and brought only one thing with me — and that is my hard work,” he remarked.

“Today is a very emotional moment for me. I consider myself fortunate that with the blessings of BJP president J P Nadda ji, Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji and home minister Amit Shah ji, the doors of this family were opened for me. I am dedicating myself to you, leaving the organisation with whom I spent 20 years,” Scindia told cheering BJP workers.

Praising former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Scindia said: “There are only two politicians who do not use air-conditioner in their cars — Shivraj and myself. When I and Shivraj join hands, then one plus one will become 11.”

Title: Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation to digitize birth and death records
Content:
Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (Ahmedabad Mirror)

AHMEDABAD: The rush for birth certificates at the civic body’s birth and death registration office, before officers verifying birth and death records for the National Register of Citizens (NRC) and the 2021 census come knocking at their doors, has led several of the fragile pages of the records to be reduced to tatters.

Small chunks of paper pieces lie strewn across the department’s floor, as they are repeatedly brought out for verification. The standing committee of the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation ( AMC ) on Thursday discussed the issue and decided to tender the job of digitizing the records soon. The department’s current staff can solve 20-odd queries a day; but queries have risen to 115 to 140 a day since mid-December.

Standing committee chairman Amul Bhatt said, “We will digitize the records very soon. This should have been done on priority.” Many of the records dating between 1932 and 1979 are stacked together and are now in poor shape. A senior official explained the complexity of municipal record-keeping. “Ward boundaries have changed with each election delimitation,” he said. For instance, prior to 1953, registers for Dariapur and Madhupura were one. Then in the 1960s, they were separated. Later, a new ward — Kazipur Dariapur — came into existence. Many of the records dating between 1932 and 1979 are stacked together are in tatters.

The lone peon, Jayanti Chanduji Thakore, 60, who knew about the records and sequence of indexing according to delimitation of wards spanning over eight decades retired in February and has refused to work for a paltry remuneration of Rs 5,000 a month. “I do help my colleagues back in office over phone who are still struggling with the records,” said Thakor.

Title: Coronavirus in Kolkata: Exam centres keep special rooms ready, schools suggest sanitizers
Content: KOLKATA: Several schools in the city have earmarked a room, where students down with cough, cold or breathlessness can take their exams, monitored by medical officers. This is one of the various measures that educational institutes have been taking in view of nCoV concerns among students and parents.The Higher Secondary examinations started on Thursday, while both the CBSE and CISEC Class-XII board examinations are also on.While many schools have deferred their parent-teachers’ meetings, one south Kolkata school has decided to send students’ annual reports by email and another institute has advised guardians, who recently travelled to foreign countries, to keep their children at home for at least a fortnight before sending them to school.The BSS School (BSS) has kept a room ready for examinees, complaining of cough, cold and breathing problems. “No one has yet complained of headache or sickness. But a separate room is allotted to anyone down with any disease. Every year, we come across cases of chickenpox or other seasonal diseases among examinees, for which the room is kept ready. We have allowed students to wear masks,” said BSS principal Sunita Sen. The headmaster of a school in Salt Lake has also allowed students to wear masks while writing their Class-XII board examinations.A senior official of West Bengal Higher Secondary Council, which is conducting the board examinations, said they had advised schools and exam centres to segregate students who turned up with cough, cold and breathlessness. “We have asked school authorities to keep a separate room for examinees down with measles or chicken pox. If need be, students with cough, cold or breathlessness can be asked to take the examination separately. Till now, we have received no information of any student who had to be separated due to cough or cold,” the official said. Some schools have kept hand sanitizers ready for candidates before they enter the examination halls.DPS Ruby Park, which is scheduled to reopen on March 19, will make wearing masks compulsory and students will be requested to carry hand sanitizers.Modern High School sent an email to parents, which stated, “May we also suggest that if any member of your household has recently returned from another country, that you keep your daughter home for a few days. However, please keep the school informed regarding her absence. This small precaution would make everyone feel more secure.”John Bagul, principal at South City International School, said the parent-teachers’ meeting was tentatively scheduled on March 27. “We are keeping a close watch on the development. We are considering whether we will email the results to the parents or not, should we want to avoid a gathering in school.”Several institutes, including La Martiniere and South Point High School, are conducting awareness workshops on coronavirus for teachers and suggesting preventive measures. Belle Vue Clinic internal medicine consultant Rahul Jain is holding several of these workshops, including the one at South Point on Friday. “This is a good way to reach out to teachers so that they can make their students aware. Viruses often spread from schools and we need to address the students and ensure they remain safe,” said Jain.

Title: Making the cut: Hyderabad kid designs soft toy for IKEA
Content:
Ayaan Ahmed with his certificate. (Below) The Eggplant Monster Car

HYDERABAD: This Hyderabadi is just eight years old and has given none other than global Swedish home furnishings retailer IKEA a design for its new soft toy – the Eggplant Monster Car.

Meet Ayaan Ahmed whose sketch has been developed into a soft toy that will be sold by the retail giant globally. Ayaan’s design is one of six designs selected by IKEA out of the 71,000 entries that poured in globally as part of the sixth edition of the annual IKEA Soft Toy Drawing Competition.

What also makes this feat of the Saidabad resident, who just got promoted to Class III at Mount Carmel Global School at Badangpet, more remarkable is that he is the first Indian kid whose design has made the cut in this contest.

The talented Hyderabadi boy took about two days to sketch the cute eggplant on wheels. “I love cars and brinjals so I drew the brinjal car,” said Ayaan.

Ayaan’s mother, Ramsha Khaliq pointed out that he developed his first brinjal car prototype when he was just three years old.

“When he was around three, his father got brinjal from the market. A fascinated Ayaan removed the wheels from his toy car and attached it to the brinjal and started wheeling it around the house,” Ramsha explained.

IKEA said the six shortlisted designs will be developed into real toys for its SAGOSKATT 2020 collection, a range of limited-edition soft toys designed by kids for kids and the entire sales proceeds will go to local charities that promote children’s right to play as part of its ‘Let’s Play!’ campaign.

Jorge Omar Santoyo Henaine, product developer for Children’s IKEA, said : “It’s a unique project where we involve children in product development. We go through every submission...and see if it can fit our collection. We are working together with our suppliers to bring it to life.”

Title: HC stays Navy’s ELF radar project
Content:
Hyderabad: The Telangana high court has ordered status quo on the Indian Navy’s extremely low frequency (ELF) radar project proposed to be set up in Damagundam reserve forest near Vikarabad. The HC made it clear to the state, the Centre and the Indian Navy that they cannot cut a tree till they file their counters on what they are proposing to do with the fragile ecosystem. The ELF project is being set up by the Eastern Naval Command.

A bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy wondered as to how the forest department could allow construction of a low-frequency radar in a forest area while hearing a PIL filed by Damagundam Forest Protection joint action committee.

Agreeing with the apprehensions expressed by S Spandana Reddy, the counsel for the petitioner, the bench directed the authorities to make sure that not a single tree is cut in the area till further orders. The CJ also asked the petitioner to make the revenue department a respondent to the case since it was they who allotted land to the project. “We understand defence of the country is crucial and an important aspect, but environment is also our concern,” the Chief Justice said.

Assistant solicitor general N Rajeswara Rao urged the bench to restrict the status quo for a few days, but the bench made it clear that it would remain there till the Centre and other authorities file their counters. The case was adjourned to four weeks.

Title: Gujarat: Cleric arrested for molesting minor girl
Content:
Representative image

SURAT: A 68-year-old cleric of a madrassa at Amod village in Bharuch district was arrested by police for sexually molesting a 13-year-old girl on Thursday.

Abdullah Wali Patel alias Abdullah Vora, a resident of Amod village, has been accused of sexually molesting the minor girl who attended the madrassa where he taught. The issue came to light when the girl informed her parents about his disgusting acts.

Amod police said the cleric had lured the girl by offering her chocolates on a couple of occasions and showed her obscene videos in his mobile phone. He used to touch her private parts, kiss her and made her perform oral sex.

SM Rathod, police inspector of Amod police station, told TOI, “The girl was afraid to go to madrassa due to sexual harassment by the maulvi. She was unable to complain to her parents against him. However, she decided to explain her ordeal by writing a letter to her parents. After going through the letter, the parents decided to lodge a police complaint against the maulvi.”

Rathod said the maulvi was picked up from his residence at Darbar Tekra in the village on Thursday evening. He has booked under IPC section 376(2) and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012 (POSCO).

“We are awaiting report of the medical examination of the girl from the government hospital. The maulvi will be presented in Bharuch district court on Friday,” Rathod added.

Title: YSRC gets its act together as BJP, JS dither to finalise candidate list
Content:
Vijayawada: A flurry of activities surrounded the returning and assistant returning officers’ offices on Thursday with about 150 candidates filing their nomination in Vijayawada.

Meanwhile, traffic congestions became common with campaign processions and rallies hitting the streets.

Vijayawada MP Kesineni Srinivas’s (Nani) daughter Kesineni Swetha filed her nomination from TDP for ward 11. A procession of TDP supporters accompanied her to Patamata, where she garlanded the statue of former chief minister NT Rama Rao and then headed to the returning officer’s office at Pantakaluva Road.

Apart from this, sitting TDP corporators were given another chance and around 43 candidates from the TDP and CPI, who have tied up for the local body elections filed their nomination on Thursday. CPM, which is contesting alone, also filed around eight nominations. CPI city secretary Donepudi Shankar is likely to contest from 56 division in the city. .

Meanwhile, YSRC filed the most number of nominations on Thursday. Party leaders in around 59 out of 64 wards filed nominations. The YSRC is likely to confirm the remaining names by Friday morning. Venkata Satyanarayana filed nomination as a YSRCP candidate from Ranigari Thota area.

As for Jana Sena and BJP, which are sailing together for the local polls, failed to finalise their list of candidates till Thursday evening. It was learned that while Jana Sena is preparing to file nominations from around 45 wards, BJP is demanding around 30 seats. Key leaders of both the parties conducted a row of meetings on Thursday and failed to come to a consensus. Interestingly, a few Jana Sena candidates are planning to file nominations as independent candidates if the party were to allocate their seats to the BJP.

The nomination process for municipal elections will end on Friday. Given that around 200 candidates are likely to file their nominations on the day, police have intensified security at returning and assistant returning officers’ offices across the city.

Title: PPP push can improve waste management in Mysuru
Content:
Representative image

MYSURU: The state government’s budget proposal to involve private agencies in solid waste management could help improve garbage processing in Mysuru, which doesn’t have enough facilities.

Mysuru produces over 500 tonnes of solid waste every day. Of this, only about 200 tonnes is processed.

The Mysuru City Corporation (MCC) already runs a compost plant with the help of an outside agency, but a bigger public-private effort is needed to improve the city’s processing capacity.

In his budget speech earlier this month, chief minister BS Yediyurappa said comprehensive solid waste management programmes should be developed in all urban local bodies with external aid. Feasibility and detail project reports would be prepared this year, he added.

If these plans materialise, MCC will be able to remodel an existing solid waste plant in Vidyaranyapuram . The site, spread over 19 acres, is managed by a Delhi-based firm. The lease has expired, but the government has asked the civic body to continue using the firm’s services.

The machinery at the site is outdated and its capacity is limited; it can treat about 150-200 tonnes of waste every day. MCC also runs a few decentralised units, but their capacity is as low as 5 tonnes.

Civic officials have proposed to open two more units in Rayanakere and Kesare and install modern machinery at Vidyaranyapuram but are yet to receive the government’s approval.

MCC commissioner Gurudatta Hegde said though the directorate of municipal administration had not yet issued any instructions for public-private partnerships, such arrangements could improve solid waste management.

Title: 2 complaints of rape filed
Content:
Ahmedabad: Two rape cases were reported in the the city on Wednesday, in the Ramol and Kagdapith police station jurisdictions.

A 16-year-old girl in Kagdapith was allegedly raped by a neighbour, who had promised to marry her. In the second case, a Class X student in Ramol was allegedly raped by a 17-year-old resident of her neighbourhood, who had allegedly threatened to kill her parents. In Kagdapith, the girl came into contact with, Farooqui Ansari, who worked at a hair salon. “The accused promised to marry her and took her to a hotel in Kagdapith and raped her. He had taken her to the same hotel twice or thrice,” said a police official. The girl’s parents later learned about the relationship. “Police have registered an offence of rape and under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO). We have arrested the accused,” said a police official. In the Ramol case, a Class X student was in a sexual relationship with a 17-year-old boy and got pregnant. “When her parents learned about the pregnancy, she told them that the boy had threatened to kill them (her parents) . We have registered an offence of rape,” said a police official. tnn

Title: Reject NPR, allow protests: Alliance against CAA to govt
Content:
Charminar: ‘Alliance against CAA , NPR and NRC’ passed a resolution demanding the state government to reject NPR and permit all types of agitation against CAA, NPR and NRC on Thursday.

The body’s convenor, Justice Chandra Kumar (Retired), presided over the meeting on Thursday. The meeting was attended by JAC convener Mushtaq Malik, senior Congress leader Mohammed Ali Shabbir, social activist Kirankumar Vissa, co-conveners of the Alliance Mohd Sadiq Ahmed, Sara Mathew and others. They also demanded that the government must form a state level peace volunteers committee to maintain communal harmony and peace in the state and withdraw all cases registered against the protesters.

A separate resolution was also passed demanding the Centre to withdraw the citizenship laws and conduct census as per the old procedure.

Title: Telangana poultry industry lost Rs 1,000 crore: Eatala
Content: HYDERABAD: Chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao on Thursday said in the assembly that there is no coronavirus case in Telangana. During a debate on the budget, the CM reaffirmed what health minister Eatala Rajender had said on Wednesday by asserting that there was no coronavirus scare nor any case. Rajender again reiterated that there was no coronavirus and the scare was only causing a huge loss to the poultry industry. “So far, the sector suffered a loss of Rs 1,000 crore. I also have a poultry business and I lost Rs 10 crore,” he said.The CM said a huge quantity of chicken and eggs get exported from Telangana to other areas. “Many big players, including former TPCC chief Ponnala Lakshmaiah, are in the poultry business. Nearly 24 lakh people in Telangana depend on the poultry sector either directly or indirectly,” KCR said.

Title: Owner clueless as Mysuru Urban Development Authority site changes hands
Content:
Representative image

MYSURU: Mysuru Urban Development Authority (Muda) has encountered another case of impersonation to gobble up a site from a beneficiary.

The incident has come to light after the owner of the site L Raje Urs knocked on the doors of Muda seeking khata. The site was allotted to him 26 years ago. Shock was in store for him as the property had exchanged several hands without his knowledge and now Muda is seeking police assistance to uncover the crime.

Meanwhile, Muda authorities are sceptical about the actual owner of the property as earlier too khata has been obtained using the photo of the complainant. Muda secretary MK Savitha said, “Raje Urs, who has been allotted the site, has come after 26 years seeking khata but as per our records, the khata has been issued and the property has exchanged several hands since 2004. This has happened nearly twenty years ago. We are checking the details after filing a police complaint.”

The 30x40ft site in prime Vijayanagar location was registered in 2001 after allotment in 1994. First it was sold to Nataraj, by a person claiming himself as Raje Urs, and then after his demise, his children obtained khata and sold it to Shobha, who in turn sold it to Muddaiah and then Kannumuddaih, who is currently in possession of the property.

Raje Urs wanted the site to be registered in his daughter’s name and he went to Muda only to realise that the site has been misused. Since the site was vacant Raje Urs thought it was still in his possession.

This is not for the first time Muda is encountering a case of impersonation and cheating. This is just another case that has come to light.

Title: Motorcyclist runs woman over, flees
Content: Ahmedabad: A man on a motorcycle hit a woman, carried her on the front fender for about 50 feet, ran her over and then fled, in the Prahladnagar area of the city on Tuesday. This incident was captured on CCTV camera, but the motorcyclist is still at large.According to the FIR filed with SG-2 Division traffic police, Gunjan Shah, 35, is an HR manager with Citrin Cooperman India LLP in Prahladnagar and a resident of Goyal Intercity on Drive-In Road. Her husband stays in the US.Shah’s brother, Harshal Bhatt, in the FIR stated that he had on Tuesday evening got a call from Shah’s colleague, Disha Shah, telling him that his sister had met with an accident when she was crossing the road in front of Shapath 5 in Prahladnagar.“When she was crossing the road to reach her car in the parking area, a speeding motorcycle hit her. She was carried on the front fender of the motorcycle but the man did not stop and kept riding,” states Bhatt.“He rode for about 50 feet and then she fell on to the road. The man then ran over her and fled. People rushed to her and took her to the side of the road. She was unconscious and was taken to a nearby private hospital,” adds the FIR.Bhatt told TOI that Shah had suffered fractures in her pelvis and left knee, for which she was operated on and is gradually recovering. She is hospitalized and will have to bear the pain for four or five months, he said.A police official of SG-2 division traffic police said they have got CCTV footage of the accident but have not been able to identify the accused so far.Police filed a case for rash driving, causing hurt by an act endangering the life or personal safety of others and causing grievous hurt, against an unknown man and began an investigation.

Title: Man gets lifer for killing wife
Content: Hyderabad: A man who had burnt his wife to death over dowry was convicted by a local court and sentenced to life imprisonment on Thursday. Few days after marriage, Ravi, who received Rs 50,000 as dowry, began harassing his wife, demanding an additional Rs 3 lakh. In September 2015, when kerosene accidentally fell on the victim, Ravi utilised the opportunity and set her ablaze. The woman later succumbed at Gandhi Hospital. TNN

Title: Bank of Buckingham canal in Indira Nagar encroached
Content:
Chennai: The Buckingham canal , which is being polluted by untreated sewage along its course on Old Mahabalipuram Road (OMR), is being encroached upon in Indira Nagar, Adyar.

A resident of the area said a landing wall on a portion of the canal’s bank was pulled down in parts and a wiremesh fence erected around the space where an earthmover and a truck are parked in the mornings. Once they move out, the place is ‘locked’ to stop the entry of people into the area, the resident said, adding that this was a blatant violation.

A Southern Railway official said it was originally proposed to lay a cemented road from the Kasturba Nagar MRTS station up to TIDEL park signal point, as part of the effortt to decongest the overcrowded Rajiv Gandhi Expressway (OMR). Already the road-laying work has been completed up to Indra Nagar station. However, the authorities were unable to remove the encroachments near the Tiruvanmiyur MRTS station due to which the road laying had to be given up.

When contacted, a senior Greater Chennai Corporation official said there was a proposal to create a walkway along the stretch. However, the corporation had to get a clearance from the Public Works Department (PWD) before creating the walkway. The corporation wrote to the PWD in this regard for obtaining clearance. However, no work has been started on this stretch. On the OMR side, the civic body had put up a fence during the visit of Chinese President Xi Jinping to Chennai late last year.

When contacted, the PWD authorities said a letter had been received from the civic body which wanted to create a walkway. But, they have not issued any letter to go ahead with the proposal. An assistant engineers has been asked to inspect the spot and check if there is any violation. If confirmed, it will be removed, he promised.

Title: YSRC is wary of BJP, Sena, says Kalyan
Content:
Vijayawada: BJP state affairs in-charge Sunil Deodhar and Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan released the vision document for the local body elections in the city on Thursday.

Speaking to the media following the release, Deodhar said both YSRC and TDP are not committed to the development of local bodies.“TDP mocked the system by giving powers to unconstitutional ‘Janma-Bhoomi’ committees. YSRC is following in their footsteps by bringing the ward volunteer system. TDP did not conduct local body elections fearing defeat. YSRC is conducting elections unconstitutionally,” Deodhar said. He said he hoped that people would give a chance to the BJP and Jana Sena alliance.

Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan alleged that YSRC is threatening BJP and Jana Sena candidates and dissuading them from filing nominations. “The YSRC, which won 151 seats in assembly elections, is still afraid of going for local body polls. They are behaving high-handedly with opposition parties and attacking our leaders. The state election commission should take stringent action against YSRC goons who are attacking our leaders,” he said.

BJP state president Kanna Lakshminarayana said he has never seen a more unconstitutional election process in his 47-year political career. He alleged that the workers of the ruling party and preventing candidates of other parties from filling nomination papers.

Title: 4 Covid-19 suspects who left Mayo hosp traced, asked to return
Content:
Nagpur: The two men, a woman and a 4-year-old boy (and his mother), who allegedly left without permission from Indira Gandhi Government Medical College and Hospital’s (Mayo) Covid-19 isolation ward on Friday night have been traced, said district collector Ravindra Thakare. All had reported to the hospital with coronavirus-like symptoms. While the first three are from Nagpur, the mother and child are from Kerala.

Hospital sources said that the four were admitted to the isolation ward on Friday evening. They were all tested negative.

The woman, aged about 40, works as a domestic help at the house of the city’s first positive-tested patient who is also under observation in Mayo hospital. She was not among the 15 first-point contact of the positive-tested patient who were called to the Government Medical College and Hospital on Thursday for giving swabs.

The two men are not colleagues of the first patient as was reported earlier. One of them is 19 and the other 41 years old. They had recently travelled to Italy and Thailand.

The mother of the boy had travelled to The Netherlands and returned on March 6. She had come to attend a private function in city where the boy showed some symptoms. Her local contacts told her to go to Mayo and get a sample checked.

While the mother and child went back to the hotel they were staying, the other three were found at their homes.

“By Saturday afternoon, three of them have reported back to the Mayo Hospital while one of them, the cook, is on the way to the hospital. Their results are expected to come out by the evening,” said Thakare.

According to information available, all the patients told police that they were frustrated with the delay in knowing the status of their samples. “Also, being kept on the same floor as the first patient who has tested positive, they were apprehensive about contracting the virus,” said Thakare.

However, dean of Mayo Dr Ajay Keoliya said, “It is true that the suspects were staying in the same building where the first positive Covid-10 patient is under treatment. But, the patient is kept separately and those quarantined are in another area, even though on the same floor. There is no chance of contact or infection in this arrangement.”

Police said that the five left the ward one after the other around 10pm on Friday, claiming that they wanted to use the washroom and have tea.

The first patient's wife and colleague, who too tested positive, are in the isolation ward at the Government Medical College and Hospital. All three are apparently recovering well.

Zonal DCP Rahul Maknikar, who was on night rounds on Friday, said that the police were on high alert to trace the four adults and the child.

Meanwhile, city police chief BK Upadhyay said on Saturday that cops would help in escorting coronavirus suspects or positive patients but “will not directly intervene due to high health risks”. He did not want to comment on the issue of security breach at Mayo hospital on Saturday night.

Title: Another SMC officer lands in ACB net
Content:
Surat: With every passing year , the number of officers of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) landing in the net of Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) is increasing. The number of cases used to remain less than five earlier. However, 2018 witnessed seven and 2019 eight cases of bribe and disproportionate assets (DA) registered against SMC staffers.

On Thursday, ACB sleuths arrested Rajesh Patel, 48, assistant engineer in Katargam zone of SMC. He was booked by ACB sleuths on Wednesday. An inquiry for having disproportionate assets was initiated by ACB against him in 2016 after he was caught accepting a bribe of Rs25,000 on February 15, 2016 when posted as assistant engineer in Rander zone.

Patel, an officer of town planning department, had demanded the bribe to give positive report for a construction project on a plot of land. The complainant had approached ACB when he demanded the bribe.

"ACB initiates DA case inquiry against all those officers who are caught accepting bribe. We are currently inquiring against a few officers of different departments," said N P Gohil, assistant director of ACB, Surat. Inquiry against Patel was done by N D Chauhan, assistant director, ACB, Ahmedabad. The investigation has been handed over to S N Desai, police inspector, ACB.

ACB officers checked wealth of Patel amassed during six previous years before he was caught taking bribe. The period under inquiry was April 2010 to March 2016. During inquiry, ACB found that Patel's income from legally declared sources was around Rs54 lakh while his total expenditure and investments totalled around Rs1.38 crore. ACB found Rs84.74 lakh more wealth either in the name of the accused or his family members.

ACB officers checked details of salary, bank account statement, property documents, income tax details etc. The accused could not give satisfactory replies to ACB officers to their queries from where he amassed so much of wealth.

BOXES

Actual market value of the property is much higher

Top ACB officials said the actual worth of the property of the accused Rajesh Patel was much higher than recorded in disproportionate assets (DA) case. "ACB recorded the value of the property as per its jantri rate while the market value is much higher. If we estimate wealth of the accused as per market rate of the property, the accused has amassed huge wealth," said Keshav Kumar, director, ACB Gujarat.

Accused nabbed while on duty

ACB officials decided to nab Rajesh Patel during early hours of Thursday. Patel was supervising a demolition work in Katargam when ACB team nabbed him. "We decided at night to arrest the accused. We planned during early hours of Thursday how to make a clean arrest. ACB wanted to arrest the accused soon after registering the complaint to ensure that he doesn't get a chance to escape," said an ACB officer.

Photo Quote (use Keshav Kumar's photo)

"ACB has made disproportionate assets cases worth Rs26 crore in 2019-20. We are plugging all escape routes of the accused caught with money made through corruption," said Keshav Kumar, director, ACB.

"We have vigilance cell in SMC to take preventive measures in corruption cases. We take strong action against those officers caught taking bribes,'' said Banchhanidhi Pani, municipal commissioner, Surat

Title: ‘Not sure if my brother can fly in from Jeddah to look after mom’
Content:
There are situations and eventualities that one can plan for. And, there are developments that are unforeseen. What’s happening now, in India and rest of the world, is somewhere in between.

When I left the US for Kolkata on March 3, novel coronavirus was very much on my mind. Normally, I wouldn’t have travelled amid such uncertainty. But this was an emergency trip. My mother , who lives in Lake Town , was unwell. Before leaving my home in Connecticut , I read up on Covid-19 as much as I could and followed the regimen on the flight. Whenever I went to the washroom, I washed my hands thoroughly with soap and applied hand sanitizer on returning to the seat.

In Kolkata, I have been busy doing the rounds of hospitals with my mother for check-ups. She is a bit better now and I am scheduled to leave on Sunday. My younger brother, who works and lives in Jeddah , was supposed to come over around March 22-March 23 and be with my parents till my mother’s health improved. His travel plan to India later this month is now uncertain. I don’t know whether airlines will continue to operate then or not and if he would be quarantined on arrival.

But now, everything is in a state of flux. The latest Government of India directive, restricting entry of foreigners and even overseas citizen of India (OCI) card-holders till April 15, means there will be a rush for Indians to return and foreigners to exit. Also, US president Donald Trump on Wednesday announced an embargo on flights into the US from Europe, other than the UK. So, there is a lot of uncertainty in travel at a time like this.

My flight is barely three days away and it is via Doha in Qatar. So I should be able to fly home. Also, since I am now an American citizen and work in the government sector, there is no pay-related issue. But the same does not hold true for those in the private sector. Three weeks of unpaid leave could put any family in huge financial stress, including uncertainty about payment of house mortgage and car loan.

(Kundu is in the law department in the state of Connecticut in the US)

Title: Sayra hanging: Teen killed self, SIT says
Content:
Ahmedabad: A special investigation team (SIT) comprising officials of CID (crime and railways) on Thursday said that the 19-year-old woman from Sayra village of Modasa taluka whose body was found hanging in the village was neither raped nor murdered.

The officials said that she had committed suicide.

DIG (crime and railways) Gautam Parmar, who headed the SIT, told reporters on Thursday that the woman was in a relationship with one of the accused in the case, Bimal Bharwad. Parmar said Bharwad had refused to continue with the affair, which led the woman to kill herself.

Parmar said that the woman had met Bharwad through her elder sister and another man — Darshan Bharwad — on December 14 or 15 last year. Bharwad was a married man who had also been in a relationship with the woman’s sister.

Parmar said that the woman had begun pressuring Bharwad to marry her, saying that she would reveal their relationship to her sister and his wife. Parmar said the SIT has found that the woman had called Bharwad 40 times and had sent 67 messages to him on December 31, asking him to marry her.

The SIT recovered the calls with the help of FSL experts; in some calls, Bharwad is heard abusing the woman, said Parmar.

Parmar said that the woman called Bharwad on January 1, 2020, and told him to meet her. “He revealed this to the woman’s sister who advised him against the meeting,” Parmar said. “But the woman told Bharwad that unless he met her, she would tell his wife about the relationship. So he reached her village and picked up her up.”

Later, they both came to Modasa town where they argued for two hours. According to police, the woman refused to get down from Bharwad’s car. “So Bharwad called the woman’s sister,” said Parmar. “The woman did not relent even after her sister arrived on the scene. So the sister snatched the woman’s cellphone to determine if it had the number of Bharwad’s wife. The sister then broke the cellphone.”

The woman got down from the car to inspect her cellphone and taking the opportunity, Bharwad fled. Aggrieved, the woman boarded an autorickshaw to Sayra village. Parmar said that the woman may have hanged herself on January 4. Her body was found on January 5.

Parmar said that neither FSL reports nor the postmortem indicated rape or murder.

Content:

According to the FIR filed with SG-2 Division traffic police, Gunjan Shah, 35, is an HR manager with Citrin Cooperman India LLP in Prahladnagar and a resident of Goyal Intercity on Drive-In Road. Her husband stays in the US.

Shah’s brother, Harshal Bhatt, in the FIR stated that he had on Tuesday evening got a call from Shah’s colleague, Disha Shah, telling him that his sister had met with an accident when she was crossing the road in front of Shapath 5 in Prahladnagar.

“When she was crossing the road to reach her car in the parking area, a speeding motorcycle hit her. She was carried on the front fender of the motorcycle but the man did not stop and kept riding,” states Bhatt.

“He rode for about 50 feet and then she fell on to the road. The man then ran over her and fled. People rushed to her and took her to the side of the road. She was unconscious and was taken to a nearby private hospital,” adds the FIR.

Bhatt told TOI that Shah had suffered fractures in her pelvis and left knee, for which she was operated on and is gradually recovering. She is hospitalized and will have to bear the pain for four or five months, he said.

A police official of SG-2 division traffic police said they have got CCTV footage of the accident but have not been able to identify the accused so far.

Police filed a case for rash driving, causing hurt by an act endangering the life or personal safety of others and causing grievous hurt, against an unknown man and began an investigation.

Title: Rebel MLAs held captive in Bengaluru: Mukul Wasnik
Content:
AICC general secretary Mukul Wasnik with MLAs from Madhya Pradesh at a resort on the outskirts of Jaipur on Th... Read More

JAIPUR: AICC general secretary Mukul Wasnik on Thursday alleged that Congress MLAs from Madhya Pradesh have been held captive in Bengaluru.

Their mobile phones have been taken away and they are now incommunicado, Wasnik said, adding that the party is now exploring the option of approaching the court for their release.

He also alleged that Bengaluru police did not allow Narayan Singh, father of Manoj Chaudhary, an MLA in the Scindia camp now in Bengaluru, to meet him. Even family members were not permitted to meet the MLAs, which is denial of individual freedom, he said.

Wasnik said ministers Jitu Patwari, Lakhan Singh, and Chaudhary’s father went to Bengaluru to meet the MLAs, but they were beaten up by police and BJP workers. He said Lakhan and Patwari were put under police custody for hours.

The MP Congress unit has kept its fingers crossed with no headway in contacting the rebel MLAs loyal to turncoat Jyotiraditya Scindia in Bengaluru. As many as 85 MLAs in the Congress camp have been shifted to two luxury resorts in Jaipur after a faction of 22 MLAs led by Scindia announced their resignation from the party.

The Congress leaders, while exuding confidence in the survival of the Kamal Nath government, did not disclose the exact number of MLAs in their camp in Jaipur.

AICC general secretary Sanjay Kapoor said, “We will prove our numbers when the time arrives. We have enough numbers to save the government.”

The MLAs staying at the Tree House resort were taken out for lunch at the Buena Vista resort during the day.

MLAs Ashok Kumar and Sunil Saraf in a brief interaction with media strongly condemned the horse-trading tactics adopted by BJP claiming that they are united and will defeat the designs of the BJP.

The state Congress leaders were conspicuous by their absence during the day as they were busy with the ongoing assembly session.

Title: ‘Diabetics need to be extra alert of coronavirus’
Content: NEW DELHI: In the midst of the novel coronavirus scare, persons with diabetes should be extra careful about their health. They should maintain good glycaemic control (blood sugar level), which helps in reducing the risk of infection and also the severity of complications. “Good glycaemic control may also lessen the chances of secondary bacterial pneumonia, a key complication of Covid-19,” says Dr Anoop Misra, chairman of Fortis C-Doc Hospital. He, along with a group of experts, has authored a research on clinical consideration for patients with diabetes in times of Covid-19 epidemic.The research paper states that attention to nutrition and adequate protein intake is important. “Exercise has been shown to improve immunity, though it might be prudent to be careful and avoid crowded places like gyms or swimming pools,” the research, published in Diabetes and Metabolic Syndrome – Clinical Research and Review, adds.It stresses on the need to follow general preventive measures, for example handwashing with soap and water, practising respiratory hygiene and minimising contact with an affected person.In case a person with diabetes gets Covid-19, the advisory suggests authorities should be notified immediately. “Majority of patients have a mild disease and can be managed at home. Hydration should be maintained and symptomatic treatment can be given,” it adds.According to the experts, hospitalised patients with severe disease need frequent blood glucose monitoring.The guidelines on preventing and treating Covid-19 among diabetics is important. According to a study published in The Lancet recently, the lifestyle disease is the second most common co-morbidity affecting 19% of Covid-19 patients who require admission. The same point has been stressed upon in the report of the WHO-China Joint Mission on Covid-19.Dr Aparna Jaswal, additional director, cardiology and electrophysiology, Fortis Escorts Hospital, said those suffering from co-morbidities such as diabetes and heart disease may benefit from supplement of Vitamin C.

Title: Actor Vijay earned Rs 50 crore for Bigil, Rs 80 crore for Master, say I-T officials
Content:
Vijay

CHENNAI: Searches at actor Vijay ’s residence ended on Thursday, Income Tax investigation officials said, adding that they checked his accounts and got details about his remuneration from two of his movies.

“We found that the actor has shown as salary Rs 50 crore from ‘ Bigil ’, which was a box office hit, and Rs 80 crore from ‘Master’, which is yet to be released. We found that the actor paid taxes for the salaries received for both movies and we have no questions on this,” a senior I-T official told TOI.

The searches started at Vijay’s residence, at the office of AGS Entertainment, which produced ‘Bigil’, and at financier Anbu Cheziyan’s residence on February 5. “Though we have completed the searches, we are yet to complete our examination of the documents and other papers which we seized from various places belonging to the three assessors,” said the official.

A preliminary examination of the documents, however, raised doubts about the investments made by the actor and his family members, he said. “We have started examining the documents and accounts of the actor and his family members. There are questionable investments on which tax will be raised.”

The searches began after the department found a common thread among all the entities following the success of ‘Bigil’ which collected around Rs 300 crore.

“About 38 premises of the [AGS Entertainment] group were covered in the search and survey operation spread over Chennai and Madurai. The highlight of the search is the seizure of unaccounted cash of about Rs 77 crore from hideouts and places at Chennai and Madurai, purportedly belonging to the financier Anbu Cheziyan,” said the official.

As part of the searches, I-T officials went to the shoot of ‘Master’ in Neyveli and took the actor with them. Vijay and his family members were questioned for not less than 20 hours. “Analysis of the accounts available at the office is on. Evidence of actual receipts and expenses, and remuneration paid to artists is under investigation.”

Title: Students change plan, return from Paris
Content: Kolkata: Arinjay Ghosh (24), who is doing his post-graduation in sports industry management at a reputable business school in Paris , was supposed to return to Kolkata on March 28. But with India imposing restrictions on incoming flyers and WHO declaring coronavirus pandemic , he advanced his dates so that he could be home by Thursday night.Along with Ghosh, 12 other students are returning to India.Ghosh said they learnt about the Indian government’s decision on Wednesday night. “We were advised (by the Paris school authorities) on Wednesday to return to our home countries. We were told we could appear for classes online from India and it would not hamper our academic session. As of now, the next semester, which was to be held in China, stands cancelled,” said Ghosh, who lives in Salt Lake Ghosh pointed out that flight fares had gone up—Rs 70,000 from the usual Rs 30,000—indicating how people were desperate to reach India.Another student, Ashish, who is returning to India, said, “I have been in Paris for the past six months. I feel relieved to be able to return home.”

Title: Senior diplomat falls ill, gets prompt medical treatment at Surat airport
Content:
Surat: Dr Deepak Vohra , senior diplomat and special adviser to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for a couple of African countries, was given prompt medical treatment after he complained of giddiness and breathlessness on landing here in Air India flight from New Delhi on Wednesday evening.

Dr Vohra, special adviser to PM Modi for Lesotho and Guinea-Bissau and also to Ladakh Autonomous Hill Development Council, Leh, was invited for a session at the launch of Young Leaders’ Council (YLC) chapter at Navsari Management Association (NMA) in Navsari on Thursday.

A few minutes before disembarking from the aircraft, Dr Vohra complained of giddiness and difficulty in breathing. Airport authorities were alerted by aircraft staff and immediately, a team of doctors checked his condition. He was then taken to Metas Seventh Day Hospital.

Dr Vohra told TOI, “I was feeling uncomfortable and had difficulty in breathing. Doctors at the airport checked my blood pressure and temperature, but it was normal. I was not breathing properly and it turned out to be stomach infection. The efficiency of the response was amazing. I went to Navsari at the launch of the YLC chapter and visited Dandi Memorial too. I will be flying to New Delhi on Friday morning.”

Dr Ashish Naik, deputy municipal commissioner (health and hospital), said, “Dr Vohra complained of giddiness and he was well attended to by the doctors at the airport. After primary treatment, he was allowed to go to the hotel.”

Title: Boy thrashed with chappal, father approaches CP
Content:
Surat: A city-based businessman has alleged that Umra police station officials did not take action against a person who had allegedly thrashed his 13-year-old son on Tuesday. He submitted a complaint to the city police commissioner on Thursday.

According to the businessman, his son had gone to his friend’s place near Vrijvasi apartment in Parle Point on Tuesday to play Holi.

While playing, the boy threw a water pouch which accidentally fell on a local resident Naresh Agrawal, who started hitting him his chappal (footware).

The businessman added that his son was so scared that he did not tell his family about the incident. It was through his friends that he came to know about the incident and then approached Umra Police to register a complaint against Agarwal.

“However, police did not register FIR against Agrawal of thrashing a minor and let go after preventive actions,” the businessman alleged. So he approached the police commissioner.

He also said that CCTV footage clearly showed Agarwal beating his son. Police had detained Agarwala and later released him on Wednesday.

Title: Gold worth Rs 60L seized at RGIA
Content: Hyderabad: Customs officials at RGIA arrested a man who arrived from Riyadh by Flynas flight XY 325 on Thursday and seized 1.4 kg gold worth Rs 60 lakh from his possession. While scanning the baggage of the accused, Customs sleuths found suspicious material. “The smuggler was carrying gold in the form of wire,” said a Customs official. tnn

Title: Subordinate stabs priest to death in Pattabiram church
Content:
Chennai: Police on Thursday arrested a man after he allegedly stabbed a 62-year-old priest to death inside a church in Pattabiram.

Police said Enos of Pattabiram, a retired employee of Combat Vehicles Research and Development Establishment at Avadi was a priest at a pentecostal church in Vallalar Nagar.

The incident came to light on Wednesday evening when a worker came to arrange things for prayer and switched on lights inside the prayer hall. He saw Enos lying on the floor in a pool of blood. Hearing his cries, people outside the hall came rushing in an took Enos to a private hospital where he was declared brought dead. They also alerted the Pattabiram police.

Enos’ body was sent for postmortem as he had stab injuries. The needle of suspicion fell on Moses, Enos’ subordinate at the church, as he went missing. He usually accompanied Enos to various places to organise prayers. Police launched a hunt for him. Police received a tip that Moses was attending a prayer at a church in Irumbuliyur and arrested him .

Interrogations with him revealed that Moses had a murder case pending against him at Sathyavedu, Andhra Pradesh. He had come to Chennai three years ago. Police said Enos is said to have rebuked him over some issue. Enraged, Moses might have stabbed him and fled the spot, they said. He was in possession of a knife he used for decorating prayer halls.

Moses was booked under murder charges and remanded in judicial custody on Thursday.

Title: One held with 200 grams of smuggled gold at Surat airport
Content:
Surat: A person travelling from Sharjah was nabbed by the air intelligence unit of the customs department at Surat airport with 200 grams of gold worth Rs 9 lakh on late Wednesday night.

Official sources said that the accused, identified as Sanjay Patel, a resident of Mota Varachha in the city, had arrived at Surat airport in the Surat-Sharjah flight on Wednesday night. Since his movements were suspicious, the sleuths of the air intelligence unit decided to scan his body and luggage.

Upon scanning, it was found that the smuggler had hidden the gold capsule covered with hard chemical sealant in his luggage.

Sources said that Patel had brought the gold to deliver it in Surat. There are many traders in Surat who pay the smugglers handsome amount to bring the contraband from Dubai.

Officials said that Patel was employed as a diamond polisher in a unit, but he had been jobless for the past three months. He was approached by one Kalpesh, who offered him Rs 30,000 for bringing gold from Dubai.

“The accused stayed in Dubai for five days and returned with the smuggled contraband on Wednesday night when he was held at the airport. The gold has been seized by the department and further investigations are going on,” said an official.

Title: CBI arrests I-T officer, inspector, CA in bribery case
Content:
Jodhpur: The Central Bureau of Investigation arrested an Income Tax officer and an inspector , posted in Nagaur on Thursday, along with a Chartered Accountant in a case of bribery involving Rs 4 lakh. They had demanded the bribe from a businessman from Nagaur to settle the matter pertaining to an undeclared income drawn by the I-T officials on the businessman.

According to the spokesperson ( CBI ), R K Gaur, a case had been registered on a complaint, against two Income Tax officers, an Income Tax inspector, all from the Income Tax Department, Nagaur; a Chartered Accountant and others.

“The allegations were that these officials of the Income Tax Department demanded a bribe of Rs 5 lakh from the complainant, through a Nagaur-based Chartered Accountant, for settling issues arising out of an Income Tax survey conducted by the Income Tax Department on the business premises of the complainant’s firms and his family members at Nagaur a few days back,” said Gaur.

After the verification of the complaint, CBI laid a trap and caught the Chartered Accountant Suresh Pareek, while demanding and accepting the negotiated bribe amount of Rs 4 lakh. After the investigation and interrogation of Pareek, an Income Tax officer Laxman Singh and an Income Tax inspector Prem Sukh Didel were also arrested by the CBI.

“Searches were conducted at the residential and office premises of the accused at 10 different places at Nagaur, Jaipur and Merta city, which resulted in recovery of incriminating documents,” Gaur informed. More officers of the department are on the radar of the CBI and more arrests cannot be ruled out followed by further investigation. Teams of CBI also visited the I-T office in Nagaur for investigation.

According to the sources, the survey at the business premises of the complainant had been conducted by the I-T officers on March 5 and 6 and a large income of approximately Rs 3 crore had been calculated by them as undeclared income. In order to weaken the case against the businessman, the officers had been building pressure on him demanding a bribe of Rs 5 lakh through the chartered accountant Pareek.

The harassed businessman brought the matter to the CBI and a trap was laid by the CBI sleuths on Thursday. As per the plan, the officers called the businessman at the residence of Pareek in Nagaur with the bribe amount and the moment he handed over the amount to Pareek, CBI sleuths swung into action, arresting Pareek and seized the money.

Title: Covid-19 scare in Telangana: Passport Seva Kendras flooded with passport applications
Content: HYDERABAD: Despite the Covid-19 cases being on the rise in the country and abroad, it has not affected passport applicants.The Regional Passport Office, Telangana could not find any decline in applying of passports for fresh/normal or tatkal categories.“ The coronavirus has not shown any impact on passport applicants,” a senior RPO official commented.A TOI correspondent visited one of the Passport Seva Kendras (PSKs) in the city and found passport applicants making a beeline in front of the PSK to get tokens.An applicant said, “A passport is an important key document.I would be able to travel abroad within 10 years (as per the passport validity) and the coronavirus outbreak will be controlled by that time.”

Title: Hotels occupancy takes a hit, drops by 60%
Content:
Surat: The travel restrictions imposed by many countries in wake of the global coronavirus outbreak has cast a dark shadow on the hotel industry in the Diamond City. The hoteliers said their occupancy rates is likely to plummet by 60% with the clients from domestic and international destinations cancelling or deferring their travel plans.

While the hotel occupancy is expected to go down by 60% across leading hotels, the impact on mid-sized hotels is likely to be more and drop could be over 70%.

The Southern Gujarat Hotels and Restaurants Association (SHARA) has said that the virus outbreak has dealt a big blow to the hotel industry in Surat. While the international clients have completely stopped visiting the city, there is a drastic fall in the domestic business clients from the diamond and textile sectors.

Vice-president of SHARA, Sanat Relia said, “Hotels occupancy is down 60% and are facing more cancellations from the overseas clients due to travel restrictions by their respective countries.”

Relia added, “Even the domestic clients are cancelling travel plans out of fear after the government imposed travel restrictions.”

According to Relia, there are about 50 hotels in the city including three five star hotels having total rooms at about 3,000.

“We have witnessed a slowdown in the business, especially new business from the international market. Cancellations are more from the Asian countries, Europe, Japan, China, South East Asia, Germany and US. About 80% of our new business has been affected,” said general manager of Surat Marriot, Amit Mehta.

General manager of Le Meridian, Prakash Parmar told TOI, “There is about 25% fall in the hotel occupancy due to coronavirus. Even our restaurant business has been affected by almost 50%, as people are avoiding large gatherings.”

Title: Uncertainty on China course
Content: Suprodip Das, who is pursuing a certificate course in advanced studies in Chinese from Beijing Language and Culture University, has come home in Bolpur on a break and is unsure when he can complete the course. He was to return on February 15 but now uncertainty looms large, with classes being suspended and travel restrictions in place. “I am not sure when classes would resume,” he said, adding online classes were being held. tnn

Title: Bike thief arrested
Content: Hyderabad: Task Force police arrested a thief and recovered two stolen bikes from his possession. The accused, Mohd Sameer, stole bikes at Vanasthalipuram and Adibatla recently. He was handed over to Vanasthalipuram police. tnn

Title: Coronavirus in Madurai: Bus conductors must avoid using saliva while issuing tickets’
Content:
Representative image

MADURAI: Conductors using saliva on their fingers while issuing tickets is a common practice. Taking into consideration the Covid-19 outbreak and its nature of spreading through infected fluid such as droplets, a consumer body has written to transport minister M R Vijayabhaskar to intervene and put an end to this practice.

While some government bus conductors issue printed tickets from point of sale machines, most government as well as private town and mini buses in cities and rural areas still use printed tickets. Though the conductor’s pouch has a provision to have a wet sponge for the purpose, saliva is still the preferred mode to wet the finger.

Executive director of Empower centre for consumer and environment education, research and advocacy A Shankar said that by touching their tongue for saliva while issuing ticket directly puts the conductor at risk of getting infected as they could be accidentally dealing with an infected person.

Conductors don’t have the opportunity to wash their hands while collecting the fare, handing over the ticket and balance to every passenger. “The unhealthy practice of touching their tongue with their fingers for every transaction also puts the commuters in the danger of getting infected,” Shankar said.

Title: Pandesara custodial death: Family shouted for help but police didn’t listen
Content:
Surat: The death of a 30-year-old man on Wednesday in the lock-up of Pandesara police station exposes police apathy since two family members lodged with him had sought cops’ help at least five times in a period of 12 hours. Family of the deceased alleged that police heard their screams only after the victim had died.

Deceased Vinay Yadav, his father Tribhovan, 60, and elder brother Vinay, 34, a disabled person, were nabbed from Balaji Nagar and brought to Pandesara police station at around 7.30pm after a brawl with their neighbour. The neighbour called police and the trio was detained and put in the lock-up at around 8.30pm on Tuesday.

"I told police not to keep Vinay in lock-up as he had breathing problem but they didn’t listen. I kept shouting throughout the night whenever Vinay told me that he was feeling suffocated,” Tribhovan told TOI.

"There were about 15 other people in the 10ft by 10ft size lock-up. It was difficult for even me to breathe since I am an asthma patient,” he added.

Tribhovan and Vinay began to scream when Vimal fell unconscious at around 7.45am on Wednesday. "Whole night police did not come. They came because of our screams in the morning and smashed the lock-up grill. We supported Vimal to stand up but he collapsed. He was declared dead by the paramedic of 108 ambulance," said Tribhovan.

"Police at night asked for Rs2,000 to release us when our relatives came to get us out on bail. We refused to pay the money after which they put us in the lock-up," said Vimal.

"There are CCTV cameras in police station and the lock-up. We will examine the footages to check whether the cops had gone to help the family members of the deceased after hearing their screams in the night. If they did not take any action despite requests, it is a case of negligence on the part of cops and they will face action," said J K Pandya, assistant commissioner of police, F division. Pandya has been handed over inquiry in the case.

Title: Bereft of bus sheds, Valpoi commuters soak up the sun
Content:
Valpoi: Besides the main Valpoi bus terminus, all bus stops in the village lack sheds, forcing people to wait for public transport in the sun and rain. Locals have now demanded that the Valpoi Municipal Council construct bus sheds, especially at prime locations, at the earliest.

“Presently temperatures are as high as 38 to 40 degrees Celsius, so its impossible to stand in the open,” president of the Valpoi Advocates Association Yeshwant Gauns said. He said that there is especially pressing need for a bus shed near the community health centre.

While Gauns said that the council should erect a shed at the spot at the earliest, another resident said that absence of a shed here means that patients, including pregnant women, people with infants and senior citizens, visiting the health centre have to suffer.

Residents, who board a bus near the Hathwada junction, said that there used to be a bus shed at the stop eight years ago, but it was demolished for road widening works. “Since then we are waiting for the authorities to erect one again,” locals said.

Chairperson of the council Akhtar Ali Shah told TOI that he would look into the matter.

Local Ashish Kanekar said that bus sheds is a long pending demand of the people of Valpoi. “During the monsoon we will plant trees at a few places so that there is at least some natural shade. However, we can go forward with the initiative only if landowners have no objection,” Kanekar said.

Title: Northern Railway tries to replicate airport’s pick-and-drop at New Delhi station
Content: NEW DELHi: Trying to replicate an airport-like model for ‘pick and drop’ vehicles at the Ajmeri Gate side of New Delhi railway station, Northern Railway has started a new ‘parking-cum-access control rights’ system, which aims to reduce congestion in the three traffic lanes by charging vehicles after lapsing of eight minutes.While commercial vehicles will be immediately charged Rs 30 when they enter the three lanes, non-commercial vehicles will have eight minutes to pick up a passenger, following which Rs 50 will be levied on them. If a car remains in the three lanes for more than 30 minutes — a fine of Rs 1,000 will be levied on the vehicle, which will then be towed away, officials said.Divisional railway manager, Delhi Divison, SC Jain told TOI that the model was designed keeping in mind congestion problems, as vehicle owners — instead of parking in the dedicated zone — would stop their vehicles in the ‘pick and drop’ lanes — leading to longer queues and congestion.“Our study estimated that in order to pick up a passenger, it only takes around two-three minutes. We have still given non-commercial vehicles up to eight minutes to enter the lane, stop and pick up/ drop a passenger. This is free of cost for them. Only after eight minutes they will have to pay,” said Jain.For non-commercial vehicles, meanwhile, the first eight minutes mean an entry fee of Rs 30, which increases to Rs 50 (8-15 minutes) and Rs 200 (15-30 minutes). Jain said there is already a dedicated fourth lane for pre-paid taxis which is not chargeable. “If a commercial vehicle wants to pick up a passenger, they can enter the lane and leave on time. If they stay longer, they will be charged for that. If one needs to stay longer, they can simply go to the dedicated parking zones where the rates haven’t changed,” said Jain.According to railway officials the model will be analysed for the next few months, the success of which may lead to a similar model being placed at the Paharganj side of the railway station. “No pickup and drop facility will be permitted beyond the 30 minutes and a vehicle so detected will be fined Rs 1,000 and towed away,” said an official.

Title: YSRC Formation Day celebrated
Content:
Vijayawada: The YSRC Formation Day was celebrated by party cadre on a grand note across the state. Party leaders combined their celebrations with their campaigns for the local body elections.

Advisor (public affairs) to the government, Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy attended the celebrations at the central office in Tadepalli and said the welfare schemes being implemented by chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy have proved to be an example to the neighboring states.

Meanwhile, Vijayawada Central legislator Malladi Vishnuvardhan participated in the Formation Day celebrations held in the city. tnn

Title: 6-yr-old raped & murdered in Jhalawar, accused arrested
Content:
Kota: A six-year-old girl, who had gone missing from her house on Wednesday evening, was raped and murdered allegedly by a tenant of her house under Jhalawar Sadar police station on Wednesday night.

The blood-stained body of the class 1 student was recovered from the house where the accused stayed, which is about 200 metres from her house.

According to SHO at Jhalawar sadar police station Sanjay Meena, her body with injuries over private parts was packed in a plastic bag and placed under a stone slab in the kitchen.

The accused is a truck driver and had fled from the spot after the crime on Wednesday night, but he was arrested on Thursday noon.

Prima facie, the minor girl was likely to have been chocked to death after rape with her, the SHO added.

The accused Lalchand Bairagi is a native of Nayagaun village under Soyatkanla police station of Agar district in Madhya Pradesh. He was a habitual drunkard and was living alone as his wife left him around four years ago, he said.

The minor girl had gone missing on Wednesday evening following which the family members initiated a search, but when they failed to locate her, they reached the police station at night. A police team, accompanied by the family members, searched for the girl and around 11pm they reached the house which the girl’s family had rented out to Bairagi. During the search in the rented house, police found the body, the SHO said.

The body was on Thursday morning handed over to family members after postmortem by medical board, he added.

Police booked the accused Lalchand Bairagi under sections of IPC and Pocso Act for rape and murder and nabbed him from Biriyakhedi mining area in Jhalawar on Thursday noon, the SHO said adding the accused is yet to be interrogated.

Title: Bharatpur police raids factory manufacturing arms illegally; arrests four
Content:
Representative image

ALWAR: In a major crackdown against illegal manufacturing of country made weapons, the Bharatpur police on Thursday unearthed a factory involved in manufacturing of arms and have seized 14 country made riffles and 57 partially manufactured arms. Police have also seized the equipments used in the manufacturing of these weapons. Police so far have arrested four persons in this connection while one of the accused managed to flee from the scene.

Mewat region is already been infamous for the illegal manufacturing of the weapons which is mushrooming on large scale.

Four teams of Bharatpur district raided at village Rundh Khoh under Khoh police station area. “We were getting specific inputs on the running of factory involved in the manufacturing of the country made weapons. The factory was identified with the help of drone camera and with the help of local inputs,” said Haider Ali Jaidi, Superintendent of police, Bharatpur.

Jaidi added that the area in which the factory was running is in jungle and is deserted. “In a planned manner the area was raided by our four teams equipped with arms,” he added.

The arrested accused were identified as Zerru, Shakeel, Shaukat and Mund all residents of Rundh Khoh area under Khoh police station.

“We have recovered a big haul of illegally manufactured weapons. All the accused would interrogated to find out if similar factories were running in this region,” he added.

Police will also interrogate the accused to find out their end customers. “These weapons were illegally manufactured and must be sold by people in the region. We will certainly break the nexus between the manufacturers and the end customers,” he added.

Title: Coronavirus awareness camps at footpath routes in Tirumala
Content: Vijayawada: To bring better awareness among visiting pilgrims to Tirumala and also to educate them on safety measures to prevent the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19), TTD is opening up three awareness and counselling camps at Alipiri and Srivari Mettu footpath routes, in addition to camps at the Alipiri toll gate on March 13, TTD Additional EO AV Dharma Reddy said on Thursday.After a high-level review meeting with all the heads of departments of Tirumala on coronavirus at Gokulam Conference Hall on Thursday, the additional EO directed all the HoDs to take up awareness and orientation programmes in their respective offices for their staff about the usage of masks, sanitisers, and the like to prevent the spread of coronavirus as most employees work in places where there is heavy movement of pilgrims.He also instructed SVBC to relay the promo on corona awareness and measures to prevent its spread frequently in the channel.
