He directed TTD health officer Dr RR Reddy and CMO Dr Nageswara Rao to lead the awareness campsArjitha seva advance booking ticket holders as well pilgrims who have booked accommodation in advance should postpone their date of darshan or cancel the tickets till May 2020 in view of coronavirus threat. “The amount will be refunded to such pilgrims. The devotees who have any doubts regarding the cancellation of tickets should mail dyeotemple@gmail.com for immediate response and the same information shall be passed on to call centre staff for guiding the pilgrims,” he said.Meanwhile, the TTD health department and medical wing are gearing up to make arrangements to run the awareness camps with enough paramedical staff and medicines, with the support of the engineering department.

Title: Terminal expansion project to be over by 2022: Aviation minister
Content:
Surat: Union civil aviation minister Hardeep Singh Puri has expressed confidence that the work to expand the terminal building at Surat airport will be completed by 2022.

Replying to a question raised by Darshana Jardosh, Surat MP, in Parliament on Thursday, Puri stated, “There is no change in the deadline of the terminal expansion project and that it will be completed by 2022. Surat airport has shown tremendous growth compared to other airports in the country and that the government is committed to provide all infrastructural and increased air connectivity to it.”

The expansion work of the terminal building is delayed as expert appraisal committee (EAC) of Union ministry of environment, forest and climate change (MoEFCC) has raised technical issues for grant of environment clearance (EC). Airports Authority of India (AAI) had filed for the EC in the first week of January 2020.

Jardosh told TOI, “The existing terminal building cannot handle passengers of more than three flights at one go. There is parking facility for only three aircraft at the airport. Looking at the tremendous increase in passenger traffic, there is an urgent need to expand the terminal building.

The foundation stone for terminal expansion project has already been laid but the work is yet to start. The civil aviation minister has promised that the expansion project will be completed by 2022.”

Title: Will serve Congress till last breath: Digvijaya Singh
Content:
File photo of Digvijay Singh

BHOPAL: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh filed his nomination for the Rajya Sabha at the state assembly building on Thursday.

Singh was flanked by Rajya Sabha MP Vivek Tankha , ministers Dr Govind Singh, PC Sharma and other state Congress leaders.

Amid political turmoil, chief minister Kamal Nath asked Digvijaya to file nominations for RS elections. Sources said, that Kamal Nath had got Digvijaya’s name cleared from AICC president Sonia Gandhi and did not want to delay till the official announcement of candidates from 24, Akbar Road.

Singh thanked AICC president Sonia Gandhi and the party leadership for giving him a second opportunity to represent the Congress in the Rajya Sabha. He said, “For me, position is not important, ideology and political credibility is.”

Digvijaya Singh said, “In my political career, I fought an ideological war and never compromised on it. There were efforts made to make me a member of the Bharatiya Jan Sangh , but when I saw their ideology, I knew it did not match mine. That is why I took membership of the Congress and till my last breath, I will work for the party.”

Later addressing a press conference at the state Congress office, Digvijaya claimed that the present crisis started after Scindia’s defeat in the Lok Sabha elections from Guna last year. He was hurt about the loss in the elections and then got in touch with Narendra Modi and Amit Shah. When state BJP leaders were told, they said they can bring down the government themselves. Hence, started the first encounter at the Manesar Hotel early this month. That operation was minus Scindia and led by BJP’s Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Narottam Mishra, Vishwas Sarang, Bhupendra Singh and Rampal Singh,” Digvijaya said.

Title: Gang rape survivor’s father murdered
Content:
Surat: A case of murder was registered against a group of men at Katargam police station on Tuesday for allegedly killing a 40-year-old man. The accused had stabbed the man and his son when they went to scold the accused who had allegedly gang-raped his daughter about six months ago.

The man was thrashed and stabbed about 13 days ago in Katargam area and he died during treatment on Tuesday. Police had earlier registered a case of attempt to murder against Jay Khokhadiya, Rakesh Khokhariya, Jitu Khokhariya, Lakshman Satiya, Ravi Basner alias Nepali and Kano Bharwad. The accused were arrested by police.

The 16-year-old daughter of the deceased had lodged a complaint of gang rape against the accused after her father was stabbed by them. Police investigation revealed that the man had gone to scold the accused when he came to know that they had gang-raped his daughter six months ago and used to harass her even now. A fight started and the deceased and his son were stabbed.

Title: 3 yrs on, Corlim unit awaits I-T nod to withdraw Rs 24k
Content:
Panaji: A manufacturing unit for corrugated boxes has been running pillar to post since 2017 trying to get clearance from the income tax department to withdraw a mere sum of Rs 24,000 invested with Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) for a group gratuity scheme.

The Corlim-based firm was run by two women entrepreneurs, but was shut down in 2004. The firm’s workers were paid all their dues and the balance amount of Rs 24,000 was left over with LIC.

“To release the funds, LIC sought an NOC from the income tax department to ascertain that there are no dues from the unit owed to the government. The application for the NOC was sought in 2017,” said a senior industry representative.

The firm and industry bodies intend to raise this issue at an outreach programme organised by the income tax department at the Goa Chamber of Commerce and Industry on Friday. The Centre has notified 'Vivaad se Vishwas Scheme 2020' to resolve pending tax litigation and disputed matters which remain unsettled as on January 1.

“This is a great opportunity for resolution of disputes related to direct tax for taxpayers. In order to encourage taxpayers to take benefit from the scheme, necessary guidance and help in understanding the scheme and assistance with procedural compliance for scheme is being readily provided,” an income tax department official said.

However, industry stakeholders feel that unnecessary compliances and red tape continues to plague the industry.

Title: Enforcement wing keen on rooting out cannabis trade; engg students ‘addicted’
Content:
Vijayawada: Around 0.2 percent people use cannabis products in the state. Curiosity and peer pressure have been attributed as factors for youngsters using various forms of cannabis.

The cannabis grown in tribal pockets of Visakhapatnam and East Godavari districts along the Andhra Odisha Border (AOB) are said to be the best weed in the national market next to Idukki Gold in Kerala. As per estimates, ganja growers in AP produce over 60 lakh kgs of weed a year and Vizag ganja has spread its market across the country.

As per the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment’s survey on Magnitude of Substance Use in India- 2019, Andhra Pradesh—with 0.2 per cent—is listed where illegal cannabis products (ganja, charas, and a few others) are used by the people in the state. The survey says that Sikkim with 7.3 per cent is listed as top in ganja consumption followed by Nagaland with 4.7 per cent, Odisha 4.7 per cent, Arunachal Pradesh 4.2 percent, Delhi 3.8 per cent. However, Vizag ganja was found everywhere in the country.

“We raided some private hostels in Guntur district and found students of engineering and management colleges were addicted to weed. They spend a good amount to procure the weed,” said Ch Prameela Rani, inspector of Prohibition and Excise Department.

The excise officials said cultivation, selling, buying and consumption of cannabis was illegal and punishable as per the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

Sharing concern on the prevalence of marijuana users among students and youngsters, Dr Uma Raju of Greenvalley Foundation in Vizag, which deals with substance-addicted patients, said the definition of happiness has changed for youngsters and some weed users claim that ganja is aphrodisiac. There was no study to establish that cannabis is an aphrodisiac, she added.

The youngsters are consuming weed in the form of cigarettes in Vizag and Vijayawada. Sometimes, they turn to ganja smugglers to meet their vices, said A Trinad Rao, a senior police officer with Task Force Wing.

“There is no data on ganja users and trends of consumption in the state. However, rooting out cannabis trade will be top priority with coordination between agencies,” said Vineet Brij Lal, Director of Enforcement, Prohibition and Excise.

Title: Covid-19 scare in Chennai: Footfalls down at city gyms, swimming pools
Content: CHENNAI: The all-pervasive fear of contracting the novel coronavirus has had a direct impact on footfalls in gyms and swimming pools. Prevention is better than cure seems to be the mantra.Swimming coach K K Mukundan said he noticed a dramatic dip in the number of children coming to his class. "We’re down by half," said Mukundan, who runs the Orca swim centre. Over the last few days, he has been sending videos to nervous parents explaining that the sport is safe.His is not a one-off case. The IIT-Madras administration sent out an email to its staff and students on Thursday that the gym was being "closed until further notice as a precautionary measure". At C3 Fitness Science, another gym in the city, staffer Christopher John has been wielding calls over the last few days from worried gym buffs."I’ve had to reassure them that the gym is not shutting down. But from our end, every precaution is being taken like disinfecting equipment at regular intervals," he said. John adds that while the younger clientele is still trooping in, the older members have stopped coming. "Our footfall has reduced by half," he said.Ajit Shetty of the Score Gym said rumours of Covid-19 is drowning out every other conversation. "In the last two weeks, handshakes and high fives have stopped. People are keeping to themselves."Dr K Kolandaswamy, director of Public Health and Preventive Medicine, said gyms or pools are not high risk locations. "Just maintain three simple rules of washing hands thoroughly in running water, cleaning and disinfecting surfaces that have been touched, and remaining at home for a few days if one has a cold, cough or running nose. Then it does not matter where you go or what exercises you do," he said.Former city health officer Dr P Kuganantham said the management at fitness centres and swimming pools needs to ensure there is no overcrowding. "At public pools, there is no check on the number of people. Exercising outdoors is always better, but at closed air-conditioned gyms, it is recommended that people take their own mats, towels and water bottles."

Title: Support Goa on mining in SC, Sawant urges PM
Content:
Panaji: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Thursday urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to file an affidavit in support in the apex court for resumption of mining activities in the state.

The matter is likely to come up for hearing on April 21. “The Prime Minister has assured to look into the matter,” Sawant said.

Sawant met the Prime Minister and had “a fruitful discussion on wide ranging issues” including mining, Mopa international airport, ZP polls besides various developmental projects.

Speaking to TOI, Sawant said that he briefed Modi on how mining is important for the state’s economy. “Union mines ministry has to file the affidavit. I have urged PM to do the needful,” he said.

The state government had filed a review petition on February 7, 2018, in the apex court against the order quashing second renewal of 88 mining leases and halting mining activities in state on March 15, 2018.

Two mining companies had approached the apex court for extension of mining leases till 2037.

The state government had maintained before the Supreme Court that the mining leases can be extended up to year 2037, as per the contention of the companies, but it would abide by the decision of the court.

The state government said that the mining companies had made a representation to the mines department contending that under the amendment to Section 8 (A) of the Mines and Minerals Development Act, they are entitled to extend their mining leases up to 2037.

The state government had said that the mining concessions which were granted by the erstwhile Portuguese regime were converted into leases under the MMDR Act with effect from 1987 and consequently, the 50-year mining leases as contemplated under Section 8 (A) would be extended up to 2037.

Title: Lok Sabha panel summons CS, DGP over MP’s security
Content:
Jaipur: Citing irregularities in the security of Rajasthan MPs, including Kailash Chaudhary and Hanuman Beniwal , the privileges committee of the Lok Sabha has summoned state’s chief secretary, Director General of police (DGP), Additional Director General (ADG), Intelligence and Deputy Inspector General of police (DIG), intelligence, and others to give their explanation. The officials are supposed to appear before the committee in New Delhi on March 17.

In November last year, Union minister of state for agriculture Kailash Chaudhary and MP Hanuman Beniwal faced an attack in a public gathering in Barmer. Both of them alleged that stones were pelted and assailants had also fired in air.

The committee of privileges at Lok Sabha has asked D B Gupta, chief secretary, government of Rajasthan, Bhupendra Yadav, DGP, Rajasthan police, Umesh Mishra, ADG(Intelligence), Sanjay Sotriya, DIG (Vigilance), Sharad Choudhary, then SP, Barmer, and Amit Dhaka, special secretary (administration) to the chief minister Ashok Gehlot to appear before the committee on March 17.

“It was an unfortunate incident. Till date no case has been registered by the Rajasthan police which shows that it was a planned attack. The privileges committee of Lok Sabha will take stringent action against the officers concerned,” said Narayan Beniwal, brother of MP Beniwal and MLA of Rastriya Loktanrik Party (RLP) from Khinvsar.

The RLP legislator criticised the attack and maintained that the Lok Sabha’s privileges committee will take proper action. “The incident has already shown that law and order is in worst shape in Rajasthan. The police role is also suspicious in this case,” said Indira Devi Bawri, RLP legislator from Merta.

Title: Women not safe, rape cases on the rise: GFP
Content:
Panaji: Pointing to the alleged abduction and rape of a minor girl at Quepem, Goa Forward Party’s women wing on Thursday slammed the state government for the rising number of crimes against women in the state.

Goa Women Forward’s (GWF) chief Ashma Sayed said that 39 cases of rape have been registered during the last six months, indicating that a woman is raped every five days.

“What is the point of saying women empowerment or women’s day when women are not safe? Women are not secure at all. What efforts are being taken by this government for the security of women? The government should take steps to curb this crime,” said Sayed.

She said that Goa Police’s presence in several hinterland villages is negligible and the lack of streetlights encouraged men to commit crimes against women.

“Our BJP women made a big noise about rape taking place in the capital. Why are they quiet today? Is it because the under trials of rape are in their party?” she said.

Title: Cong MLA from Jambusar receives threat call
Content:
Surat: Sanjay Solanki , Congress MLA from Bharuch’s Jambusar assembly constituency, allegedly received a threat call from an international number. The unidentified caller threatened the MLA on phone that his movements were being tracked and he will be killed anytime.

Sources said Solanki was returning to his house at Tankari village after attending a meeting in Jambusar on the night of March 9 when he received a call from an international number. The caller reportedly said, “I am following your movements. Wherever you go in the state, I will kill you.”

Solanki told TOI, “A few days ago, my family members had reprimanded a woman selling snacks outside the primary school for girls located in front of our house at Tankari village. She was throwing dirty water and leftovers outside the school and was asked by my family members not to do that. She started quarrelling with them over the issue and a complaint was given to police. I think someone is trying to take benefit out of the issue and issuing me threats over phone.”

BM Rathwa, police inspector of Jambusar, told TOI, “The MLA received the threat call from South Africa. However, the MLA doesn’t have recording of the caller. We have registered a complaint and trying to trace the number and identify the caller. There was some issue at the MLA’s village involving a lady who was throwing filth and dirty water outside the primary school in his village. But, it is difficult to link the issue with the threat call.”

Title: Bhopal: Scindia loyalists pledge support to ‘Maharaaj’
Content:
File photo of BJP Leader Jyotiraditya Scindia

BHOPAL: The 19 Congress MLAs (six of them ministers) from Scindia camp, who resigned from the party in solidarity with him, may get ticket to contest the by-polls or mid-term polls as the case may turn out to be, and ministers may get ministerial berth again in the BJP government (if Kamal Nath government falls and replaced by the BJP government) but what happens to hundreds of Scindia supporters in the Congress party who have also resigned with him. What would be their future and would they be accommodated in the saffron party in the same way as Scindia or his supporter ministers or MLAs may be accommodated?

Pankaj Chaturvedi, who was Pradesh Congress Committee (PCC) spokesperson from Scindia quota, took no time to resign after Scindia shared his resignation letter sent to Congress president, Sonia Gandhi, on March 10. “I have also resigned. I would be where my leader is,” was his reply when asked whether he was with the Congress or the BJP.

When asked whether he had any communication with Scindia on how he proposes to accommodate him or other supporters like him (who is not a minister or an MLA), he said, “No. I have full faith in him. He has always taken care of us and we are sure he would continue doing it.”

Pramod Tandon, who was president of Indore (city) unit of Congress party, also resigned in solidarity with his leader, Jyotiraditya Scindia . When asked whether he is not feeling vulnerable on whether he would get same kind of prominence in the BJP as he had in the Congress party, Tandon said “I have resigned from the Congress but not joined the BJP as yet. I will decide on the issue once I consult Scindiaji. But, I have complete faith in him and there is no question of feeling vulnerable in any manner.”

When asked whether he has had any talks with Scindia in the past few days, Tandon said “No. He must have been busy of late. I would have a meeting with him in 4-5 days.”

Surendra Sharma, who is PCC general secretary from Gwalior, also resigned from the party as soon as Scindia announced his decision to quit the Congress. When asked whether he doesn’t see an uncertain future ahead of him, he said “I worked with bade Maharaj ( Madhavrao Scindia ). For past 20 years, I am with him. Where would I go from here in the Congress itself, if Maharaj is not there? Do you expect me to find a new leader and begin afresh? BJP may not give me post but I will still be able to stand up before Maharaj and ask for anything with a right.”

Title: Chicken sales plummet, but no impact on price of dishes
Content:
Madurai: Covid-19 fears have caused a drastic dip in the sale of chicken in the city and suburbs in spite of the price of the meat also crashing and selling for as less as Rs 60 a kilogram. Not less than 10,000 kilogram of chicken is sold in the city on weekdays which trebles during the weekend. However, for the past few days, chicken shops in the city have been finding it difficult to make a profit of even Rs 100 a day.

S Ibrahim, who runs a chicken shop on Nethaji Road, said that usually they sell live chicken for about Rs 80 to Rs 90 a kilo and make a profit of about Rs 40 a kilogram. Now the market rate for live chicken has gone down to between Rs 20 and Rs 39 and a trader stood to gain just Rs 10 or even less, which would not even meet the electricity charges for his shop. Many of the meat shops that dot the city’s roads remained closed on Thursday as Wednesday’s sales had been very dull.

However, shops which are popular for chicken dishes such as tandoori, chilli chicken, boneless, wings and other things continue to maintain the price as in last week. “There is no price drop on the online delivery systems and not even offers,’’ said Rahul, a software engineer who has all three meals at hotels.Kumar, manager of a leading hotel, said they did have complaints from customers about the high price of some chicken items and they had to convince them that the dip in prices of raw meat was temporary and hence reduction of prices could not be done immediately. “The demand for chicken-based items such as curry, tandoori chicken and biryani has also gone down in the past week,’’ he added.

R Ganesan, president of K Pudur Chamber of Commerce and member of broiler chicken traders association, said that false propaganda had hit the sale of chicken in the city badly in the past one week. “If at all people are affected by chicken it will be those who cut the meat and sellers. The government should step in and alleviate the fears of the people,’’ he said.

Title: Delhi: AAP government may move against NPR today
Content:
Image used for representational purpose only

NEW DELHI: Describing it as a step towards National Register of Citizens (NRC), the AAP government may bring a resolution against the National Population Register (NPR) in the day-long special Delhi assembly session on March 13.

Sources said the legislators may argue that the current atmosphere in Delhi — especially in the wake of communal riots in northeast and protests at several other areas — was not favourable for the update of NPR, which is slated to begin from April 1, and may demand its suspension. The legislators may also demand that the NPR questionnaire may be reverted to 2010 format, which did not require an individual to share additional information such as the place of birth of their parents.

“There is a general sense that in this atmosphere there was a need to take a stand to allay the general fear of the minorities,” said a legislator requesting anonymity.

The NPR, which began in 2010 and updated in 2015, is a list of “usual residents” of the country, which means those who have been residing in a local area for at least last six months or intend to stay in a particular location for the next six months.

Delhi has witnessed massive protests against the amended citizenship act and people fear that NPR may be the first step towards bringing nationwide NRC.

The Delhi assembly is also likely to have a detailed discussion on CAA and NRC apart from the coronavirus scare. The AAP had voted against the citizenship law amendments in both houses of the Parliament. Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal had stressed that entire country should “reject” the law, arguing that it will affect “both Hindus and Muslims” in equal measure.

Title: Covid-19 outbreak: No need to close cinemas in Tamil Nadu, says minister Kadambur C Raju
Content: MADURAI: Information and publicity minister Kadambur C Raju on Thursday said there was no need to close cinemas in Tamil Nadu, unlike in Kerala. Cinemas in Kerala have been temporarily closed as requested by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan in the wake some Covid-19 cases.Responding to a question if the Tamil Nadu government was planning to request cinemas to suspend shows to prevent novel coronavirus spread, the minister told reporters in Kovilpatti in Tuticorin district that such a situation did not arise in the state.According to the minister, the situation is different in Kerala. “There is swine flu and other epidemics there. Nobody is infected in Tamil Nadu due to early detection and stringent measures by the government (to control Covid-19). So, there is no need to close theatres here,” Raju added.Replying to another question, the minister said actor Rajinikanth’s announcements need not be taken seriously as they would not affect the ruling AIADMK. “Let us see after he makes a new announcement,” the minister said.Raju said Rajinikanth had been meeting with his fans regularly from 1996 and the AIADMK sees Thursday’s meeting as one such routine meeting.

Title: Health officials reach out to pvt hospitals for isolation wards
Content:
State, district and local health officials on Thursday held a meeting with Vidarbha Hospitals Association (VHA... Read More

Nagpur: Even though the city has around 150 beds reserved for Covid-19 cases at two government and one private hospital, authorities are reaching out to more private hospitals as part of their preparedness to tackle the challenge.

On Thursday, state, district and local health officials held a meeting with Vidarbha Hospitals Association (VHA) to chalk out a plan in case government facilities fall short for quarantine and treatment.

Earlier, there was talk of six private hospitals extending support to provide isolation wards, but sources said nothing has been finalized as on date. Another meeting has been scheduled for Monday. The main problem in private hospitals is lack of separate facilities for such a ward.

Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) has 72 beds earmarked for coronavirus cases, Mayo Hospital has 25 while Lata Mangeshkar has offered 53.

While health officials are looking for specific facility for isolation wards, private hospitals too are in a fix given the risks involved.

One issue is avoiding centralized AC system, which is installed in almost all big private hospitals. “The chance of virus spreading fast is more in this system,” officials said.

Private players are looking at the possibility of offering one entire hospital as an isolation ward.

“The issue with private hospitals is that whenever they were built they never contemplated a separate entrance or air filtration system for the ideal isolation facility. No private hospital usually contemplates this. We can also thinking, if there are a lot of patients, a one entire hospital can become an isolation facility. It will become easy,” said convener of VHA Dr Anup Marar.

Marar added that private hospitals shall always cooperate and extend all help to the government in times of crisis.

Some private hospitals are also worried about the health of their own doctors and paramedical staff, who will become the first point of contact with suspected cases.

Title: ICG detains 15 SL fishers, releases them due to Covid-19 fears
Content:
Madurai: Fifteen Sri Lankan fishermen who were fishing in three mechanised boats were detained by the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) on Wednesday, on charges of crossing the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL). However, the fishermen, who were to be handed over to the Tuticorin Marine police on Thursday, were reportedly handed over to the Sri Lankan enforcement officials due to Covid-19 scare.

Marine police sources said the boats were spotted about 70 nautical miles (130km), south of Kanyakumari. A communication from the ICG, Tuticorin, said that they apprehended three boats - Sugandhi, Seral and Netmi - during a security patrol for violation of sections 3 and 7 of The Maritime Zones of India (Regulation of Fishing by Foreign Vessels) Act, 1981. Escorted by ICG ship Abiraj, they were expected to reach the Tuticorin harbour around 11.30am on Thursday and handed over to the marine police for questioning. It is learnt that they were taken back to IMBL due to global Covid-19 outbreak. ICG officials in Tuticorin were not available for comment on the reason behind releasing Lankan fishermen.

The marine police said that a stretch between 100 to 150 nautical miles south of Kanyakumari is a wedge bank for mechanised boats from Sri Lanka. They suspected that the men could have accidentally crossed the IMBL while fishing. Marine police sources added that fishermen were also not involved in smuggling or activities that posed a threat to India’s national security, following which the ICG handed them over to the Lankan navy.

Title: No trace of Class X boy who fell in Narmada canal
Content:
Vadodara: Even after 72 hours , rescuers have found no clue about 16-year-old Arbaz Pathan, who had fallen in Narmada canal near Chhani.

On Thursday, firemen resumed the search for the Class X boy. Personnel from National Disaster Response Force also joined the search. However, until Thursday evening, they could not find Pathan. Officials said that the search was extended till Bhimpura and equipment like underwater cameras were also used.

“The water level in the canal is too high and the water is very dirty, so the search operation is turning out to be difficult,” said a fire official. The search will resume on Friday.

Pathan, a resident of Navayard, had fallen when he was shooting his own video while standing on the bank of canal on March 10 noon. His friends who were at a distance had alerted the locals and the fire brigade was called in to search for the boy.

Title: Kolkata: Midnight evacuation as building cracks widen on East-West route
Content: KOLKATA: Thirty-six Bowbazar residents were evacuated after midnight on Thursday as cracks that had surfaced the previous day on their house at 5/2 Gour De Lane started widening.Gour De Lane is within the zone, where buildings fell after one of the tunnel boring machines (TBMs) digging the East-West Metro tunnel hit an aquifer last year, leading to large-scale subsidence. Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation ( KMRC ), implementing agency of the project, however, ruled out a repeat of the August 31 disaster, considering the host of precautionary measures they have taken for the second phase of tunnelling.Residents panicked nonetheless as buildings along the narrow bylane off Bowbazar developed cracks in the last 36 hours. Crack meter readings on the terrace of 5/2 Gour De Lane revealed that fissures had increased almost four times — from 4.5mm on Wednesday to 16mm on Thursday.Tiloki Kesari, one of the owners, took TOI on a round of the well-maintained three-storey structure that had passed the mandatory building condition survey (BCS) undertaken to assess stability of structures ahead of the tunnelling. Unable to sleep the night at the hotel where they have been put up due to the emergency evacuation , he had come to check the extent of damage in the morning. “It took 40 minutes to get my immobile mother down the narrow staircase,” he said.Asked why this building that fell on the TBM ’s influence zone of 25m wasn’t evacuated before the tunnelling, an official said, “All the parameters suggested that it was a healthy structure.” Kesari, an electrical goods trader at Tiretta Bazar, said, “Yes, we have maintained the property that my grandfather had bought 125 years ago. Suddenly, it seems to be falling apart.”He and his family were evacuated when Chundee, the TBM that was digging the west-bound tunnel, hit the aquifer below the nearby Durga Pithuri Lane on August 31. The machine is now lying defunct 14m below the ground. Its twin, Urvi, resumed tunnelling on February 18 on Calcutta high court’s orders.“In August, some cracks had appeared on the walls of our building. But that was nothing compared to these,” Kesari said. KMRC and ITD ITD-Cementation , contracted to build the last leg of East-West Metro, are taking a several measures to strengthen the Kesari residence. The entire building has been propped up with iron beams. Grout mixtures (cement, sand and water) are being injected. “The residents shouldn’t panic. If they are feeling insecure, we are ready to shift them to hotels,” a KMRC spokesperson said.Debashish Pradhan, 33, a resident of 4C Gour De Lane, said, “And what happens after we return from the hotel? The tunnelling work should be stopped immediately.”

Title: Government positive about separate civic body for Pune's fringe areas: Ajit Pawar
Content: PUNE: The long-pending demand of forming a separate municipal corporation for fringe areas of Pune is likely to receive a boost with district guardian minister Ajit Pawar stating that the state government was “positive” about initiating talks on the proposal.Pawar was replying to questions raised by two local MLAs Ashok Pawar (Shirur) and Bhimrao Tapkir (Khadakwasla) about issues faced by citizens in areas located on the city’s periphery.Pawar said that two options were under consideration — merging of villages in PMC limits and formation of separate municipal corporation. The discussions will be held on both options to find a solution suitable for administrative management as well as residents, he added.The elected representatives from the city and fringes have been pushing for a separate municipal corporation, especially for the eastern areas, which include parts of Hadapsar , Wagholi and adjacent villages like Manjari budruk and Manjari Khurd . These areas have witnessed significant development in terms of real estate and influx of people.The residents and elected representatives are in favour of formation of a new civic body which they feel would be more feasible and an effective option instead of putting additional pressure on Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) by way of merger.Ashok Pawar said that areas in Wagholi have been facing problems due to poor road infrastructure and water supply.The situation will become more challenging in the days to come, he said.State urban development minister Eknath Shinde , who also participated in the discussion, said that steps have been taken to augment water supply in Wagholi and works are being undertaken by the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority, which looks after the city’s peripheral areas.

Title: Threatened by ex-lover, woman kills self in Delhi
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: A 22-year-old woman who was being blackmailed by her former lover allegedly committed suicide at her residence in northeast Delhi’s Jagatpuri on Wednesday afternoon. Police have arrested the mother-son duo in connection with the case on Thursday. The accused have been identified as Pankaj Dang and his mother Alka Dang.

According to the cops, Pankaj had created a ruckus at the engagement ceremony of the deceased, which eventually had to be called off because of the claims made by him. Police have also seized the mobile phone of Pankaj and Alka.

Family members of the deceased alleged that the girl had on March 8 written to police informing them about the Pankaj blackmailing her. No action was, however, taken, the kin claimed.

After the victim hanged herself, her mother filed another complaint and a case of abetment to suicide and extortion was registered against Pankaj and his mother.

Police said the victim had come to know that Pankaj was involved in a betting racket and had started distancing herself from him. However, the accused started blackmailing her and troubled her mother. The victim’s family had even given Rs 50,000 to the accused. Pankaj, however, demanded Rs 10 lakh.

According to the police, the mother-son duo also ruined the victim’s engagement ceremony after they reached the venue and created a ruckus. The girl’s mother told the cops that her daughter, who was troubled by the constant blackmailing and the money demands, found no other choice but to hang herself and commit suicide.

Title: Pimpri Chinchwad cops recover 4 pistols
Content:
Pune: In separate actions, the Pimpri Chinchwad police recovered four country-made pistols since Tuesday with the arrest of four criminals on police records.

The suspects were taken into custody from Chakan, Pimpri and Chinchwad areas.

Constable Ganesh Sawant of the Pimpri Chinchwad crime branch on Thursday received a tip-off that one person was carrying a firearm at Nighoje village near Chakan.

The crime branch team, led by assistant inspector Ganesh Patil, reached the spot. “Seeing the police team, the suspect started running away. Our team nabbed him after a chase. We have recovered a country-made pistol and a cartridge from him,” said Uttam Tangade, inspector, crime branch.

Tangade said suspect Hrishikesh Kalhatkar (29) from Khed was a scrap vendor. He was arrested with two country-made pistols in 2018.

The Pimpri Chinchwad crime branch team, led by inspector Shailesh Gaikwad, arrested a criminal on police records — Amol Bhegade (30) of Ghotawade in Mulshi — and recovered a country-made pistol and a cartridge from him.

The team also arrested another criminal on police record, Mangesh Palve (29), from Pimpri and recovered a country-made pistol and cartridge from him. The suspects — Bhegade and Palve — have cases related to murder, attempt to murder registered against them, sub-inspector Sanjay Nilpatrewar told TOI.

On Tuesday, the crime branch team arrested a criminal on police record, Indarsingh Rajput (29) from Nanekarwadi in Chakan, and seized two country-made pistols from him. An officer from the crime branch said that the police are investigating from where the suspects managed to obtain the firearms, he said.

The crime branch of the city police recently arrested three criminals and recovered eight firearms from them. suspects procured the weapons from an arms dealer in Madhya Pradesh and planned to sell them here and surrounding districts.

Title: Authorities stall foreign cargo ship crew from disembarking
Content: Mumbai: Port authorities in Mumbai are dissuading crew on foreign cargo ships from disembarking on Indian soil and have already stopped an Iranian cargo ship at the outer anchorage of JNPT since March 7.“We are holding cargo ships that have come to JNPT from Covid-19-affected countries away from the inner anchorage while the crew on ships from other countries are being dissuaded from landing, except for Indian officers, provided they do not have high body temperature or show any other symptoms,” said an JNPT official.According to port officials, their medical teams will allow the Iranian ship to berth only if data of the cargo on it, body temperatures of the crew and declarations submitted by its authorities are found to match the standards laid down by the central health ministry.It may be mentioned that thermal scanners have been put up at the embarkation and disembarkation points, besides health staff have been deployed to cross-verify and certify these.“If we find anyone infected with the virus, we have ambulances and other setup in place to take patients to Kasturba Hospital at Chinchpokli,” an official added.For disembarkation, health officers have to certify the crew as per health department procedures, said an MbPT official, adding ships importing oil at Jawahar Dweep and other cargo ships were being allowed to operate but only after checks by medical teams. Sources said unlike at airports, no steps are being taken to check surveyors, agents, clients and barge personnel who enter vessels without checking health of crew.

Title: 4 held for ransacking office
Content:
Pune: Four persons were arrested and their accomplices were booked for ransacking an office and pelting stones at hutments in Upper Indiranagar over a trivial issue on Wednesday evening.

The Bibvewadi police identified the arrested persons as Sukhdev Nalekar (24) of Katraj-Kondhwa Road, and Suraj Khandagale (25), Kiran Randive (23) and Deepak Devkule (18), all residents of Gangadham Road.

Mangesh Shigvan (42) of Upper Indiranagar, the owner of the ransacked office, lodged a complaint, which stated that he was walking down the slum pocket with his friends when one of the residents hurled abuses. The man asked why they were helping the residents of the area and what did they want from the poor people?

The man then slapped and punched Shigvan as well as others. Some friends of the suspects also surfaced at the spot with sharp weapons. They ransacked Shivgan’s office.

Title: Two constables face inquiries
Content:
Vadodara: Two policemen of Vadodara rural police have come under the scanner in connection with two different prohibition cases.

The first case pertains to an audio clip of a phone call conversation between a constable of a branch of rural police and a bootlegger. In the audio, the cop can be allegedly heard trying to save the bootlegger in connection with a recent liquor raid at Ratanpur village near Vadodara city.

As the audio clip went viral on social media and was widely shared on WhatsApp, an inquiry was ordered by the superintendent of police. The deputy superintendent of police of Dabhoi division K V Solanki is conducting the probe and the constable’s statement was recorded on Wednesday.

In another case, a head constable of surveillance team of Dabhoi police station was suspended for not following proper procedures. The cop Munaf Mohammed had seized liquor and was chasing an accused during which he went out of the police station’s jurisdiction and did not follow the procedure of conducting ‘panchnama’. “An inquiry has been ordered against him, so he has been suspended,” said superintendent of police Sudhir Desai.

Title: Three arrested at Calangute for child begging
Content:
Calangute: Three women were arrested by Calangute police late Thursday for allegedly forcing minor children into begging .

Following a complaint by Calangute sarpanch Francis Rodrigues about the menace of child begging in Calangute, police conducted a raid late Wednesday evening during which they found four minor children begging at the behest of three women.

The four children were rescued and have been lodged at Apna Ghar in Merces.

The women have been remanded in five days police custody.

Title: PCB struggles to maintain gardens, islands in its limits
Content:
Pune: The Pune Cantonment Board’s poor financial health has taken a huge toll on the maintenance of public gardens and islands under its jurisdiction, prompting the authorities to turn to private help.

Out of the 10 gardens in PCB limits, the maintenance of two has been outsourced to a private firm under its corporate social responsibility initiative, a PCB official said, confirming that 19 islands in the area were in bad shape.

“We cannot maintain the gardens and islands the way we used to due to the prevailing financial condition. For now, we are primarily focused on providing basic services like water to these gardens and islands,” PCB chief executive officer Amit Kumar told TOI.

The board’s call for private help has also failed to find many takers. “Talks are going on with various companies and organizations as of now. However, we need time to examine the conditions that these companies have mentioned in their proposals before taking the final decision. One of the private companies has agreed to take over two gardens and some of the islands without any condition,” Kumar said.

The board needs at least Rs7.5 lakh per month for maintaining the gardens and islands. It has not issued any fresh tender regarding the maintenance of their gardens and islands for the last one year. The then president Major General Navneet Kumar had suggested the board authorities to bring more CSR funds to maintain these facilities.

“Currently, the board has only six staffers for cleaning and other works at these gardens and islands. Unless board ropes in other private agencies, it will not be able to maintain these places properly. At some gardens, plants have withered due to lack of maintenance,” a senior board official said.

One of the worst affected structures is the Maratha War Memorial, with its internal and outside premises staying dirty for a long time now.

“We have written to various companies and organizations to maintain the memorial, but they have not responded to the letters yet,” the official added.

Sanjay Kawade, activist and resident of Ghorpadi, said, “Over the years, the board failed to recruit staffers at the garden department. Many of them have retired from the service in the last one decade. If the board has its own staffers, they would not require private help.”

Title: Times of India
Content:
Kolkata:Cesc Ventures Ltd, RP-SG Group holding entity for IT, BPO, FMCG, real estate, has acquired 8.5% stake in Mumbai based Peel Works (P) Ltd as per a stock exchange filing. RP-SG Group firm has said that total consideration for the stake buy is Rs 20.99 crore through acquisition of 4,134 compulsory convertible preference shares. Peel Works was incorporated in 2010 and has been engaged in supply of good food, grocery and consumer products to retailers and wholesalers through a software application. Cesc Ventures has argued that the company has synergy possibilities with FMCG and retail business of the company and its subsidiaries.

“The group has entered FMCG two years back and it has big plan for the business, this acquisition can be handy for that business,” added experts. Peel Works had clocked a revenue of over Rs 40 crore in the last fiscal. CESC Ventures had acquired 64.63% shareholding in Herbolab India last year. It was a manufacturer of Ayurveda medicines and products under the brand name “Dr. Vaidya's". The Kolkata-based company had acquired 64.63% stake for an aggregate cash consideration amounting to Rs 32.17 crore plus/minus any agreed adjustments, if any, in terms of the investment agreement. Incidentally, Cesc Ventures had a consolidated revenue of Rs 4,400 crore and a profit of Rs 234 crore in last fiscal.

Spencer’s Retail, the RP-Sanjiv Goenka Group’s retail flagship, has also acquired Godrej Group’s premium food retailing venture Nature’s Basket for 300 crore in an all-cash deal last year.

Title: Hyderabad boy with cancer meets Dubai prince
Content:
The dream of a seven-year-old boy from Hyderabad, who is fighting cancer, came true when Dubai’s crown prince ... Read More

HYDERABAD: The dream of a seven-year-old boy from Hyderabad, who is fighting cancer, came true when Dubai’s crown prince Sheikh Hamdan met him. Following a post on social media from the boy, Abdullah Hussain , that he wanted to meet his idol, crown prince and chairman of the Dubai Executive Council, Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammad bin Rashid Al Maktoum , met him in Dubai on March 6.

Abdullah was also featured in a TV news report, where he said: "Shaikh Hamdan is so cool, adventurous and so kind. I want to meet his pets and I want to see his dresses.” Sheikh Hamdan met the boy along with his younger brother. After meeting the young boy, Sheikh Hamdan posted a picture with Abdullah on Instagram which said, "Met this courageous boy today". The family also spent time with Sheikh Hamdan’s pets to fulfil the boy’s request. After the crown prince made the boy’s wish come true, Consul General of India Vipul said: "It is indeed a great and gracious gesture on the part of the crown prince of Dubai to fulfill the wish of his little fan, which also signifies strong bilateral ties and people-to-people connect between India and UAE.”

Title: School bus topples over after collision with another bus at Chhatrapati Square
Content:
The school bus was coming from Khamla side and going towards Narendra Nagar Chowk when a speeding private bus ... Read More

Nagpur: A school bus toppled over after being hit by another bus at Chhatrapati square on Thursday morning. Fortunately, there were no children in the school bus which was en route to collect children before taking them to school.

Three vehicles were damaged in the accident and drivers of all three sustained minor injuries. Dhantoli police have registered a case of rash driving against the driver of the bus, Dyaneshwar Mahale who fled the spot after the accident.

According to police, the school bus was coming from Khamla side and going towards Narendra Nagar Chowk when a speeding private bus coming from Ajni square and going towards airport hit it from left side at Chhatrapati Chowk.

As a result, the school bus hit an SUV coming from Narendra Nagar side and going towards Khamla before toppling over on its side and colliding with the road divider.

Police said passers-by rushed to help the drivers, however, the driver of private bus had fled the spot fearing wrath of the crowd. Sources said the incident took place at 6.15am but the police removed the school bus from the spot after almost three hours.

Senior PI of Dhantoli police station, Dilip Landge said, “We have the registration number of the bus and registered an offence against the driver under sections of Indian Penal Code. We have also launched a search to nab him.”

Title: 4 minor boys assault duo, detained
Content:
Pune: The Swargate police on Wednesday detained four minor boys on the charge of assaulting a 27-year-old man and his friend in the Market Yard area on Tuesday evening.

Police said the boys beat up the duo with an iron rod and stones. “The duo — Siddhaling Hoshmani (27) Sagar Shinde — suffered head injuries,” an officer from Swargate police said.

The boys were detained following a complaint lodged by Hoshmani on Tuesday. All the boys are aged around 16.

The officer said Hoshmani and Shinde were having a chat near the Industrial Estate when the four boys accosted them. “They hurled abuses at the duo, following which Shinde approached them. One of the boys picked an iron rod and hit him on the head. When Hoshmani tried to intervene, the boys beat him up,” the officer said, adding the boys and Shinde argued over something a few months ago. “They beat up the duo to exact revenge,” the officer added.

Title: Kolkata Metro News: Kolkata metro saves girl after suicide alert by friend
Content:
The 19-year-old was virtually dragged away from the edge of the platform at Kalighat station

KOLKATA: A teenager’s life was saved after her friend alerted Metro Railway authorities at Kalighat station of her intention to commit suicide around 12.20pm on Thursday. The 19-year-old girl was virtually dragged away from the edge of the platform and taken to the station master’s office minutes before a train was to arrive. After basic counseling, she was handed over to officials of the Kalighat police station, who summoned her parents before allowing her to leave.

“It seems that the girl from Amtala in South 24 Parganas and her male friend from Bankura had an argument at the station over something. Before her friend could stop her, the girl rushed down to the platform threatening to end her life under the wheels of the next train. Her companion then alerted a Railway Protection Force (RPF) personnel passing nearby. Without wasting any time, the security personnel rushed down to the platform and rescued the girl,” Metro Railway CPRO Indrani Banerjee said.

Though the girl insisted that she be allowed to leave, station officials didn’t think that she was in the proper frame of mind and informed the local police station. It was around 1.20pm when the police took her away. “We could not risk allowing her to leave alone. She was also not ready to go with her male friend. Finally, we urged her parents to reach the police station and take her away,” an official said.

In the past, lives have been saved after relatives called up the Metro control room to say that a family member has left home in a huff with the intention to commit suicide. This may be the first time when a companion alerted Metro staff of the intention of his companion to take her life within the station premises itself.

Title: Submit action plan on electric poles removal: HC to NMC, MSEDCL
Content:
Both respondents told to submit plan within a week with details of expenditure involved and for completion of ... Read More

Nagpur: Peeved over civic and power entities’ failure over removal of deadly electric poles from roads, the Nagpur bench of Bombay high court on Thursday asked MSEDCL and NMC to sit together and prepare an action plan in this regard which would be implemented with a deadline.

A division bench comprising justices Sunil Shukre and Avinash Gharote sternly directed both respondents to submit the plan within a week having details of expenditure involved in shifting of poles and for completion of work.

The directives came while hearing a suo motu PIL (No 98/2018) based on TOI’s reports on electric poles standing right in the middle of roads, due to expansion, where Shreerang Bhandarkar is appointed as amicus curiae.

Earlier, the respondents informed that they had spent Rs30 crore so far on shifting the poles from various areas. Both informed that they had additionally deposited Rs5 crore in 2015 with HC registry for poles shifting as directed by the court. When the judges inquired about it from its registry, they were informed that the amount is now accumulated to Rs7.74 crore in five years due to bank interest.

Earlier, the NMC further informed that out of 19 old roads under Integrated Road Development Project (IRDP), shifting has been completed on two. Out of remaining 17, revised estimate of three roads is required to be done by MSEDCL, while work on 14 roads is on the verge of completion.

Title: 121 arrive from abroad, only three from affected countries
Content:
Vadodara: Health officials of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) breathed easy on Thursday as it transpired that out of 121 persons who had arrived in the city from abroad during the last couple of days, only three were from countries affected by coronavirus (COVID-19).

The officials were closely scrutinising the list of persons from the state who had landed from foreign countries.

VMC health department sources said that lists of passengers arriving in India after visiting foreign countries were being regularly shared with them. But since Wednesday, the department received lists of visitors from abroad with the total number of persons arriving from foreign countries standing at 1,500. It came to light that out of these, 121 persons were from Vadodara.

On combing the lists thoroughly, heath officials were relieved to note that only three persons were from countries that were affected badly by COVID-19 and were on the list regarding which caution had to be exercised. “Most of the fliers on the list had arrived from the US, UK, Australia and New Zealand where the condition is not very serious,” an official said.

According to the protocol, the three persons have been advised home quarantine and their health will be monitored closely. Officials said that this was being done as a precautionary measure, but the three persons had not shown any signs of COVID-19.

Officials said that the home quarantine period of two persons got over on Thursday and they had not shown any symptoms of novel coronavirus. With the three persons advised home isolation on Thursday, the total number of persons under home quarantine stood at 15.

Box: Seven tested, all negative

Health officials in the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) said that so far seven persons including four Italian tourists had been tested for COVID-19. All of them have tested negative. Since Monday, no cases where tests would be needed have come to light.

Title: Afforestation, school infra get focus in Corpn budget
Content:
Trichy: Trichy corporation has presented a secret budget for the fourth consecutive year, in the absence of an elected council. The corporation on Thursday tabled a Rs 42.65 lakh surplus budget for the financial year 2020-2021. Proposals to grow dense forest through Miyawaki method and develop infrastructure of corporation schools are among the budget’s priorities.

The total revenue is expected to be Rs 1,335.47 crore against an expenditure of Rs 1,335.04 crores. While the revenue in the previous budget (2019-20) was estimated at Rs 767.94 crores, it has surged by 74% in Thursday’s budget, thanks to the smart cities mission and Atal Mission for Rejuvenation and Urban Transformation (Amrut) funds. Unlike the previous budgets which had several fancy announcements that did not materialise, the civic body proposed a limited number of practically executable announcements.

Following the success of Miyawaki forest in Srirangam, Rs 40 lakh has been allotted for dense afforestation in all four zones through the method. The civic body has also proposed to develop a model school each in the four zones at an outlay of Rs 75 lakh a school. State-of-the-art facilities including smart classrooms will be set up in the proposed school, officials said.

“It is a welcome move to spend towards increasing the city’s green cover. Trichy corporation should expand the Miyawaki method of afforestation to all the 65 wards,” K Suresh Kumar, a resident of Raja Colony said. Other proposals from the general fund include expansion of micro compost centres (MCC) to 17 more locations at an estimated cost of Rs 8.87 crore. The decentralised waste collection centres at 32 locations will now collect and recycle the waste within a ward, preventing the waste from heading to the dump yard in Ariyamangalam.

Corporation has also proposed to buy incinerators for all four zones at an outlay of Rs 16 crores. Utilising smart cities mission fund, officials said that the civic body will establish model urinal-cum-toilets at four spots. “Combining the concepts in science, technology, engineering and maths (STEM), a public park for children will come up at Panchakarai at an estimated cost of Rs 14.90 crore. It will be named after Trichy-born Nobel prize winner Sir C V Raman,” an official source said.

Title: Women protesters lathi-charged at Chanda
Content:
Over 400 contract workers of Chandrapur GMCH are staging agitation in front of the district collectorate since... Read More

Chandrapur: The 49-day-long agitation by contract workers of Chandrapur GMCH, under the banner of Janvikas Kamgar Sena (JKS), took an aggressive turn when women agitators blocked the entrance of district collectorate on Thursday afternoon. Police resorted to baton charge on the agitating women, leaving many of them injured.

Over 400 contract workers of Chandrapur GMCH are staging agitation in front of the district collectorate since January 23 to demand minimum wages, payment of pending five month salary, and scrapping of contract and black listing of labour supplier to GMCH.

The president of JKS said medical education minister Amit Deshmukh met guardian minister Vijay Wadettiwar and ordered cancellation of the labour supplier’s contract. Dean Dr SS Morey allegedly cancelled the contract on March 8, but did not inform the agitators.

Some 250 women agitators were detained and booked. Congress MLA Pratibha Dhanorkar has demanded cancelling the offences against the women agitators in a letter to home minister Anil Deshmukh.

Title: MPs urge MEA to repatriate Indian fishermen from Iran
Content:
Madurai: A delegation of Rajya Sabha MPs and parish priests from Kanyakumari met Union external affairs minister S Jaishankar at the Parliament complex on Thursday and urged the government to take efforts for speedy repatriation of hundreds of Indian fishermen who are stranded in Covid-19 affected Iran.

The delegation, led by the state government’s special representative in Delhi N Thalavai Sundaram included MPs A Navaneethakrishnan, S R Balasubramaniyan, Vijila Sathyananth, N Chandrasekar, S Muthukaruppan, R Vaithilingam, A Vijayakumar and A K Selvaraj and priests.

Kanyakumari MP H Vasanthakumar also raised the issue in the Parliament during the zero hour and sought their repatriation in a special flight. Responding to it, MEA Jaishankar said that the Indian Embassy officials in Iran have got in touch with some of the fishermen and will be contacting the others soon. The minister said that efforts are being taken to ensure that the fishermen are provided with food, water and essential supplies.

President of the international fishermen development trust, Justin Antony made a representation to the minister to deploy more medical teams to test the fishermen along with other Indians in Iran.

“We have been seeking repatriation of fishermen for more than two weeks. The ministry has stated that there are more than 6,000 Indians including about 1,000 fishermen in Iran. The government must send additional medical teams to test them all soon and bring them home,” Antony said.

Title: PM gave assurance he will look into Mhadei issue: CM
Content:
Panaji: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday assured chief minister Pramod Sawant that he would not allow any injustice to be done to Goa in the Mhadei matter. Sawant urged Modi not to permit Karnataka to divert Mhadei water.

“Modi assured to look into the Mhadei matter and said that he will not allow any injustice to Goa,” Sawant told TOI after he called on the PM in New Delhi on Thursday. Sawant said he explained the chronology of events in the Mhadei matter to the PM. He told the PM that the Mhadei matter is likely to come up in the Supreme Court on July 15, 16 and 22. “Until the SC’s final hearing, the Union government should not give permission to Karnataka to start construction for diverting Mhadei waters,” Sawant told the PM.

On March 6, Sawant urged the Jal Shakti ministry and the environment ministry not to permit Karnataka to carry out any construction on Mhadei till Goa’s side is heard. The opposition had said that the meeting was just an eyewash and the chief minister should have met the PM and explained Goa’s stand as it is linked to different ministries.

On March 2, the SC had rejected Goa’s plea to stop Karnataka from starting work on the Mhadei, but said Karnataka can begin construction only after getting permission from the Centre, and preparation of a detailed project report (DPR). A day later, Sawant had said that the state would approach the Centre and request them not to permit Karnataka to start any work on its projects on the Mhadei.

Title: Political parties start preparationsfor election
Content:
Jaipur: Dates for elections to six municipal corporations in the state have been announced and preparations have begun in both the political parties for the municipal body elections announced on Thursday.

While the Congress is still in the planning stage, the BJP has already appointed its workers in the city to supervise the municipal wards and shortlisted probable candidates who are active in their respective areas. As per the information provided by the BJP members, they have divided Jaipur in different levels.

BJP sources said that as per the 10 state assembly areas, Jaipur has been divided into 33 mandals. In every state assembly area, there can be five to three mandals and in each mandal, there can be 4 to 6 wards. At the top level, Vidhan Sabha Prerak has been appointed by the party followed by Mandal Prerak under him. The work of the Mandal Prerak is to get information about caste equation, influential voters and powerful families of the ward.

One BJP member, who didn’t want to be named said, “Everything has been planned and the work has been divided. Unofficially, we have been asked to prepare a list of influential people in the ward who can be given tickets, to figure out the Congress vote bank in the ward and to chalk out strategies to break their vote bank. A voters’ list will be prepared for the number of people residing outside the district or ward.” People have already started approaching the district heads of political parties to secure a ticket for the upcoming elections.

Both the parties are, however, certain that the OBC women mayors in both the corporations will be chosen from the already active members in their women’s wing. “There are no active women OBC members in the city but we are trying to give tickets to women members active in the party in our women’s wing. It will make much sense. Within a few days, it will be clear,” said one Congress member.

Title: Coronavirus hits travel plans in Delhi, leaving backpackers’ haven in despair
Content: NEW DELHI: It is well near impossible to take a relaxed walk through Paharganj in central Delhi. The area packs in tourists on a shoestring budget and walking there means weaving through an obstacle course of human beings from across the globe. On Thursday, however, there was a relaxed air in the usually crowded backpacker’s haven. The lanes looked uncharacteristically accommodating because there weren’t many people around.“Sorry, I have a bus to catch,” a foreigner in his 20s smiled. The smile did not hide the wariness in his tone. Like him, most masked tourists refused to talk to TOI. Those who did expressed keenness to leave the city. A Turkish family explained through a translator app that they were leaving Delhi on Friday. They didn’t want to be named or photographed. The travellers surely realise that they are as much at risk of infection by the novel coronavirus in their parts of the world as in Paharganj, but the travel restrictions announced by various countries, including India, must have been playing on their minds.A group from Kazakhstan has been trapped by such restrictions. Vishal Narang, who owns a few hotels in the locality, told of the plight of the 25-odd Kazakhs. “Their flights stand cancelled till March 21. They were staying at Pearl Plaza hotel from March 5 but have run out of money. We are providing them food,” Narang disclosed. TOI tried reaching out to these stranded tourists, but they declined to talk.A few, however, are enjoying their time in Delhi despite the anxieties. Russel Shakespeare, a resident of Brisbane, Australia, was nonchalantly ambling along with Sidney resident Michael Amendolia. The unmasked Shakespeare explained, “Unless it’s a P95 mask, there’s no point in wearing one. The only precaution we are taking is washing our hands and using hand sanitisers.” The duo came to India for two week and are returning home on Friday, having spent most days in Varanasi.“I haven’t noticed anything yet to panic about,” Shakespeare said. Amendolia revealed that the two, both photographers, had been eating in dhabas to experience Indian food. “There are worse diseases we could contract,” the 57-year-old reasoned. “We are, of course, very careful about the general hygiene of the place where we eat.”Ajay Kumar Aggarwal, president, Paharganj’s Hotel Mahasangh, said the panic and restrictions due to the Covid-19 pandemic had cut into their earnings. “This is a 100% occupancy season, but we are seeing not more than 20% occupancy,” Aggarwal said glumly.Pawan Mittal, general secretary of the association, elaborated, “February and March are completely ruined. At this time, apart from tourists, importers, exporters and medical tourists arrive in Paharganj. Now the visa process is on hold till April 15 and even those who are here are hurrying home,” Mittal claimed.Paharganj’s 800 hotels are jittery because the domestic tourist season in April-June too is likely to be hit. Bookings are being cancelled and payments are being held back. They are coping with the virus as advised. Mittal revealed that the hotels are sending daily reports to the municipal corporation: “Guests who came after February 15 are under the scanner, especially those who arrived from the virus-affected countries.”At Shimtur, a popular Korean restaurant, manager Hari said all employees had been instructed to wash their hands frequently, though masks hadn’t yet been made mandatory. At Appetite German Bakery the staff use masks and hand sanitisers though there aren’t too many tourists eating there. Cleverly enough, Harish Kumar, who runs Minis Sports and Jeans, compensated for the slump in business by stocking masks and finding ready takers for them.

Title: West Bengal: Tank collapse in Salt Lake sparks panic
Content:
Water gushing out of the broken tank (L) floods the complex

KOLKATA: A 33,000-gallon water tank at the Post and Telegraph (P&T) housing quarters, located adjacent to City Centre mall in Salt Lake’s CC Block , collapsed on Thursday morning, triggering panic among the residents of the complex.

Nobody, however, was injured. The residents said that the incident had occurred around 8.45am.

“I was preparing to leave for office. Suddenly, I heard a loud thud with an earthquake-like feeling. We rushed out of our flats and saw the huge water tank had collapsed behind the maintenance office. Water was also gushing out of the tank,” said Satyajit Maji, a resident.

The tank, located near gate number 3 of the housing built in 1978, supplies water to the entire housing complex that has 88 building blocks and 1,056 flats. Residents of the nearby flats also came out, fearing it was an earthquake . “Our buildings were trembling as if there was an earthquake. Many of the buildings are in dangerous condition with large cracks due to the lack of maintenance,” said Shovan Mukherjee, another resident. A telecommunications department official, who came to the spot with department of posts officials, said they were taking all necessary steps to replace the tank and restore water supply in the complex at the earliest.

Bidhannagar mayor Krishna Chakraborty said, “It was a narrow escape for the residents. We have asked the authorities concerned to take urgent steps to restore the water supply as early as possible. We are urging the authorities to look into the condition of the buildings as well.”

Councillor Tulsi Sinha Roy said, “I have never seen any maintenance work taken up by the central government agencies for the housing in the past 10 years. We have repeatedly sent letters to both the postal and telecommunications departments but with no result.” Roy said tankers will be provided till water supply is restored.

Title: Coronavirus scare in Mumbai: Authorities stall foreign cargo ship crew from disembarking
Content: MUMBAI: Port authorities in Mumbai are dissuading crew on foreign cargo ships from disembarking on Indian soil and have already stopped an Iranian cargo ship at the outer anchorage of JNPT since March 7.“We are holding cargo ships that have come to JNPT from Covid-19-affected countries away from the inner anchorage while the crew on ships from other countries are being dissuaded from landing, except for Indian officers, provided they do not have high body temperature or show any other symptoms,” said an JNPT official.According to port officials, their medical teams will allow the Iranian ship to berth only if data of the cargo on it, body temperatures of the crew and declarations submitted by its authorities are found to match the standards laid down by the central health ministry.It may be mentioned that thermal scanners have been put up at the embarkation and disembarkation points, besides health staff have been deployed to cross-verify and certify these.“If we find anyone infected with the virus, we have ambulances and other setup in place to take patients to Kasturba Hospital at Chinchpokli,” an official added.For disembarkation, health officers have to certify the crew as per health department procedures, said an MbPT official, adding ships importing oil at Jawahar Dweep and other cargo ships were being allowed to operate but only after checks by medical teams. Sources said unlike at airports, no steps are being taken to check surveyors, agents, clients and barge personnel who enter vessels without checking health of crew.

Title: OFT hands over first batch of 500 Trichy Assault Rifles to CRPF
Content:
Trichy: The first batch of 500 Trichy Assault Rifle (TAR) indigenously developed by the Ordnance Factory of Tiruchirappalli (OFT) was handed over to the Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) at the factory premises on Thursday. The rifles are part of the total order for 6,167 rifles. OFT here has so far supplied around 11,000 TARs to various central and state police forces. The rifles were received by CRPF DIG D S Rawat.

Trichy Assault Rifle was conceived in 2015 and production began at OFT in 2017. TAR, is considered an equivalent variant of AK-47. Compared to stamped sheet metal riveted body in other rifles, TAR features a fully machined receiver body for higher reliability and strength.

After Chhattisgarh state police received the first batch of 200 TARs in March 2017, various state police forces and paramilitary forces placed orders for the rifle. CRPF had conducted evaluation trials of TAR including accuracy and reliability apart from tests such as drop, mud, saltwater immersion and rain tests. The rifle was then subjected to life cycle test in which 15,000 rounds were fired without any single stoppage, proving its reliability. After successful trials, CRPF placed a pilot order for 100 rifles.

After extensive field usage in various terrains including Srinagar, in 2018, CRPF placed the bulk order. CRPF had asked for customised requirements such as upper hand guard with picatinny rail for mounting telescopes and tritium filled luminous sources for night firing capability.

“Our factory has produced several weapons. Among all, TAR is undoubtedly our biggest success,” said Shirish Khare, general manager, OFT.

The ordnance factory here has 17,000 orders for TAR from Border Security Force and Sashastra Seema Bal.

Title: 14,472 officials to take charge of 2 new corps
Content:
Jaipur: The state government has released the list of officers to be posted in both the newly created municipal corporations of the city.

Directorate of local bodies (DLB) issued a notification on Thursday allotting 8,599 posts for the Jaipur Municipal Corporation, Greater and 5,873 posts for Jaipur Municipal Corporation, Heritage.

Both the municipal corporations have already come into existence and after notification of posts have been released, things have become clear. Around 466 posts have been abolished and 210 temporary posts have been created. In all, 14,472 officials will take charge of new corporations.

According to sources, a month back, the municipal commissioner had sent the format to all the section and zonal offices of the corporation. In this, employees and officers have been asked their choices regarding they municipal office they want to work in. Around 70% officials opted for the Jaipur Municipal Corporation, Greater.

The reasons appear to be the fact that most of the areas in the Jaipur Heritage office are of boundary wall and slum area which is disputed. Apart from this, problems like dirt, sewer and traffic congestion are constant issues in the said area. Compared to this, in Jaipur Greater, there is neither such disputed area nor there are more complaints related to cleanliness.

Moreover, for revenue officer there won’t be much work as most of the properties in the Heritage city are not taxable due to their small size. The office of Jaipur Heritage is being built in the old PHQ office in the boundary wall, while the office of Jaipur Greater will remain in the existing corporation headquarters on Tonk Road.

Officials at the JMC said that at first their focus is to get the two municipal corporations start functioning. “Both the municipal corporations have started functioning on paper now with the decision of number of officials the process will soon begin,” said a JMC official.

Title: Mopa airport gets green clearance, with addendums
Content:
Panaji: Union environment minister Prakash Javadekar said that he has given environmental clearance for the Greenfield international airport at Mopa. He said that the EC will pave way for overall development for the region and boost tourism in the state.

A senior officer said that the addendum environmental clearance has been given to Mopa airport based on the directions and recommendations of the National Green Tribunal (NGT), expert appraisal committee (EAC) of the environment ministry and the recent Supreme Court order.

“My gratitude to Javadekar for the environmental approval to Mopa International Airport, with addendums, as per the Supreme Court judgment, to the original EC,” chief minister Pramod Sawant said on Thursday.

In October 2015, the environment ministry had issued environmental clearance to the Mopa airport. The EC was suspended by the Supreme Court in March 2019 after activists challenged it.

On January 16, the Supreme Court lifted the suspension on construction of the greenfield airport being developed by the GMR Group, and asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) to oversee the project to ensure there is no environmental damage or danger to flora and fauna of the area.

Title: Panchayat official held taking bribe
Content: A technical assistant of the Pahadi Panchayat Samiti of Bharatpur district was arrested by a team of the Anti-Corruption Bureau for allegedly taking a bribe of Rs 30,000, an official said. The accused, M D Khan, had demanded the bribe from one Iqbal, a former sarpanch, for an official work.

Title: Vadodara: Man’s second wife dumps him for her ex-husband
Content:
Representative image

VADODARA: An auto garage owner living in Yakutpura was left shocked after his second wife dumped him for her previous husband and also took with her cash and ornaments worth Rs 2.6 lakh.

Mohammed Shakil Mansuri, who lives near Adaniyapul in Yakutpura, lodged a complaint of cheating against his second wife Iram and her previous husband Salman Shahbuddin at City police station on Wednesday.

According to Mansuri, Iram was not found in the house on February 6 so he checked in the neighbourhood. One of the neighbours told him that he had seen Iram going with a man in the car early in the morning.

Mansuri called her, but her phone was switched off so he suspected that she must have fled with Shahbuddin as she was in touch with him even after the marriage in November last year. On coming back home, Mansuri found out that she had also taken along Rs 1.2 lakh cash and ornaments worth Rs 1.4 lakh with her.

Later, Mansuri went to Shahbuddin’s home at Indore to convince her and bring her back to Vadodara. However, she refused to come with him as she was still fond of Shahbuddin. Mansuri waited for a month as even Iram’s parents tried to talk to her, but when she kept refusing to come to Vadodara, Mansuri approached police.

Cops said that Mansuri married Iram in November as he was not able to have kids from his first wife. “Iram is complainant’s sister-in-law’s daughter and as everyone in the family were fine with the alliance Mansuri and Iram got married at his home in Vadodara,” said a police official.

Title: Stray dog sterilisation drive likely to resume in April
Content:
Trichy: The Trichy Corporation and Animal husbandry department have chalked out plans to resume the stray dogs sterilisation drive from April. A meeting conducted recently identified a Trichy-based NGO recognised by Animal Welfare Board of India (AWBI) to resume the sterilisation drive at the corporation’s Animal Birth Control (ABC) centre at Konakkarai.

Since August 2019, the sterilisation drive at ABC centre was suspended owing to poor sterilisation practice at the centre. Though the civic body had requested NGOs recognised by AWBI to take up the sterilisation process, officials said that none of the NGOs turned up in the last few months.

As the menace of stray dogs was persistently affecting the public, the district administration convened a meeting recently which was attended by social activists, civic body and animal husbandry department.

The credibility of the NGO, their resources and work plan to neuter the dogs shall be verified within a week.
