Title: Coronavirus scare: Focus now on prevention, says Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
Content:
New cases in Kannur and Thrissur

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: After two new Covid-19 cases were reported in the state on Thursday, the chief minister said that the state should exercise caution to curb the spread of the disease.Addressing the media after a review meeting in the evening, Pinarayi Vijayan said that the new cases came from persons who had visited Middle-Eastern nations. “Medical colleges in Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode are testing samples. And 65 new persons were admitted in hospitals on Thursday; 33 others who were under observation removed from list as they have no disease. Those removed from list is over 4,000 now,” said the chief minister.We are facing a situation that is not fully under our control and so the focus now is on prevention. We should take full precaution and keep our homes, premises clean and ensure personal hygiene. LSGD bodies should also take care and field workers should also be cared for; government will ensure the same, said the chief minister.“At present, the situation is bad as more cases are being reported. But we should not panic. Instead we should take the initiative to check the spread of virus in the community, he said.State ministers have been asked to convene a review meeting in all the districts on Saturday. All local bodies and the police have been asked to work in tandem with the health department to spread the awareness.The chief minister asked persons, who have suspected symptoms, to avoid public transport. “Such persons should contact helpline numbers and they will provide all assistance and give immediate care,” he said.To create awareness among the people, it has been decided to start announcements at railway stations across the state. Steps are being taken to make the announcements inside the trains also.The 44-year-old-man from Kannur, who came from Dubai, tested positive for Covid-19, one week after he came on leave. District collector T V Subhash said the person, who is a driver in Dubai, reached Kannur via Kozhikode airport on March 5. Though he had cold at that time, he contracted fever on March 7, following which he was taken to Kannur medical College in Pariyaram from where they collected samples and asked him to undergo home quarantine. After the result came, he was shifted to an isolation ward, said the officials.He had maintained contact with a few relatives, who are quarantined at home. They will be hospitalized if need arises after a medical test.The Covid-19 patient in Thrissur was a co-passenger of the Ranni family from Italy, who arrived in Kochi by flight QR-514 from Doha on February 29. The 21-year-old man contacted the health authorities after learning that the Ranni trio had tested positive for Covid-19 on March 8, and was quarantined in the General Hospital.He was among the five passengers in the high-risk category. Reports said he had attended an engagement function.Thrissur district collector S Shanavas said efforts were on to track all those who had meet the patient. He would be shifted the medical college hospital if necessary, the collector said.

Title: Can Godavari be linked to Cauvery?
Content:
Chennai: After four decades of court battles over inter-state sharing of Cauvery river water, Tamil Nadu is now pinning its hopes on the Godavari-Cauvery inter-linking to meet its future requirements. Ahead of assembly polls, chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami is propping this up as the big development project and extending an invite to his counterparts in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh for talks.

While the high-profile meet could take place as early as April-end, obstacles lie at every turn for the ambitious project . The blueprint was drawn after a hydrological analysis by the Union Jal Shakti ministry that revealed there is surplus of 429 thousand million cubic feet (tmcft) at Manibhadra (Mahanadi basin) and 530tmcft at Polavaram ( Godavari basin).

To tap into the surplus, nine links have been planned under peninsular river component connecting Mahanadi, Godavari, Krishna, Pennar, Cauvery, Vaigai and Gundar. While a substantial quantum from Himalayan rivers could be diverted to Mahanadi, the first leg of peninsular component, Mahanadi-Godavari link, may not materialise. One of the issues is that work on the proposed storage reservoirs at Manibhadra on Mahanadi and Inchampalli on Godavari could not be taken up by the co-basin states in view of floods.

So talks are on for the next leg, that proposes to divert 247tmcft from Godavari to Krishna, and further down to Cauvery. There are three routes being identified between Godavari and Krishna. But its implementation is under a cloud. Sample this: The Centre sent the draft detailed project report to all nine states, including Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra and Karnataka in March last year. "But states like Telangana, Odisha, Kerala and Union territory of Puducherry are yet to send their comments. Chhattisgarh is objecting to the proposal," said a ministry official. The Telangana government built barrages at Sundilla, Annaram, Medigedda – to harness Godavari river water under its Rs80,000 crore Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation project last year, which could have disturbed Chhattisgarh.

But water managers are eyeing the diversion of unused waters on the Chhattisgarh side from Indravati river, tributary of Godavari, for diversion to Pennar and Cauvery. This diversion will help improve water supply in Telangana, Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu. As per the draft report, Godavari (Inchampalli)-Cauvery (Grand Anicut) link will offer Telangana 66tmcft, Andhra Pradesh 81tmcft and Tamil Nadu 83tmcft.

In Andhra Pradesh, the Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy government is showing "great interest" in implementing irrigation schemes. It revoked the previous contract of erstwhile TDP government and chose a new bidder, Megha Engineering and Infrastructure for the mega Polavaram irrigation project on the Godavari. In October, Jagan announced another diversion of Godavari water from Polavaram dam to Banakacherla head regulator at Rs60,000 crore. "The Centre plans to divert some water from Polavaram that drains into sea, for the Godavari-Cauvery link. This will enhance the supply to Tamil Nadu to 88tmcft. Looks like many of the water problems could be solved if only water is brought under the concurrent list," an official said.

In Tamil Nadu, Cauvery is the lifeline. One-third of its population relies on the river for drinking water, irrigation and power. Sources say influential bidders are keen on the meeting of chief ministers of the three southern states for the Godavari-Cauvery link. Though not a direct a beneficiary, Karnataka is equally interested in the project as it will reduce the skirmishes over sharing Cauvery water with Tamil Nadu.

The Centre has set the a deadline of 2022-23 to complete the detailed project reports of the identified 13 of the 16 links in the peninsular component. Study on Tamil Nadu’s request for Pamba-Achankovil-Vaippar link could not be taken up after Kerala’s objections due to environmental issues. A study to link the Netravathi and Hemavathi, a tributary of Cauvery in Karnataka could not be taken up for similar reasons. Only a consensus of the states will ensure the project is not just a pipe dream.

Title: Wife of Italian shifted from SMS Hospital to RUHS
Content:
Jaipur: Wife of 69-year-old Italian tourist has been shifted from Sawai Man Singh Hospital’s isolation ward to Rajasthan University of Health Sciences (RUHS) Medical College on Thursday after she tested negative for coronavirus. She was tested positive for the disease on March 4. Her husband was the first Covid-19 case of the state who was diagnosed with the disease on March 3.

Since then, they were undergoing treatment at an isolation ward of the SMS Hospital for Covid-19. It has come as a major relief for the health department as they have successfully treated her completely, while her husband is still undergoing treatment. The doctors have shifted her to RUHS where they have kept people who are under observation. There are four Italians, one each from Japan, Hong Kong and Germany, who are kept at RUHS under observation.

“The 69-year-old Italian tourist is also recovering. On Thursday, the doctors have taken him off from oxygen supply to check his breathing. He responded well,” said Dr D S Meena, superintendent of SMS Hospital.

However, condition of 85-year-old man, who was tested positive for Covid-19 on March 10, is stable. The doctors have put him on non-invasive ventilator support. He is already suffering from other diseases such as diabetes and hypertension. Moreover, his kidney is not functioning properly.

“He is suffering from chronic kidney failure. He is having multiple diseases and he is being provided with the treatment accordingly,” said Dr Meena.

Moreover, a taxi driver was admitted to the isolation ward of SMS Hospital having complaints of fever, cough and cold.

Title: No formalin in fish, eat it, live for 100yrs: Min
Content:
Chennai: There is no formalin in any type of fish sold in Tamil Nadu and people can eat fish without any doubt and live for a 100 years, said state fisheries minister D Jayakumar . DMK Cheyyur MLA R T Arasu raised the issue of formalin found in fish sold in markets across the state.

Replying to the question, the minister said what was seized in Madurai was only stale fish and only the media had said the fish contained formalin. “There is no formalin in any type of fish. In Madurai, fish from some other state was sold and it was found to be stale. The officials only seized the spoiled fish but it was reported that formalin was found,” said the minister.

The minister also refused to set up a fish landing centre in Chandrapaadi in Nagapattinam district as there is a another fish landing centre 8km away, in Tharangambadi.

Title: NEET-PG aspirant moves HC over quota
Content:
Representative image

MUMBAI: The state government’s policy to apply quota to seats surrendered to the state after the all-India quota admissions for post-graduate medical courses results in a loss of 80-100 seats for open category students every year, aspirants have alleged. A post-graduate aspirant, who appeared for NEET-PG this year, has challenged the policy in court.

In post-graduate courses at government medical colleges, 50% of total seats are reserved for all-India quota. Several seats are vacant under the quota after the second round of counselling, though, as students may prefer their home states over Maharashtra. While these seats are reverted to the state, admission authorities apply state reservations before making these available in the centralized admission process, said Sunil Biyani, father of the aspirant, who moved court.

“In the process, several seats in the open category are lost to reservations. With increased reservations in the state after Maratha quota, very few seats will be left for students in the open category,” said Biyani. His daughter, who appeared for NEET-PG this year, scored an all-India rank above 15,000. The student has moved Aurangabad bench of the Bombay high court .

Advocate Shrirang Choudhary said in 2018, around 280 seats from the open category and 80 from the SC and ST category were returned to the state after the second round. “At that time, the government followed 52% reservation in the state, which was then applied to the 360 seats reverted to the state. In doing so, the seats in MD/MS courses shrunk for open category students,” said Choudhary. Dr T P Lahane, director, DMER, said it is the state policy to apply reservations to all seats that are surrendered to them.

Title: After DEO summons, school nixes fee hike
Content:
Ahmedabad: After facing protests from parents who claimed that SH Kharawala, AG & LD Primary School (SHKAGLDPS) had announced doubling of fees for primary students, the school authorities today said they will continue with the existing fee structure, without any hike.

Earlier this week, parents claimed that they had received mobile messages that the school authorities had decided to increase the fees from Rs 20,000 per student to Rs 40,000 per student. The parents protested at the school campus and complained to the district education officer (DEO), Ahmedabad, R C Patel. They claimed that A G School officials sent messages announcing 100% hike in fees without the mandatory approval from the Fee Regulatory Committee (FRC), Ahmedabad.

In response to a show-cause notice issued by the district education officer (DEO), Ahmedabad, R C Patel, the school authorities on Thursday said that they will continue with the existing fee structure of Rs 20,000 per student. “They will continue with the existing fee structure and any changes in it can be made only after clearance from the Fee Regulatory Committee (FRC), Ahmedabad,” said DEO Patel.

tnn

Title: 2 Malayali nurses in Bahrain test positive, condition stable
Content: Kannur: At least two Malayali nurses and three others, all working in a clinic, are undergoing treatment in a hospital in Bahrain , after they tested positive for Covid-19 . One of them is from Kasaragod and the other is from Thiruvananthapuram, and all the five have been admitted to the isolation wards of Salmaniya Medical Hospital in Manama , which is a government-run hospital.The nurse from Kasaragod said that all of them work in a private clinic in Manama, and one Iranian patient was admitted there a few days ago. He was tested positive for Covid-19 after he was discharged, and later the health department officials tracked his medical history and came to the clinic with the information. The officials asked all the staffers to get screened for the virus, in which five of them tested positive.Out of the other three, two are from other parts of India while the third one is from Bahrain.“We have no health problem and there is no major medication, so there is no need to get panicky,” said the nurse, adding that they have been admitted to the isolation ward to prevent the spread of the disease and for better healthcare. At the time of screening they had no symptom of the infection, she added.Though the families of some of them wanted them to return to India and get treatment here, they are stable and there is no need to travel which in turn might pose risks for others, she said. tnn

Title: 100% campus placement for 2018-20: NIBM
Content:
Pune: The National Institute of Bank Management (NIBM) stated that it had achieved 100% campus placements for the 2018-2020 batch.

“All 118 students of the PGDM (banking & financial services) 2018-20 batch are placed. The current batch size was larger than all the earlier batches of PGDM,” the institute said.

The institute said 32 companies visited the campus this year and the highest number of students was recruited by Axis Bank and HSBC. It said the major domain the students had been recruited for was risk management.

“The highest package offered this year is Rs22 lakh and the average is Rs9.7 lakh per annum,” the institute added.

Title: Coronavirus in Delhi: SDMC turns a floor of Kalkaji hospital into isolation ward
Content: NEW DELHI: South Delhi Municipal Corporation has turned the vacant portion of its hospital in Kalkaji into an isolation ward in a period of less than 24 hours. As the number of confirmed Covid-19 cases in the city increase, authorities are looking for more spaces that can be turned into isolation wards where patients may be kept if the burden on existing facilities increases.A senior municipal corporation official said that urgent instructions had been issued by lieutenant governor Anil Baijal to prepare more isolation wards and Purnima Sethi Hospital, which has multiple floors lying vacant, was found to be an ideal place. “This is the first isolation ward that has been developed by us. It is situated on the third floor of the building and can accommodate 30 suspected patients,” the spokesperson of the civic body said.The suspected patients will be provided with medicines, food and other facilities by the corporation. “We have made adequate provisions for disinfecting and sanitising the premises on a regular basis,” a senior doctor said.Another senior public health department official said that preparations to cater to additional patient load are being made on war footing and instructions regarding the new isolation ward from the LG were received on Wednesday night. “Patients will be kept under observation for 14 days and regular tests will be carried out. Only when the Covid-19 tests come out negative, the patient will be allowed to leave,” he added. Official are also considering turning some of the community centres into isolation facilities.

Title: BJP partner AIADMK puts NPR on hold in Tamil Nadu
Content:
R B Udayakumar

CHENNAI: The updation of National Population Register has been put on hold in Tamil Nadu until the state government receives clarifications from the Centre on the three new questions in the form, revenue minister R B Udayakumar said here on Thursday.

He told mediapersons that the state government has notified only the Houselisting Operation as of now. The Union government issued an order for Houselisting Operation, along with updation of NPR for a period of 45 days. It has to be done from April to September this year.

“We have notified only the Houselisting and Housing Census between June 16 and July 30, and there is no notification for updation of NPR. We will take up NPR exercise only when a response is received from the Centre. We have not received it yet,” the minister said.

Union Home minister Amit Shah told Parliament on Thursday that no citizen will be marked ‘D’ or ‘doubtful’ during the updating exercise and no documents are needed to prove citizenship.

Chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami had sought clarifications on the three additional questions in NPR 2020 format, including mother tongue, place and date of birth of parents and spouses.

Udayakumar said the state had no competence to revoke a Parliamentary law, but the opposition was indulging in false propaganda that NPR required submission of documents.

“We say it again that there is no need for submission of documents for NPR. Enumerator will only register the details provided by the citizen,” he said, reiterating that the NPR exercise was meant for all sections, irrespective of religion and caste. The minister said the states that had passed resolutions in the assembly against NPR too had notified the conduct of NPR exercise in their respective states, including Bihar and Punjab.

Taking a dig at DMK president M K Stalin, who urged the anti-CAA protesters in Washermenpet to remain non-cooperative to the NPR exercise, Udayakumar sought to know how welfare schemes could be evolved and funds could be received if the basic data about the population was not available.

“The opposition and the DMK leader were conspiring to make the minorities scapegoat and earn political gains,” the minister said, adding the AIADMK’s influence among the minorities would not reduce a bit.

Title: MKU syndicate likely to meet on March 24: VC
Content:
Madurai: The next syndicate meeting of the Madurai Kamaraj University (MKU), to discuss a host of issues including various pending complaints of wrongdoings, is likely to be held on March 24, vice-chancellor M Krishnan said on Thursday.

The syndicate is expected to take a decision on the alleged graft charges and wrongdoings of controller of examination, O Ravi and a misconduct complaint against a faculty member of a MKU constituent college in Thirumangalam.

The CoE has already submitted his replies to the two charge memos issued by the MKU VC seeking explanation regarding two separate alleged wrongdoings.

The first was with regard to an incident on January 23, where an unauthorised personnel from a distance education centre was found going through consolidated marksheets in the CoE office.

The second was about the issue of November 2019 exam answer sheets being lost and found just before the results were to be announced on February 10. The CoE was also accused of corruption and bribery.

In another instance, a teaching faculty member from an MKU constituent college in Thirumangalam was accused of indulging in unprofessional behaviour by several female faculty and students.

An internal committee was subsequently formed to look into the matter and a report submitted to the VC.

The last MKU syndicate meeting was held on January 29. During that meeting, it was decided to call for a re-advertisement for the post of registrar as all candidates interviewed that day were found unsuitable.

Title: Bus passengers nab criminal
Content:
Pune: The passengers aboard an MSRTC bus nabbed a criminal on record after he stole Rs21,600 from a private contractor at the Swargate terminus around 2pm on Wednesday.

Avez Parvez Shaikh (19) from Hadapsar has been remanded in police custody till March 14.

The contractor, Arun Hande (52) from Sangamner in Ahmednagar district, boarded the bus bound for Bhor after it arrived at the terminus.

“Shaikh was standing behind Hande when they boarded the bus. On finding the bus packed with passengers, Shaikh stole Rs21,600 from Hande’s trouser pocket. Before Hande could react to the situation, Shaikh pushed him ahead and tried to flee. He was nabbed by the passengers boarding the bus after Hande raised an alarm,” said senior inspector Bramhanand Naikawadi of the Swargate police.

Naikawadi said, “We have recovered the amount from Shaikh. We have prosecuted him for committing robbery under Section 392 of the Indian Penal Code. The passengers, with the aid of bus driver Rajesh Shirke, brought Shaikh to the police station.”

“Shaikh has eight cases registered against him with the Swargate, Bund Garden, Hadapsar and Bharti Vidyapeeth police stations since 2018. We are questioning him to trace his accomplices. We suspect his involvement in more pickpocketing cases,” he added.

Title: Exam committee to decide on Class X maths grace marks
Content:
Ahmedabad: After an uproar about the board’s Class X mathematics paper being too tough, the board exam committee has decided to hold an inquiry and decide if those who took the exam merit grace marks or not.

The Gujarat Secondary and Higher Secondary Education Board (GSHSEB) exam committee will take up the issue at an upcoming internal meeting, said sources.

“We have received numerous complaints from students claiming that the maths paper was very tough. Some of the questions were not part of the curriculum. To ensure that students do not face any injustice, we will look into the matter at our upcoming exam committee meeting. We will also take a call on grace marks,” said Priyavardhan Karat, a member of GSHSEB exam committee.

On Wednesday, many students complained that the mathematics board exam paper was very difficult and that many questions were from outside the course content. Last year, as many as 2.5 lakh students failed in maths exam and the number is expected to go higher this time, subject experts say. Some mathematics teachers who analyzed the question paper claimed it did not follow the blueprint to set papers.

The blueprint suggests that for setting the exam paper, questions with a total weightage of 15% may fall in the ‘tough’ category, which was not the case here, said a mathematics teacher with 20 years of work experience. About one fourth of the paper was tough, he added.

Many parents and teachers also complained that students were asked to solve tough sums that are usually asked in competitive exams like GujCET.

Title: Glaucoma awareness rally in Tirunelveli
Content:
Madurai: Students from various nursing colleges took part in a glaucoma awareness rally held in Tirunelveli on Thursday.

Dr Agarwal Eye Hospital organised the rally as part of the World Glaucoma Awareness Week, being observed from March 8 to March 14. Glaucoma is an eye condition that causes damage to the optic nerve and affects vision. This disease is mainly due to genetic factors and is not curable.

The rally was flagged off by the dean of Tirunelveli Medical College Hospital, Dr M Ravichandran in the presence of members of the Tirunelveli branch of the Indian Medical Association.

The rally began at Cathedral School and concluded at Dr Agarwal Eye Hospital in Vannarapettai.

Dr Lionalraj, regional medical director of Tirunelveli Dr Agarwal Eye Hospital, said, “Glaucoma is a silent thief of sight. The disease is caused by genetic factors, metabolic diseases like diabetes in people above 40 years. Those above 40 years must undergo glaucoma test at least once a year.”The hospital is performing free glaucoma tests on people aged above 40 years till March 14.

Title: Coronavirus in Jaipur: Health department intensifies screening
Content:
TimesView Apart from the door-to-door survey done in city's Adarsh Nagar area, which reported the first case of a Jaipur resident contracting the coronavirus, the health department has to take some bold decisions to discourage mass gatherings in the city. In Delhi, cinema halls, schools & colleges have been closed. The district collector should take precautionary measures and issue directions to shut schools and cinema halls for a restricted period. Also, it is the responsibility of citizens not to go out of their homes without reason and avoid public gatherings. Prevention is better than cure.

JAIPUR: The health department authorities have started disinfecting temples, government offices and tourist places in Jaipur following three cases of coronavirus being detected here. The officials are conducting screening of residential and commercial areas in a 3-km area of the house of an 85-year-old person who tested positive for coronavirus early this week.“A three-layer screening system is in place. First a team of ANMs, then deputy chief medical officers and finally RRTs are conducting surveys in these areas. They are collecting history if anyone in the family who went abroad recently or anyone suffering from influenza-like illness,” said Dr Narrottam Sharma, chief medical health officer (CMHO), Jaipur (I).Moreover, the health department has conducted screening of persons who came in contact with the person returned from Dubai and tested positive for Covid-19 on March 10 at SMS Hospital. Samples of four persons were taken and they were tested negative for the disease.As of now, there are 25 persons who are kept in isolation wards in different parts of the state. Out of those, 15 are admitted to SMS Hospital, RUHS Medical College and Mahatma Gandhi Hospital. Four are kept in isolation in Kota, three in Jhunjhunu, two in Udaipur and one in Bharatpur.Moreover, 576 persons have been advised to remain inside their homes for isolating them as they were found suffering from influenza-like illness. They are kept under observation.So far, 331 teams have conducted screening of three lakh people of the state. The nursing students are helping the health authorities in conducting screening in the state. There are 8,600 nursing students conducting door-to-door survey.A doctor, who was posted at corona control room has been suspended for alleged carelessness in disposing her duty.

Title: Don’t refuse to admit suspected coronavirus patients: Rajasthan govt to private hospitals
Content: JAIPUR: Reminding ethics of ‘medical profession’, the health department has pulled up private hospitals for refusing admission of a suspected coronavirus (Covid-19) person who later tested positive for the disease on March 9 at government-run Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Hospital where all the three such patients are undergoing treatment.Seeking help of private hospitals, the department had issued two communications on March 3 and March 8 for their cooperation in containing Covid-19.“Inspite of communications and a meeting of myself with leading private hospitals of Jaipur on March 3, it was brought to my notice that admission to a suspected corona patient was denied (who was later admitted to SMS Hospital) on night of March 8. This goes against the ethics of medical profession and humanity,” Rohit Kumar Singh, additional chief secretary, health department wrote to Dr M N Thareja, president of Indian Medical Association (IMA), Rajasthan branch.However, it mentioned in the letter appealing them to ensure that all private hospitals in the state extend their full cooperation for treatment and management of suspected coronavirus cases.The officials said that 85-year-old patient was tested positive for Covid-19. They have conducted screening of healthcare staff where the patient had gone on March 8 for treatment but he did not get admission. He reached SMS Hospital at around 3am on March 9 in critical condition.Acting on it, health department has directed all private hospitals remain prepared by making availability of separate functional isolation ward and beds for the suspected and confirmed Covid-19 patients. Moreover, a separate OPD for influenza-like illness and upper respiratory infection patients.Also, directions have been issued to private hospitals to make availability of doctors and paramedics for management of such patients in isolation ward.For diagnostic test, the private hospitals have been directed to coordinate with SMS Hospital for sample collection of suspected cases, if need arises.Also, the private hospitals have been told to generate awareness among patients coming to hospitals about Covid-19 by displaying material such as posters and LED.

Title: Pune-bound Shivshahi bus catches fire, all on board safe
Content:
The bus caught fire at the base of Chandanapuri Ghat.

NASHIK: Twenty-two passengers of the Nashik-Pune Shivshahi bus escaped unhurt when the vehicle caught fire on Thursday morning, thanks to presence of mind shown by the driver, Batu Arjun Ahire.

The alert driver brought the bus to a halt near Chandanapuri ghat in Ahmednagar district soon after noticing smoke coming out of it and told the passengers to get down, MSRTC officials from Nashik division said.

The Ahmednagar division officers of the MSRTC, who will be investigating the incident, said the likely cause of the fire could be short circuit, but an investigation is under way.

The MSRTC officials in Nashik said that the bus started its journey from New CBS in Nashik at 6.15 am. “When the bus approached the base of Chandanapuri Ghat at around 8.30am, after crossing the Sangamner bus stand, the driver noticed smoke coming out from the bus and immediately stopped.”

Driver Ahire quickly de-boarded the passengers and took them to a safe distance from the bus, which was soon engulfed by flames. Two fire tenders rushed to the spot and doused the fire in 15 minutes, but the belongings of the passengers had already been damaged.

The highway police rushed to the spot and took control of the situation, stopping vehicular traffic as a precautionary measure.

“We immediately stopped the movement of vehicular traffic on the opposite side of the road as well. The decision was taken so that the relief and rescue operations were not hampered. An ambulance also rushed to the spot, but fortunately, all the passengers managed to escape unhurt,” said a police officer said.

Title: Civil hospital drawing on H1N1 experience to fight Covid-19
Content:
Nashik: The management of the Nashik Civil Hospital is in a much better position to handle the Covid-19 pandemic than it was during the 2009 swine flu outbreak.

The experience that the hospital management had in dealing with swine flu cases is now helping it deal with the new pandemic. The hospital is also much better equipped as the state government has upgraded the medical infrastructure since the swine flu outbreak.

“The experience that the doctors and the para-medical personnel gained in handling swine flu patients is helping us now. Many of those doctors and para medicos are still with us. And they have trained the ones who joined hospital later,” said Nashik civil surgeon Suresh Jagdale.

When the swine flu broke out, the civil hospital initially had 7-8 beds. “Over the years, we increased the number as our staff became trained to handle more patients. Now, even without any confirmed coronavirus case, we have already established a 15-bed isolation ward. We have another 15 beds in reserve,” he said.

The only difference is that there was a prescribed medicine — Tamiflu — for swine flu patients. “But in the case of Covid-19, the doctors have to treat the patients based on symptoms. There is ample stock of such medicines with us,” he added.

The civil hospital has three physicians and one pulmonologist at its disposal. “There are several pulmonologists in private hospitals. We can always fall back on them if need be,” the civil surgeon said. However, the hospital has requested the state government for a more physicians and pulmonologists.

“The immunity among Indians is better. The spread of this virus is manageable. To start with, refrain from touching surfaces and then your nose or mouth. This eradicates 90% chances of catching this infection,” he said.

Title: Local IT firm sues Microsoft for trademark violation
Content:
Ahmedabad: A local Information Technology company, Azure Knowledge Corporation, has sued international software giant Microsoft Corporation, complaining that the latter is violating its rights by use of its trademark ‘Azure’.

The local company urged the court to stop Microsoft from infringing on its trademark rights by using the terms ‘Azure’, ‘Microsoft Azure’, ‘Azure Cosmos DB’, ‘Azure Cloud for All’, ‘Azure Sphere’, ‘Azure Brain Wave’ and other words deceptively similar to the registered trademark. It termed Microsoft’s use of the domain name ‘www.azure.microsoft.com’ an infringement and demanded that Microsoft be told to stop using it or to change it.

In response to local company’s suit, a city civil court issued notice to Microsoft last month seeking its reply. The court said it would not be proper to stay the US giant from using the name for its services without first hearing it. Microsoft filed its reply on March 6, stating that it has been using the word for its cloud services platform since 2008, and in India since 2014. Microsoft claimed that it was the prior user of the name in the field of cloud services, a statement from Azure said.

The court granted time till April 4 for both parties to submit their versions and posted a further hearing for April 18 for arguments.

Before Azure moved this court, it had been opposing Microsoft’s use of the word ever since the software giant registered ‘Windows Azure’ as a trademark. Azure filed a rectification petition before the Intellectual Property Appellate Board (IPAB) seeking cancellation of the registration, claiming exclusive rights to the trademark under certain classes as it first registered it in 1998. In fact, the company has been using this trademark since 1996.

Azure also took exception to the changed logo for Microsoft’s cloud services. “Earlier, Microsoft used a cloud symbol as its logo. Now, it has changed it to the letter ‘A’ which is the logo of our company,” an Azure official said.

Title: Hydrogen-CNG buses likely to hit Delhi roads from next month
Content:
A four-tonne per day compact reformer-based HCNG production plant has come up at DTC’s Rajghat-1 bus depot and... Read More

NEW DELHI: Starting next month, buses running on Hydrogen-enriched CNG (HCNG) are likely to hit the capital’s roads. A four-tonne per day compact reformer-based HCNG production plant has come up at DTC’s Rajghat-1 bus depot and is likely to start operations from next month.

HCNG, which is a cleaner fuel compared to CNG, will be used to run 50 Cluster scheme buses as part of a pilot project for six months. The Supreme Court had last year suggested looking at hydrogen-run vehicles as a solution for NCR’s poor air quality and while the technology will take some time to appear in the capital, HCNG could be a step in that direction.

“The plant is ready and is awaiting approval from the Petroleum Explosive Safety Organisation, which comes under the Union ministry of commerce, and approves all gas stations and filling stations,” an official associated with the project said. “The buses that will be run on HCNG would just require some tuning and no major retrofitting,” he added.

In July, Indian Oil Corporation Limited — which has developed the technology to create HCNG — and Indraprastha Gas Limited had laid the foundation stone the plant. According to IOCL, the use of compact reforming process is 30% more cost effective as compared to the physical blending of Hydrogen with CNG.

It was, in fact, a directive of the apex court in July 2018 that led to IOCL and IGL collaborating to put up this first semi-commercial plant as a pilot project for conducting the study on the use of HCNG fuel in 50 BS-IV compliant CNG-run buses in Delhi.

Mixing hydrogen with CNG physically is a difficult proposition and that is why IOCL came up with the compact reforming process, which reforms CNG with no need for mixing. For the pilot project, 50 buses of the Anthony Road Transport Ltd (a cluster scheme concessionaire) will be fed with HCNG and their efficiency and emissions would be recorded for six months run and then submitted to the Supreme Court.

Four tonne of HCNG would be produced at the plant every day and the excess fuel generated would be used to run a generator, which would produce electricity.

Title: DMK opposes JNU VC on Madras univ search panel
Content:
Chennai: Former minister and DMK MLA K Ponmudi on Thursday said Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar should not head the University of Madras VC search panel.

Speaking during the debate for grants for school and higher education departments in the assembly , he wondered how the JNU VC was appointed as head of Madras University VC search panel. Higher education minister K P Anbalagan replied that while the university’s syndicate and senate have their own nominees, the governor-chancellor has nominated M Jagadesh Kumar to the panel. “He was already in the VC search panel for Tamil Nadu Teacher Education University (TNTEU),” Anbalagan said.

“But he attack on JNU students was after that. He has links with the RSS and the state should oppose his nomination,” Ponmudi said.TNN

Title: Coronavirus scare in Delhi: Ashoka University extends break, AUD to decide today
Content: NEW DELHI: Delhi University has called off its classes till March 31 but colleges will remain open for the faculty. The decision was announced after the state government ordered closure of all schools and colleges till March 31 to check the spread of coronavirus.“To maintain continuity in the teaching-learning process, in all UG and PG programmes, study material shall be made available on a weekly basis on the website by the respective teachers of all departments/colleges and centres,” the statement said. DU said teachers shall remain available as per the time-table through e-resources. The varsity has also announced postponement of internal assessment exams till March 31 and cancellation of seminars and workshops, etc.The office of deputy CM Manish Sisodia had earlier said that “all educational institutions — schools, colleges, ITIs, polytechnics — shall remain closed till March 31 except for holding examinations. The students can be asked to attend only to take the board, term-end and semester exams.IP University has cancelled its classes. It said it’s taking steps to ensure that their campus is safe. “We will comply with government directions,” said VC Mahesh Verma. All exams will be held as scheduled and faculty and non-academic staff have to attend. Ambedkar University has, meanwhile, postponed its decision to Friday.IIT-Delhi has decided to cancel all classes, exams and public gatherings. JNU will continue to hold classes and Jamia is waiting for instructions from UGC and the HRD ministry.Meanwhile, Ashoka University has extended its term break by two weeks till March 31 while Jindal University, also in Sonepat, has said it is waiting for directions from Haryana government. Amity University in Noida has not called off its classes but is cancelling its fests, workshops and other events besides sanitising the campus.

Title: Little signs of water, but Tamil Nadu begins work on Rs 8,300 crore project
Content: CHENNAI: After declaring the Cauvery delta a protected agricultural special zone, the Tamil Nadu is betting on the Cauvery-Vaigai-Gundar link project, for which Rs700 crore has been allocated in the Budget for land acquisition and preliminary work. But this project is inextricably tied to the last leg of the Godavari-Cauvery project.Only a surplus in the Godavari will support seven districts in the south by diverting 79.5tmcft. "The Cauvery-Gundar project is estimated to cost Rs8,300 crore. The state is requesting submission of a draft in a week," a Jal Shakti ministry official said. If it materialises, the diversion of water will be made during the monsoon months, and the maximum diversion could be 15.5tmcft during December.The Cauvery-Vaigai-Gundar link passes through Karur, Trichy, Pudukkottai, Sivaganga and Virudhunagar through a link canal from the Kattalai barrage, upstream of Cauvery. "This link connecting Cauvery to Gundar serves as a conduit for the transfer of surplus Mahanadi and Godavari waters. Nevertheless, a consensus must be arrived by the states of the peninsular river basins. The existing inter-state agreements for various river basins will have to be reviewed and modified," the official said.Faced with the discomfiture of water from Karnataka reservoirs draining into the Bay of Bengal, due to lack of storage in the state, the Edappadi K Palaniswami government is keen on taking up the project. The Tamil Nadu government has been insisting on the ministry to divert water to Kattalai barrage, which is upstream of Grand Anicut for Godavari-Cauvery link, since that would mean easy transfer down south to Vaigai and Gundar rivers. The Centre is studying the option, but the final decision is yet to be taken.Experts say the inter-linking of rivers could diffuse the tensions across the border. For instance, Vaigai river is dependent on water from Mullaperiyar dam, where the state has locked horns with Kerala to raise the storage in the century-old structure to 152ft and store more water. While Kerala wants to build a new Mullaperiyar dam, Karnataka Mekedatu reservoir in the inter-state border.

Title: ISL final behind closed doors
Content: Panaji: The Indian Super League ( ISL ) final between Chennaiyin FC and ATK will be played behind closed doors at the Nehru Stadium in Fatorda on Saturday.With coronavirus fears rising with each passing day, league organisers were mulling over such a possibility and finally decided not to allow fans at the stadium after the sports ministry sent out an advisory on Thursday asking national sports federations to “ensure that no public gathering takes place in any sporting event”.According to sources, only accredited team officials, ground staff and media would be allowed at the stadium, while the final between the two teams gunning for their third ISL title will be out of bounds for everyone else.“Football Sports Development Limited, owing to the current preventive measures against Covid-19 , has decided to hold the season’s final behind closed doors. FSDL will soon initiate the process of ticket refunds and an announcement will be made through ISL channels,” the organisers stated in a statement.The announcement will come as a huge blow to many travelling fans who had already made arrangements and booked tickets to come to Goa. While league organisers said they understood the sentiment of the fans, they couldn’t put anyone’s health at risk, particularly after advisories were issued by the health and sports ministries.The ISL final will not be the only major football event that is now in danger of being played behind closed doors. The Kolkata derby between Mohun Bagan and East Bengal in the I-League will, almost certainly, also be played without any fan at the Vivekananda Yuba Bharati Krirangan on Sunday.The derby is among the most anticipated clash in Indian football and remains a huge draw. With Mohun Bagan, who won the I-League crown early this week, joining hands with ATK and moving to the ISL next season, Sunday’s derby was being touted as the “final one” in its truest form.“A decision will be taken after consulting the clubs. We understand that the derby is a huge draw but the AIFF cannot go against the directives of the sports ministry. We have two options: either play behind closed doors or postpone the game, which then may be played beyond the end of season,” said one official.There are still four more rounds to be played in the I-League and the All India Football Federation (AIFF) said they would hold a Skype meeting with representatives from all clubs on Friday to decide on the future course. With the sports ministry making it clear that public gathering cannot be allowed for any sporting event, the AIFF may be forced to take drastic measures.The sports ministry guidelines, issued to all national sports federations, states: “You are advised to adhere to the advisories issued by the ministry of health and family welfare and ensure that no public gathering takes place in any sporting event. In the event the sporting event cannot be avoided, the same could be done without allowing the gathering of people, including spectators.”

Title: Madurai’s Smart City projects get rolling in good speed
Content:
Madurai: Madurai Municipal Corporation’s Smart City Mission projects such as multi-level car parking near Meenakshi Amman Temple, the tourist plaza at Periyar bus terminal and the arrival plaza at Jansi Rani Park have been taking shape as per schedule, whereas projects such as Periyar bus terminal and the Vaigai Riverfront development are delayed a bit.

Madurai Corporation has completed chalking out its plans for projects for the entire amount under the Smart City Mission scheme. As many as 14 projects have been proposed at an estimated cost of Rs 970 crore. Projects such as underground drainage system for 15 wards on the northern part of the city at a cost of Rs 291.37 crore and a convention centre at Tamukkam ground at a cost of Rs 45.55 crore are the latest additions to the list.

Corporation officials said that they are satisfied with the overall development of the projects. However, the Periyar bus stand reconstruction and the Vaigai Riverfront development projects are not progressing as expected, they said.

Corporation commissioner S Visakan said that he is happy with the progress of a few projects including the multi-level car parking. He said that he has been closely monitoring all the projects. "I convened a meeting of officials a couple of days ago to take stock of the progress of the Periyar bus stand and the Vaigai Riverfront development projects. Although, these two projects are behind schedule, I am happy with the overall progress of the Smart City projects. Comparatively, projects in Madurai are taking shape in good speed," he said.

"The work on the multi-level car parking facility is almost finished, except the shops. Flooring and concrete works have been completed. Electrical works and fire safety works are pending," the commissioner said.

He said that the delay in a few projects such as the Vaigai Riverfront development, Masi Street works and platform work in Chithirai Street cannot be averted due to the upcoming Chithirai Festival. Certain work will be temporarily suspended in view ofthe Chithirai festival, he said.

"In Chithirai Street, cobble stone laying works will be completed by the first week of April and platform work will be taken up after the festival. Similarly, certain works in Masi Streets will be temporarily stopped in view of the festival," he said.

Officials said that the works such as multi-level car parking and the west part of Periyar bus terminal work were to be completed by April. But, now it looks like they will be completed only by July.

Title: Covid-19 outbreak: Passengers stranded in Italy uncertain about their return
Content: THRISSUR: The Keralites , who are among the 40-odd Indians stranded in an Italian airport against the backdrop of the Covid-19 outbreak, and their relatives back home are keeping their fingers crossed about the possible date of their return. Most of them remain stranded at the Flumicino airport in Italy since last Tuesday, while a few of them have shifted to a house near the airport.Speaking to TOI from Italy over the phone, the passengers said that even though the reports that an Indian health team had departed for Italy have brightened their hopes, they have not yet received any official communication. Their relatives here too are clueless about it. The Indian embassy officials in Italy too had thrown up their hands, the passengers said.“We had booked tickets on the flight operated by Emirates, but when we reported at the airport on Tuesday morning, the airlines staff told us that we cannot fly,” said the passenger Fego Francis, son of K C Francis of Neithakudy in Mala. His wife Gloria Fego and his three-month-old baby Enrico Fego are among those stranded at the airport.“According to airlines staff, the Indian authorities had informed them that passengers can travel to India only if the Italian authorities gave them a certificate that they haven’t contracted Covid-19,” said Daniel Palatty Joy of Puthenvelikkara.“It is practically impossible to get such a certificate from Italian health officials stating that these passengers free from Covid-19 at this stage since they are now busy treating the patients,’’ said Hima Biju from Kakkanad who is among the stranded passengers. Hima was working in a media company in Kerala earlier, and she is now studying at the University of Cassino in Italy.Joy Palathy, father of Daniel, said from Puthenvelikkara that the airlines informed the passengers about the new regulation for travel to India only after they reached the airport. They would not have gone to the airport, had they been alerted earlier, he said.Both Francis, father of Fego, and Joy were also working in Italy and had returned to Kerala only recently.Fego has shifted to a friend’s house near the airport along with his wife and baby.Daniel said the remaining passengers have been spending the last three days at the airport without proper food, or adequate drinking water. The supplies available at the airport are costly and not part of the regular meal, he said.

Title: Nirbhaya Case Latest News: Delhi court seeks report on Nirbhaya convict claim
Content:
Pawan Gupta

NEW DELHI: A Delhi court on Thursday sought Action Taken Report (ATR) from Mandoli Jail authorities on a plea filed by one of the death row convicts in Nirbhaya rape case , Pawan Gupta, seeking registration of an FIR against two police personnel for allegedly physically assaulting him.

A direction was given to the jail authorities to file the report by April 8. It was, however, clarified by the court that this direction won’t have a bearing on the hanging and the same won’t be stayed because of it.

Gupta through his counsel sought an FIR against two constables for alleged physical assault inside jail, where he is lodged. The incident is stated to have taken place in July, 2019.

The alleged incident Gupta’s counsel A P Singh described in the application took place on July 26 when the convict was thrashed “very badly on the head and also his entire body” with a stick inside jail number 14 of Central Jail, Mandoli. Singh said that a court issued notice to the jail authorities concerned.

The convict was beaten up again on July 28, 2019, when he received injuries all over his body besides being verbally abused, the application said. “Blood oozed from his head and only after repeated requests and a prolong delay he was sent to GTB Hospital,” the plea claimed.

It has been contended in the application that when the convict’s father approached the local police station to lodge an FIR, he was harassed and threatened. And despite representations before various police authorities no action was taken, it added. “Please take legal action as soon as possible,” the application urged the court.

Title: 5 trains cancelled as works undertaken
Content:
Nashik: The Central Railway (CR) has cancelled 10 trains, five on either side, on Saturday and Sunday, because it is undertaking traffic and power block, which will cut down movement of trains and power supply in the section.

The block will be conducted from 2am to 6am on Saturday and some trains starting their journey on Friday and Saturday will remain cancelled, the Bhusawal division of has said in a communication.

The CR’s Mumbai division is undertaking maintenance works between Kalyan and Kasara and also installation girders of foot overbridge at the Titwala station.

As per the railway authorities, the 17611 Nanded-Mumbai Rajyarani Express, 12112 Amravati-Mumbai Express, 11402 Nagpur-Mumbai Express and 51154 Bhusawal-Mumbai passenger trains have been cancelled from their point of origin on Friday, March 13.

The other trains that have been cancelled on March 14 from the point of origin include 17612 Mumbai-Nanded Rajyarani Express, 12117 Manmad-Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (LTT) Godavari Express, 12118 LTT-Manmad Godavari Express and 12111 Mumbai-Amravati Express and the 11401 Mumbai-Nagpur Express.

The Railways has also diverted the routes of large numbers of trains and hence they will not travelling beyond Manmad towards Nashik-Igatpuri and beyond Kalyan, towards Igatpuri and Nashik.

The 11062 Muzzaffarpur-LTT Express and 12541 Gorakphur-LTT Superfast trains will take a detour from Jalgaon via Vasai Road while the 11058 Amrutsar-LTT, 11016 Gorakhpur-LTT Kushinagar Express and 11025 Bhusaval-Pune Hutatma Express will be diverted via Manmad, Daund.

Two trains have been rescheduled. The 12542 LTT-Gorakhpur Superfast train will leave at 12.05pm instead of 11.10am and the 11061 LTT-Muzzaffarpur Pawan Express will leave at 15.50 instead of 12.15 pm on Saturday.

Besides, there are nine other trains that will be regulated at various stations. They will start from their point of origin at scheduled timings and will be held at the various stations.

Title: Centre mulls aid for Delhi government to start pink buses
Content:
Nitin Gadkari

NEW DELHI: After initial success of all-women “Pink Buses” on different routes in Uttar Pradesh, including the Lucknow-Allahabad route, Union road transport minister Nitin Gadkari said on Thursday that the Centre would consider providing financial support to Delhi government to run women special buses in Delhi. Similar buses can also be introduced in cities having more than one crore population, the minister informed the Lok Sabha.

While responding to a question from New Delhi MP, Meenakshi Lekhi in the Lower House during Question Hour, Gadkari said, “We will try to find a way out to provide support for running such buses in Delhi. I will talk to the women and child welfare minister Smriti Iraniji since her ministry provides fund for this. It’s the best proposition for cities where a large number of women work in offices. The buses will have women driver, women conductor and only women passengers. This will make the passengers feel safe.”

The minister also said his ministry has made it mandatory for all new buses to have cameras and panic buttons for women safety.

Title: Covid-19 in Goa: Another suspect quarantined in GMC, total touches three
Content: PANAJI: One more Covid-19 suspect , who worked on a ship and travelled to Goa on Thursday, was placed in isolation ward no. 113 of Goa Medical College, taking the total number of suspects in isolation to three.The suspect worked on a ship that travelled to Europe, including Italy, which has been under lock-down due to Covid-19 since midlast month.Dr Jose D’Sa, director of public health department (PHD), said the suspect was directly brought to GMC from the airport as he was found symptomatic for the disease.D’Sa ruled out a possibility that he (suspect) may have exposed his family and others, who had been in contact with him to the virus in the event he tests positive for coronavirus On Wednesday, two suspects — a male and a female — with travel history were quarantined at the GMC.Laboratory reports of all three suspects are awaited, GMC dean Dr S M Bandekar told TOI. The condition of all three patients“is stable”, Bandekar said.With three more persons put under home quarantine on Thursday, the number of people who have been quarantined at home rose to 36.

Title: Saamna takes on Congress for ignoring Jyotiraditya Scindia, Sachin Pilot
Content:
MUMBAI: Saamna on Thursday criticized the Congress for ignoring the party’s young leaders such as Jyotiraditya Scindia and Sachin Pilot . In an editorial, Saamna said aging Congressmen pulled out all stops to cut Scindia to size, which prompted him to join the BJP. Congress is an ally in the Shiv Sena-led Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in Maharashtra.

Saying that Scindia enjoyed considerable political clout in several parts of Madhya Pradesh, including Gwalior and Guna, Saamna said, “In fact, Scindia was the Congress face during the MP assembly elections. However, party seniors conspired against him while the Congress high command looked on helplessly.”

Stating Scindia’s demands —a Rajya Sabha seat or presidentship of MP Congress Committee—were reasonable, Saamna said the Congress high command should have pacified the millennial leader by accepting one of the demands.

Saamna, though, added Kamal Nath, Congress chief minister of MP, was not an amateur fighter. “He will not give up so easily.”

Title: Complaints on LED streetlights delay project completion
Content:
Madurai: Completion certification for the project in which streetlights are replaced with LED under the Smart City scheme will be issued only after solving the complaints of residents. The work was carried out at a cost of around Rs 29 crore. Though the work was completed months ago, it has not been counted as a completed project.

According to officials, 98% of the work has been completed so far, since a few complaints keep coming. They received a few hundred complaints a day as soon as all the bulbs were replaced with LED a few months ago. But now the number of complaints has been coming down gradually. At present, 10 to 20 complaints are received a day. “We will issue completion certification only after the complaints came down further. Once we received a few hundred calls a day regarding streetlight issues, which has come down to 10 to 20 a day,” an official said.

The project was proposed to bring uniformity to the city in terms of streetlights as there were various kinds of lights emitting different colours.

There are around 53,000 streetlights in the city. As many as 30,500 lights in 72 wards in the core city were replaced with LED bulbs under the scheme. The rest of the lights were already converted to LED streetlights.

Title: Delhi to try global player for better HoHo buses
Content:
Launched three months before the Commonwealth Games, the 14 buses ran at a frequency of 30 minutes

NEW DELHI: With its contract with the private operator running Hop-On-Hop-Off (HoHo) buses ending in July this year, Delhi government’s tourism department is mulling to invite global players to run the service in the capital.

Sources said a global tender would soon be called to invite agencies having expertise in running such a facility in other cities of the world to run HoHo bus service in Delhi.

Launched three months before the 2010 Commonwealth Games with 14 buses running at a frequency of 30 minutes, the service failed to live up to the expectations. While the number of buses currently operating has come down to just five, the footfall too has fallen to just about 40-50 people a day.

Though the tourism department had initially planned to procure 25 new buses on its own — some of them double decker with open deck to make it more attractive — and even identified three new routes, sources said the department realised that it was not equipped to run a facility of international standard.

The HoHo service enables tourists to get on and off the bus at different points of their choice. A live commentary is also delivered informing about the site or place in English and Hindi. According to tourism department officials, there are about 35 countries such as Spain (Barcelona and Madrid), United Kingdom (London), United States (Washington DC), Australia (Sydney), Ireland (Dublin), Florence (Italy), and France (Paris) which have a successful HoHo service and Delhi wanted to replicate the same model.

“Delhi has a large number of tourist destinations, some historical and some modern, which cannot be covered by running the facility on just one route. We have worked out three different circuits including one dedicated to 1857 mutiny on which the service would be run. These routes would intersect each other at two-three locations to enable tourists to go to locations of their choice,” said an official, requesting anonymity.

Another official said that the tourism department has also planned to set up interpretation centres, eateries, and recreational activities at some sites, which are under jurisdiction of Archaeological Survey of India and other agencies like Delhi Development Authority.

Title: Like U’khand in 2016, BJP will face humiliation in MP too: Harish Rawat
Content:
Dehradun: Former Uttarakhand chief minister Harish Rawat who has been deputed by the Congress to help Kamal Nath save his government, says he is offering advice based on “my own experience of handling a similar situation engineered by BJP in Uttarakhand in 2016.”

The former chief minister had faced a revolt from a section of his MLAs in 2016, who had subsequently joined the BJP. With the Congress government short of majority, central rule was imposed in the state but Rawat was later able to prove his majority in the House and save his government. In view of his experience in dealing with the crisis, Rawat along with AICC general secretary Mukul Wasnik has been deputed by the party to help in the MP situation.

Rawat who was in Jaipur on Thursday told TOI that “90-plus Congress MLAs are currently in Jaipur and contact has been made with 14 other MLAs, who have been held captive at Bengaluru.” Exuding confidence that these 14 Congress MLAs were willing to return to the party fold, Rawat said, “I am confident that we will prove our majority in Madhya Pradesh. As far as Scindia ji is concerned, he held prominent positions for a large part of his political career but it was the need for power, which took him to BJP.”

He added that the situation was different when Scindia was in Congress as he had some MLAs in his camp. “After he quit the party, his followers do not want to do so, but still they are being forcefully kept at Bengaluru. It is surprising that the PM himself is negotiating these things,” he said.

He alleged that on Thursday, the father of a Congress MLA went to Bengaluru to meet his son, but he was also detained at a police station. “What kind of democracy is this where a father cannot meet his son and bring him back?”

Attacking the BJP for creating political instability, Rawat said, “There is a sense of political uneasiness in the states because of the Narendra Modi government. They have created similar situations earlier in Assam, Uttarakhand and Goa and now are doing it in MP.” He claimed that the BJP’s top leadership was “unable to digest anything which is against them, even the peoples’ mandate.” “Whether it is through Vijay Bahuguna in Uttarakhand or Jyotiraditya Scindia in Madhya Pradesh, the BJP is quick to pounce on the situation and aggressively act against any state government which is of another political outfit.”

Title: Fighting the virus with film songs
Content: Kochi: As the state is on high alert over Covid-19, a set of audio jingles using catchy tunes from popular Malayalam film songs that spreads awareness on Covid-19 created by the National Health Mission NHM ) has gone viral on social media.These jingles, which starts off with catchy numbers like ‘Thottu thottu nokkaamo thottaavaadee ninne’ and ‘thotturummi irikkan kothiyaayi’, were created by the behavioural change communication (BCC) wing of NHM with help from private FM stations. The messaging is about the need for social isolation by keeping a distance, the need to desist from touching and wearing of masks. Towards the end of the messages, which are less than 25 seconds, 1056, the helpline number of Direct Intervention System for Health Awareness (Disha) is provided.“We do lot of mass media campaigns including in radio and these jingles were created with the help of RJs from a private radio station,” said Shinosh K P, senior consultant BCC wing.“We wanted to give out positive, reassuring messages because right now there is lot of fear and negativity associated with the outbreak. Everyone would be able to relate to it and if the message is appealing their would be more acceptance,” said Shinosh.

Title: Kalpasar project still being studied
Content:
Gandhinagar: The state government has spent another Rs 61.87 crore between April 2018 and December 2019, for the Kalpasar project which is yet to be formally announced.

The government in its reply to the question of Petlad MLA Niranjan Patel has said that as on December 31, 2019, the Kalpasar project is yet to be formally announced. However, the government has since January 22, 2003, given permission for studying the feasibility of the project.

The government claimed that the required permission for the project will be obtained from various departments of the Union government. The state government said that Rs 35.91 crore was spent in 2017-18 and Rs 20.36 crore in 2018-19 on feasibility studies for the project. In the year 2019-2020 (till December 31, 2019) a total of Rs 5.60 crore has been spent for the same purpose.

Officials pointed out that even three decades after the Kalpasar project was conceptualized, feasibility reports are still being carried out. The government is yet to give any deadline for the commencement of the project.

Conceptualized in 1989, the first pre-feasibility report for the project was prepared in 1996. Six special reports were prepared in 1999 and preparation of the final feasibility report has been going on since 2003. As many as 25 studies have been completed,

Title: Gujarat sold power at rates between Rs 3.79 and Rs 5.13 per unit
Content:
Gandhinagar: The state government has sold power to 10 states of the country at prices ranging from Rs 3.79 to 5.13 per unit and 138.21 million units were sold to the Indian Energy Exchange at Rs 4.11 per unit.

Energy minister Saurabh Patel, in reply to a question by Modasa MLA Rajendrasinh Thakor, said the state produced excess power and this was sold on the open market. The minister said consumption fluctuates due to various reasons. He said that a fall in demand from industry, holidays or even changed weather causes consumption to fall and excess power is sold to other states through the Indian Energy Exchange.

The minister said only surplus power is sold, after meeting demand from within the state.

In reply to a question by Wankaner MLA Mohammed Javed Pirzada, the state government stated that it entered a power purchase agreement with various companies and the rates have been agreed on. The minister said the government in 2018 paid Rs 382 crore to buy power from private companies. The power purchase agreement with CLP India Private Limited ended on December 2018.

Title: Colour blind may get licence to drive
Content:
Representational photo.

NEW DELHI: Colour blindness may not remain a bar any more for getting licence to drive private vehicles and those with “mild or moderate colour vision deficiency” may get to drive commercial vehicles too.

The road transport ministry is preparing the draft norms after a panel of ophthalmologists from AIIMS gave its recommendations on this issue. The ministry had referred the case to AIIMS to seek its view after receiving several representations.

Sources said debarring people with colour blindness would impact around 3% population.

Colour blindness or colour vision deficiency is the inability or decreased ability to perceive colour differences under normal light conditions. In India, prevalence of congenital colour blindness is about 8% in males and 0.4% in females. While conducting the study, the AIIMS panel found that European Union has dropped the provision of colour blindness to obtain driving licence while in United States, licences are not issued to such persons for driving commercial vehicles.

Citing international studies, the panel said those with colour deficiency can recognise traffic lights and signs based on multiple sources of information in addition to colour. It said ancillary clues such as luminance, position and pattern can help a colour-deficient driver in recognising traffic lights or signs.

The panel has recommended that there is no need to test colour blindness for licence to drive private vehicles including two-wheelers. It has also said badges, which the state transport departments issue to commercial drivers, can be issued to such applicants, if the deficiency is mild or moderate. In case of serious deficiencies, no badge should be issued. It also said the LEDs of traffic lights can be made friendly for people with colour blindness as per the International Commission on Illumination.

“It is a good step. It will not pose any challenge to road safety. If the applicants pass the practical driving test, which is becoming more automated, there should be no issue. This will also shut another door for corruption,” said Anil Chikkara of Delhi’s transport department.

Ministry officials said the Centre will issue guidelines to states on how to have uniform luminance, position and pattern of traffic lights and signals.

Title: Why no Metro to Old City, Musi not a hurdle: Akbaruddin Owaisi
Content:
Akbaruddin Owaisi

HYDERABAD: AIMIM floor leader in assembly, Akbaruddin Owaisi , on Wednesday said that minorities in Old City have been given a raw deal in terms of Metro connectivity. He said though he proposed re alignment on Old City route, the extension of Metro was delayed pending environmental clearances as it runs over Musi river.

Speaking in the assembly, he said, “In Chaderghat, Metro passes over the Musi, but there is no problem. However, when it comes to Old City, there is a problem, and every excuse is given. Is it not injustice? I am the one who had argued and fought for Metro rail, and I don’t get Metro in my area,” he said.

He said in 1999, when he was elected to the house for the first time, he had spoken about Metro rail. “The then CM, YS Rajasekhara Reddy, agreed to take a team of MLAs to Delhi to study the Metro. But P Janardhan Reddy, the then Khairatabad MLA, used to talk about mono rail,” he said.

Expressing concern that AIMIM is being singled out for non-clearance of Metro rail second phase, he said, “CM KCR also said that I have proposed the realignment. Yes, I have in view of many religious structures there. But they say alignment could not get clearance because of Musi. The second phase of Metro covering Old City has been promised, but actual work has not begun since many years.”

MA&UD minister KT Rama Rao said there are 96 religious structure in the proposed Metro route of Old City.

Owaisi also asked the government to allot Rs 2,000 crore for Old City from the proposed Rs 10,000 crore for the Hyderabad Urban Agglomeration. “Every year, Rs 10,000 crore will be given to Hyderabad, give Rs 2,000 crore for Old City,” he said.

“The government should spell out details of Rs 10,000 crore allotment, and conduct meeting with all elected representatives of GHMC area,” he said. He also expressed concern about pending dues of more than Rs 1,000 crore to water board. “Many government departments have not released dues for it, and government has not given any power fee waiver as promised,” he said.

Title: Delhi: Friends kill 26-year-old after argument
Content:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: A 26-year-old man was killed in Neb Sarai by two of his friends who later had unnatural sex with his body. The accused were arrested from Bihar on Thursday after a cat and mouse chase. The police teams travelled by road, rail and air to catch the accused men, who kept on changing their locations.

Atul Kumar Thakur, deputy commissioner of police, South, said: “The accused have been identified as Birender Kumar Jha and Gautam Kumar Choudhary. Both the victim and the accused worked as labourers in the same area.”

The murder was reported on Tuesday night. “The deceased had gone to the accused’s house to meet them, and had informed his sister about it. The next day, the sister dialled police at 6am and informed them about two people trying to move the body of her brother,” said a police officer.

A case of murder was later registered. A team led by Sudhanshu Dhama, ACP, Sangam Vihar was tasked to crack the case. The cyber cell was roped in and two teams of police started tracking the location of the accused.

The location of the accused was found to be near Anand Vihar in Ghaziabad. Subsequently began the cat and mouse chase between the cops and the accused. As a police team tried to trail them by road, the location of the accused changed. Another team of cops then took a train to catch the accused.

One of the accused, Gautam, meanwhile switched on his phone in the middle of their journey, which gave the cops a hint that they were heading towards Patna. Realising that they need to reach Patna before them, the cops then took a flight and reached Varanasi. From there they travelled by road and reached the Patna railway station where the accused were taken into custody.

The arrested men told the police that they were drinking together on the night of Holi. A minor argument erupted between them after which the accused strangled him with their hands.

Title: Don’t hold iftar parties: Owaisi
Content: Akbaruddin Owaisi said that government, instead of hosting ‘iftar’ parties for minorities, should bring about awareness on schemes for them. Asara pension does not have percentage of Muslims according to their population. “Muslims studying in higher educational institutes must get Rs 2 lakh incentive,” he said. TNN

Title: Anti-CAA stir called off temporarily
Content:
Coimbatore: The marathon anti–CAA stir organised by Muslim outfits at Athupalam has been called off, albeit temporarily in the wake of simmering tension in the city on Thursday.

The protesters said they are suspending the protest for five days in a bid to diffuse the growing tension in the city. The protesters have dispersed from the makeshift shed at Athupalam Junction. They have been asked not to congregate at the place till next announcement from the Muslim outfit leaders.

The protest commenced on February 19 opposing Citizenship Amendment Act and demanding the state government to pass a resolution against CAA in the assembly. Large number of men and women from Ukkadam, Podanur, Karumbukkadai, Sundarapuram and Athupalam locality were congregating at the protest site everyday where speakers from various political outfits would visit and deliver speeches. A young couple also got their wedding solemnized in the protest site to express solidarity with the protesters.

On Tuesday, the Muslim outfit leaders were summoned by district collector K Rajamani and were asked to withdraw all their protests for a week to bring back normalcy in the city. The outfit functionaries agreed to drop all their protest plans but said they would not give up the anti–CAA protests. However, in the wake of raising tensions, they decided to drop the anti–CAA protests.

Title: IIT-Kanpur cancels mega fest Techkriti due to coronavirus scare
Content: KANPUR: The annual technical and entrepreneurial festival of IIT-Kanpur, Techkriti-2020 has been cancelled in view of coronavirus scare , informed the media cell of the institute on Thursday.Though there is no confirmed case of Coronavirus in the city but since Techkriti witnesses a huge footfall of students and visitors from across the country as well as abroad, the IIT-Kanpur administration, on Thursday evening, decided to cancel the mega event which was to start from March 19.Techkriti is one of the largest technical festivals held in engineering and management institutes of the country. The fest witnesses participation of students from all IITs and top colleges of the country. During the fest a number of events including competitions like Model United Nations, Tech Summit, Entrepreneurial Conclave, Technocruise are held every year awarding goodies and prize money to the winners. Besides, workshops and talks by eminent speakers remians an attraction. Prominent artistes also visit the institute for performnaces during the cultural evenings. The website of Techkriti had been made live and all preparations were in place.The cancellation of the fest has come as a setback for the students who had been preparing for the fest for past many months. A student told TOI that it takes an entire year to prepare for the grand event and its cancellation at the last moment is very disheartning. The cancellation was also a setback to the sponsors of the fest, he added.Meanwhile, precautionary measures have been also put in place on the campus for protection against coronavirus spread without disturbing the academic atmosphere. The institute has also made the attendance of all postgraduate students optional till April 15. The residents of IIT-Kanpur have also been advised to avoid international travel till April 15 and all outreach activities on the campus have also been suspended until April 15.The institute stated that it is in constant touch with the district epidemiologist as well as the health department about the situation regarding Covid-19.

Title: Centre gave Rs 1,200 crore VGF for Hyderabad metro: KT Rama Rao
Content:
HYDERABAD: Municipal Administration and Urban Development (MA&UD) minister KT Rama Rao on Wednesday informed the state assembly that the Union government has so far provided Rs 1,200 crore Viability Gap Funding (VGF) for the Hyderabad Metro rail .

Replying to a question on Hyderabad Metro rail during the question hour, KTR said the world’s biggest Metro rail project in Public Private Partnership (PPP) mode costs Rs 14,000 crore and the Centre’s share as VAF was Rs 1,450 crore, so another Rs 250 crore is yet to be released.

Stating that Metro rail project has been successful and about four lakh passengers travel in the Metro daily, KTR said that works for the second phase of the project will begin soon.

He said that tenders have been issued for 20 multi-level car parking facilities. “Presently, at all Metro stations combined, there is facility of parking 20,000 two-wheelers. We have also asked the Metro rail authorities to consider giving train passes to passengers,” KTR said.

Title: Police to aid in tracing foreign arrivals
Content: Thiruvananthapuram: The state police chief has directed all district police chiefs to provide all help to the health department in tracing people who have come from abroad in the wake of Covid-19 scare.Intelligence ADGP will collect the details of the passengers who are arriving at Thiruvananthapuram, Nedumbassery, Kannur and Kozhikode airports. The details of the passengers will be collected from the foreigners’ regional registration officer.
